question: What specific functional, data, integration, security, testing, deployment, maintenance, and training requirements does the RFP specify for enhancing and adding the 복수의결권주식, 스톡옵션, and 성과조건부주식교부 modules to the 벤처확인종합관리시스템?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional requirements: 1.1 Build reporting and 신고 workflows for 복수의결권주식 (발행·변경 보고, 발행고시/변경고시, 허위·거짓발행 신고 및 조사) and for 스톡옵션/성과조건부주식 (부여신고, 취소·철회 신고, 신고 결과 처리). 1.2 Provide both 대민 (public) menus and 내부 BackOffice menus: public-side items (제도안내, 신청방법, 부여신고/발행보고, 신고 결과, 취소·철회 결과, 중기부 배정 현황, 통계) and BackOffice items (신고 리스트/완료/보류/취소, 출력·발송, 이상관제, 허위신고 접수·조사, 통계(교차상세), 제출서류 자료실). 1.3 Support stepwise processing: 조회(비상장 벤처기업) → 신고/보고 → 접수(보완) → 공시/고시 and maintain One-Stop service for application receipt and result notifications. 1.4 Provide separate supervisory/감독기관 systems (전용 시스템 for 복수의결권 and 스톡옵션) and role-based functions for 본부 and 13개 지방청 (관리 기능). 1.5 Provide statistical functions (복수의결권 통계, 스톡옵션 통계, 벤처확인 연계 통계, 교차상세 통계). 1.6 Implement data outputs/features such as 신고증/변경신고증 출력 및 발송. 2) Data and migration requirements: 2.1 Perform 스톡옵션 과거 데이터 정제 및 적재(데이터 이관) from 기존 시스템(such as 중소벤처24 transfer of 신청 기능). 2.2 Conduct data analysis to produce 통계자료 and to investigate 연계정보 현황 by 벤처기업유형, 업종, 지역, 매출, 거래소상장 여부, etc., and use 벤처확인유형별 입수 정보를 to enable 신고 간소화. 2.3 Submit impact analysis (영향도 분석) for system integration and data linkage. 3) Integration and interfaces: 3.1 Link 복수의결권 and 스톡옵션 features to existing 벤처확인 이력정보 and 신고자(벤처기업) information. 3.2 Provide API 연계 with 타 기관 to confirm external information. 3.3 Analyze and plan 회원연계 (중소벤처24) and other 기관 연계 for simplification of 신고. 3.4 Address TA/인프라 구성 considerations and identify use of 상용SW and related license risks. 4) Security, access control, and operational controls: 4.1 Apply an 정보보안 솔루션 and analyze applicability. 4.2 For BackOffice and 감독기관 systems, implement 접근제어 솔루션 for 외부 접속 and analyze 공동인증서 로그인 usage and propose improvements; preserve 로그인 기록. 4.3 Include 이상관제 기능 in BackOffice to detect anomalies and handle 허위신고 접수/조사. 5) Non‑functional / risk & analysis requirements: 5.1 Perform 시스템 Risk-Point 해결/개선 via interviews with 중소벤처기업부 and 13개 지방청. 5.2 Conduct TA 분석 and Risk 분석 (ex. 라이선스 이슈) for reuse of 상용SW and infra. 6) Testing, delivery, and deployment requirements: 6.1 Complete 요구분석 및 설계, with at least one 중간보고 after requirements/ design completion and a 완료보고 upon finish. 6.2 Execute testing including 단위, 통합 테스트 and 검사·검수·테스트 phases prior to open. 6.3 Deliver staged opens (at minimum a 1차 오픈 for 복수의결권 and a 2차 GrandOpen for 스톡옵션/성과조건부주식) within the contract timeline. 6.4 Provide weekly progress reports to 벤처기업확인기관 during implementation. 7) Training, documentation, and stabilization: 7.1 Provide 사용자 교육 최소 2회 이상 and prepare 사용자 매뉴얼 and 업무용 매뉴얼. 7.2 Maintain operational stabilization with at least 1개월 이상의 안정화 운영인력 상주 after system open. 7.3 Provide 중간보고 및 완료보고 to 중소벤처기업부 and 벤처기업확인기관. 8) Project management and pre‑implementation activities: 8.1 Conduct 충분한 인터뷰(구축 인터뷰) with stakeholders to derive 사전 기능 요구사항 and submit 분석·기획 보고서. 8.2 Produce 스톡옵션 데이터분석 결과 and 수요조사 for 타 기관 연계 정보 현황. 8.3 Perform 기획 including 제도 정의, 간편 신청 flows, 사용자 알림, 운영 모니터링, and 통계 기획. 9) Contract/timeline constraint: 9.1 The contractor must complete the work within the defined contract period (contract일로부터 150일) and meet the mandated phased opens (복수의결권 1차 오픈 requirement).

question: What are the comprehensive functional and non-functional requirements and deliverables specified in the RFP for the BIFF & ACFM online services redevelopment and 행사지원시스템 (event support systems), covering web and mobile sites, integrations, event systems supply, analytics, helpdesk, deployment/training, staffing, and maintenance?
ground_truth: The requirements and deliverables include: 1) Web UX/UI and standards: apply web standards, web accessibility, and user‑centered UI improvements; produce an annual, distinctive design/UI for each year to enhance brand value; ensure family sites (*.biff.kr subdomains) share a unified "family look" and consistent composition. 2) Responsive multi‑device delivery: build responsive web pages so identical content is provided across diverse devices. 3) Official sites & family sites redevelopment and maintenance: full redevelopment and ongoing maintenance for BIFF and ACFM official and family/special sites (including upper‑ and lower‑year site cycles: 상반기/하반기 changes, special e‑market sites). 4) Mobile apps: supply and/or redevelop official mobile applications (Android and iOS, one instance each) for BIFF and ACFM; provide mobile app or mobile web versions of certain event systems where requested. 5) Administrator interfaces: redevelop and maintain administrator pages (boards, menu builders, CMS, Artboard, etc.) and provide manager‑centric improvements for databases (e.g., for ACFM sales/buyer data). 6) Integrated data linkage: integrate with the 통합업무관리시스템 to provide server‑linked pages that reflect input/changes in real time across menus. 7) External system integration: integrate various external ASP/systems such as ticketing, recruitment (채용), payment, badges, booths, promo codes, and other requested APIs. 8) Registration & submission systems: develop/maintain web-based submission and participant registration pages for BIFF (seasonal open periods) and ACFM (online/offline registrations), including online/offline registration linkage. 9) E‑market and online meeting/support: supply an ACFM e‑market platform (festival site), online meeting/화상미팅 platform, and enhance meeting scheduling/timezone/project linkage for convenience. 10) Online screening & CDN: supply online screening systems (video library, 심사 system), provide cloud CDN with unlimited traffic for screening video content, and ensure integration with the integrated work management system for real‑time screening info. 11) Streaming, VOD, and real‑time chat: supply live streaming and VOD capabilities and real‑time chat services (for community BIFF and event support). 12) Event support systems supply: supply and educate on event systems including access control (출입관리) mobile apps (iOS, Android each 1 set), protocol/의전 system (mobile web or app for admin and users), red carpet system (input forms, output forms, server, onsite deployment), and 커뮤니티비프 행사지원시스템 (streaming, VOD, chat). 13) Onsite/server components & operations: provide necessary servers and onsite deployment/operation support for event systems (e.g., red carpet, video library, access control). 14) Helpdesk: supply and operate an online helpdesk with status checks (전체, 접수, 진행, 완료), file attachment capability, to process departmental IT requests (planning, development, design) efficiently. 15) Analytics & statistics: integrate tracking (Analytics or equivalent) to provide usage statistics (user counts, event counts, pageviews) and other access/analysis data. 16) Content production: produce newsletters and various media content and create pages for annually produced content. 17) Scalability & extensibility: design for extensibility by enabling integration with external solutions (채용, 티켓, CDN, screening services) to expand website capabilities and administrator/user convenience. 18) Staffing & dispatch: provide dispatched personnel—web developers and web designers for BIFF (web developer 1, web designer 1), web developer(s) for ACFM (PM‑level 1), plus additional web designer/developer dispatch listed elsewhere (overall stated counts: web designers and developers for specified periods). 19) Festival‑period support: during festival peak periods, dispatch specialized personnel to produce pages/content and to rapidly and stably resolve variables arising near the festival. 20) Supply, training, and education: for supplied event systems, provide supply plus 교육 (training) and operational support; relevant items are listed as "공급 및 교육" or "공급 / 재개발 / 유지보수" depending on component. 21) Maintenance & operation: provide redevelopment, ongoing maintenance, and operation services across websites, apps, administrator pages, and supplied systems (explicitly noted: 신규/재개발/유지보수 and 공급/재개발/유지보수). 22) Operational features & user functions: for ACFM mypage and login‑based features, implement upload/manage functions, permission/role settings, and other user convenience enhancements. 23) Delivery obligations and scope types: the contract covers a mix of supply, redevelopment, maintenance, and dispatched labor (용역파견), with explicit deliverables per listed categories (websites, apps, screening, streaming, helpdesk, access control, protocol, red carpet, community support). 24) Non‑functional expectations implied: ensure accessibility, reliability during high traffic (with CDN), real‑time data synchronization with integrated systems, and administrative efficiency through improved manager interfaces. 25) Note on schedule and changes: all listed development, supply, and operation items are to follow the project timeline but the 과업 내용 및 추진 일정 may change (i.e., subject to modification).

question: What functional, non-functional, data/output, security, infrastructure, and operational/support requirements does the RFP specify for the KUSF 체육특기자 경기기록 관리시스템 (i.e., summarize the full scope of system requirements and expected post-delivery support)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional requirements: (a) Provide tournament/match game-record input pages for team sports, with initial priority on basketball and planned extensibility to volleyball, baseball, and soccer; (b) Support user roles including student-athlete, university, and sport-federation accounts; (c) Implement KUSF institutional pages (institution introduction, member universities, major projects); (d) Implement verified administrator signup and access methods and provide ID/PW creation and retrieval (find) functions; (e) Provide verified/validated personal membership signup procedures when individuals register after institution/university IDs are created; (f) Minimize repetitive data entry by building inter-system linkage and auto-fill/automatic input features; (g) Provide data export and reporting capability—analyzed data must be saveable in MS Office formats for report creation; (h) Provide intuitive, modern (current trend) user interface design focused on user and administrator operational convenience; (i) Produce user and system-administrator operation/use manuals (separate) and online promotional materials (logo, banner) for distribution. 2) Data & scoring/output requirements: (a) Store and manage game-record data required to calculate the KUSF individual performance evaluation indicators; (b) Provide composite indicators by grade and by competition as a principle; (c) Provide composite indicators as percentile and transformed score (50 ± 10); (d) Support universities applying custom weights to composite indicators to compute individual converted performance scores; (e) Maintain a DB for integrated management of game records and statistical/analysis functions for internal (KUSF) use. 3) Security & privacy requirements: (a) Support personal data management and information security for service-personal-information; (b) Present information-disclosure scope and personal-information usage guidance at member signup; (c) Ensure verified and secure administrative access and account creation processes. 4) Non-functional / system design requirements: (a) System architecture/design must be extensible and flexible to accommodate future functional expansions; (b) Apply latest technologies that are proven for performance and operation; (c) Ensure user/admin usability and operational convenience; (d) The indicator data structure was to follow the same structure as the national college entrance exam to facilitate university understanding/applicability (i.e., consistent score-structure design). 5) Infrastructure, performance, and operations requirements: (a) Build service infrastructure for system operation and management; (b) Provide service infrastructure environment management, error monitoring and correction, and system operation technical support; (c) Implement DB integrated management and statistics/analysis functionality; (d) Include MS-Office export for analyzed data to support report generation. 6) Quality assurance, testing, and delivery requirements: (a) Conduct active and sufficient testing to ensure stable service; (b) Propose and supply a detailed schedule of tasks per sub-work to complete within the contract period; (c) Propose project personnel who are immediately deployable for the work. 7) Procurement/technology & compliance expectations: (a) Use technologies able to satisfy changing business requirements (expandable/flexible); (b) Use modern, validated technologies whose performance and functionality are proven in operation; (c) The RFP’s stated requirements are major items that can be adjusted by business-level consultation (i.e., subject to negotiation during implementation). 8) Deliverables and documentation: (a) Deliver system, DB, operational manuals (user and admin), statistical/report outputs (MS Office), and online promotional assets; (b) Provide ongoing operational & technical support for the system as part of service operations (monitoring, fixes, technical support).

question: 통합 정보시스템 구축 사전컨설팅의 컨설팅 요구사항(CNR-001 ~ CNR-006)에 따라 제안서에 반드시 포함되어야 하는 주요 과업 범위와 각 과업별 세부활동 및 산출물을 항목별로 자세히 정리하라. (환경·현황분석, 이용자 조사, 데이터 분석·설계, 벤치마킹, 비전·전략 수립, 서비스(안) 개발, 유지보수 산출물 등)
ground_truth:
컨설팅 요구사항별 주요 과업 범위와 세부활동·산출물은 다음과 같다.

1) CNR-001 환경 및 현황분석
  - 주요활동:
    1. 내·외부 환경 분석: 미술진흥법 등 관련 법령, 정부정책, 제도 분석을 통한 사업 영향 요인 및 요구사항 도출
    2. 최신 정보기술 및 적용 기술 사례 분석: 통합정보시스템 구축과 연관된 기술 사례 조사
    3. 현행 한국미술시장정보시스템 운영현황 분석 및 개선과제 도출
    4. 관계자·일반인 등 대상 정보수요조사 수행
  - 산출물:
    - 법·제도 및 정책 영향분석 보고서
    - 현행 시스템 운영현황 분석서(운영구조, 기능, 문제점 포함)
    - 정보수요조사 결과 보고서(관계자·일반인 대상)
    - 개선과제 목록 및 우선순위

2) CNR-002 통합미술정보시스템 구축 데이터 분석 및 설계
  - 주요활동:
    1. 데이터 수요조사: 기존 이용자 및 잠재이용자가 요구하는 데이터 유형 조사
    2. 수집 데이터 분석: 미술 유통업 정보, 작가·작품 정보(저작권·추급권 관리) 등 수집 가능 데이터의 유형·형태 분석
    3. 데이터 수집 방법·기술·특징 정리: 수집방법, 예상 용량, 수집시기, 비용 등 제시
    4. 데이터 분류 및 결합 표준화 전략 수립
  - 산출물:
    - 데이터 수요조사 보고서
    - 수집 가능한 데이터 목록(유형·형태별)
    - 데이터 수집·구축 계획서(수집기술, 구축방법, 예상용량, 수집시기, 비용 등)
    - 데이터 표준화 및 연계 방안 문서
  - 예시로 문서에 제시된 데이터 유형·수집기술 매핑(예시표):
    - 정형데이터: RDB → RDB Aggregator → 관계형 DB 수집 후 HDFS/HBase 등 NoSQL 저장 (RDB, 스프레드시트 등)
    - 반정형 데이터(HTML): Crawling → 웹 문서 수집 (HTML, JSON 등)
    - 반정형 데이터(XML/RSS): RSS 등 → 최신정보 수집 (HTML, JSON 등)
    - 비정형 데이터(File): FTP 등 → 문서·이미지·비디오 등 수집

3) CNR-003 통합정보시스템 벤치마킹 사례 조사
  - 주요활동:
    1. 국내외 분야별 통합정보시스템 운영 사례 조사 및 분석(각 5개 이상)
    2. 벤치마킹 대상 선정 시 현황분석으로 도출된 문제점·개선사항 반영
    3. 시스템 구축 배경·목적, 정책·법제 적용, 사용 기술, 관리체계, 데이터 제공 및 서비스 운영 방법 등 분석
    4. 센터에서 지정한 조사시스템 및 인터뷰 담당자 일부 포함 가능
    5. 특성별 비교표 작성 및 분석(공통서비스, 차별화서비스, 주요 운영전략 등 도출)
  - 산출물:
    - 벤치마킹 대상 목록(국내외 각 5개 이상)
    - 사례별 분석 보고서(배경·목적·기술·정책·관리체계·서비스 등)
    - 특성 비교표 및 분석문서(공통/차별화 서비스, 운영전략 등)
    - 현행 시스템과 비교하여 도출한 문제점 및 개선권고안

4) CNR-004 비전 및 전략 수립
  - 주요활동:
    1. 이용자 중심의 통합미술정보시스템 비전 및 전략 수립
    2. 핵심 서비스 기반의 목표·단계별 실행전략 및 서비스 전략 수립
    3. 예상 문제점 도출 및 개선방향 제시
  - 산출물:
    - 통합미술정보시스템 비전·목표 문서
    - 단계별 실행계획 및 서비스 전략서
    - 예상 문제점 및 개선방향 보고서

5) CNR-005 통합미술정보시스템 서비스(안) 개발
  - 주요활동:
    1. 서비스 수요조사: 설문조사, 심층인터뷰(In-depth Interview), FGI 등; 이용자 그룹별 표본수·인터뷰 대상수는 센터가 지정 가능
    2. 1차 서비스(안) 도출: 환경·현황조사, 벤치마킹, 데이터분석 기반 제공 가능 서비스 도출
    3. 서비스안 상세기술: 서비스명, 서비스형태, 사용데이터, 데이터활용방법, 목표대상, 필요정보, 구현가능성, 예상문제점 및 해결방안, 제안배경 등 제시
    4. 샘플 이미지 또는 테스트 프로그램 제작(수요조사용)
    5. 이용자별 서비스 선호도 조사 및 분석: 1차 서비스(안)에 대한 이용자 유형별 선호도 및 수요특성 분석
    6. 이용자별 핵심서비스 도출: 서비스 정의서 및 비교표 작성, 서비스별 문제점 및 개선방향 설정
  - 산출물:
    - 서비스 수요조사 보고서(설문·심층인터뷰·FGI 결과)
    - 1차 서비스(안) 목록(차 서비스안은 문서상 "최소 개 이상" 제시 요구 포함)
    - 각 서비스별 상세 제안서(서비스명·형태·활용데이터·구현가능성·문제점·해결방안·제안배경 등)
    - 수요조사용 샘플 이미지/테스트 프로그램
    - 이용자별 선호도 분석보고서 및 핵심서비스 도출문서
    - 서비스 비교표 및 서비스 정의서

6) CNR-006 유지보수 산출물(공통사항)
  - 주요활동/산출물(문서에 명시된 항목은 제목으로 제시됨):
    - 유지보수 관련 공통 산출물 제출(구체 항목은 과업 수행 시 제시·작성)

7) 프로젝트관리·보고 관련(문서 전반에서 요구되는 공통사항)
  - 관련요구사항(PMR) 연결항목:
    - PMR-001: 프로젝트관리 방법론 준용 등 사업관리 요건 준수
    - PMR-002: 산출물 작성 및 제출(착수보고, 중간보고, 결과보고 포함)
    - PMR-003: 일정관리
    - PMR-004: 변경관리
    - PMR-005: 위험관리
    - PMR-006: 용역 관리에 대한 상시 관리·감독
  - 산출물:
    - 착수보고서, 중간보고서, 결과보고서
    - 일정관리·변경관리·위험관리 관련 문서

8) 기타 요구사항 및 제시형식 관련 유의사항
  - 벤치마킹 대상은 국내외 시스템 각각 5개 이상 조사
  - 데이터 유형 및 수집방법 예시표(정형·반정형·비정형 등) 제시 및 과업 진행 중 수정 가능
  - 서비스안은 내부 사용자·관리자·외부 이해관계자·일반인 등 대상별로 개발하되 외부 시스템 전문가의 검증을 필수로 거쳐 구현 가능성 검증 필요
  - 상기 모든 산출물은 과업 추진 상황에 따라 세부내용·일정이 변경될 수 있으며, 세부 추진일정은 협의 후 결정됨

question: Summarize the required functional modules, interface/integration behaviors, operational/testing tasks, reporting/export needs, and on-site operation & maintenance/training requirements for the 2025 Gumi Asian Athletics Championships Comprehensive Information System and linked homepage. Include details about data flows to/from measurement devices, scoreboards, broadcast systems, Start Lists, registration/cards, access control, and disaster/edge-case handling required by the RFP.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Core S/W modules to be developed: 1.1) 대회 기본자료 관리 시스템 (Competition basic-data management): - Player/participant registration (Entry-level basic personal info, historical records). - Registration of organizing committee staff, referees, officials. - Registration card (AD Card) issuance and re-issuance, including printing support for final lists and on-demand reprints. - Photo handling: on-site photo capture and insertion, passport-photo scanning and insertion, support for players without pre-submitted photos. - Card anti-counterfeit measures: sealing and hologram stickers; color-coding by category/access; include holder photo. - Card types: regular (player, coach), upgrade (officials, referees, organizers), daily temporary (press, broadcast, volunteers, ops). - Report generation and export (PDF, Excel) including country registration and card issuance status. - System management: user basic info, access-right management, differentiated screens by role, code management, notices/posts. 1.2) 경기 운영 시스템 (Competition operation system): - Event scheduling/registration: detailed event date/time entry, athlete entries per event, referee/official assignment, event numbers (Event No), max participants per heat, event start times. - Seeding / heat composition (조 편성): import participant entry forms (English) 1–2 days prior, auto-generate Start Lists and auto-assign heats based on rules; support manual seeding/movements and special-case manual overrides. - Competition execution: provide per-discipline specialized input screens; online real-time result input. - Data input modes: track events — automatic real-time input from timing/measurement devices (계측기); field events — manual input from result sheets/other devices (real-time). - Result processing & distribution: validate records per event, ranking and advancement (automatic/manual) for heats to next rounds; assign final start order (auto/manual); medal confirmation and aggregation, transfer medal data to interface subsystem; manage records (world/Asia/etc.) data. - Real-time outputs: after results processed, output to scoreboard and broadcast output screens. 1.3) 인터페이스 관리 시스템 (Interface management): - T&S (Timing & Scoring) integration: real-time, bidirectional data exchange with competition operation system, complying with Asian Athletics regulations to ensure accuracy and reliability. - Scoreboard integration: parse information from competition system and filming equipment via 판독실 and send in real-time to stadium displays; support mixer to display timer, scoreboard, and live venue camera outputs simultaneously. - Broadcast equipment integration: real-time linkage with host-broadcaster equipment; allow broadcast equipment to display competition system/scoreboard content (participant names, results) and enable website real-time feed for broadcast. - Homepage integration: share the same database with competition operation system so field-entered results are immediately visible on the website; provide Official Result and Summary PDFs and Start List files for download. - Data items to be sent to website: full/dated schedules (overall, by date, by event, by athlete), medal information (country/player medal tallies), Start Lists, official results. 1.4) 보고서 관리 시스템 (Report management): - Generate and output reports: participants, referees/officials, Start Lists, results, medal status, record status; exportable to PDF/Excel. 2) Real-time and data-flow behaviors: - Real-time ingestion of timing device outputs for track events and immediate display on website, scoreboard, and broadcast systems. - Field events use manual/alternative input devices but must support real-time online input and downstream distribution. - All processed competition info must be routed to report management and interface management for distribution to external systems (scoreboard, broadcast, homepage). 3) Integration and compliance constraints: - Must comply with Asian Athletics (AA) rules/regulations regarding timing/record accuracy. - Multi-system bidirectional interfaces (competition system <-> timing devices, scoreboard, broadcast, homepage) with reliable, low-latency data exchange. - Provide PDF/Official Result and Start List file generation for distribution. 4) Operational, testing, and edge-case requirements: - Conduct rehearsal test(s) with a pre-competition athletics event prior to the 2025 Games. - Test internal/external system integrations (timing devices, scoreboards, homepage, broadcast). - Test response capability to emergency/unexpected scenarios (정보통신망 장애 — network outage; 정전 — power outage; etc.). - Provide operation manuals or guidelines and training for system operators. 5) On-site operations, staffing, and maintenance: - Provide information-facility construction at venues as needed for system operation (network/infrastructure within stadium and related facilities). - Supply an on-site IT operations team stationed at the venue starting 4 days before the competition until competition end. - Assign operating personnel by competition/ non-competition areas. - Provide system operation (pre-registration, competition progress tracking, result printing) during the event period. - Provide maintenance support up to and through competition conclusion (유지보수: until end of competition). 6) Homepage-specific requirements: - Main/menu structure and contents per RFP (main, news, schedule/results, medal ranking, athletics events, community sections). - Real-time sharing of competition DB to display Start Lists, Official Results, Summary, medal rankings, athlete-specific schedules and results; provide PDF downloads. 7) Data management, security and access control: - Role-based access control and differentiated UI per access level. - Manage system codes and system user info centrally. - Ensure registration card issuance and access control via color codes and access permissions; prevent card forgery using sealing and holograms. 8) Development & delivery lifecycle expectations (high-level): - Requirements analysis and detailed design for comprehensive system (business requirements: basic data, competition operations, interfaces, reports). - Produce detailed implementation schedule aligned with project milestones. - Development, unit testing, initial data setup and verification, integration testing, and final deployment including homepage analysis/design, development, testing, pilot operation and service launch.

question: Summarize the contractual, project-management and compliance requirements and constraints imposed on the contractor by this RFP, covering fair-trade commitments, subcontracting rules, development location policy, handling of schedule extensions and delays, payment requirements, limits on liability and penalties, use of a task-review committee, and the complaint/whistleblower procedures.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Fair procurement and compensation: KHIDI will define clear and detailed requirements to calculate appropriate project cost and duration and will pay appropriate compensation according to procedures (explicit commitment to fair, transparent costing and payment). 2) Project-period and change management: KHIDI will secure an appropriate project execution period; if project content changes occur, changes will be handled through mutual consultation and via the 과업심의위원회 (task-review committee); the RFP explicitly notes that 과업내용 확정 심의 여부 및 과업변경 요청 가능 is specified (see p36). 3) Remote development preference: KHIDI will prioritize consideration of remote (off‑site) development suitable to information projects (원격지 개발을 우선적으로 검토). 4) Extensions and additional work: If delays or extensions occur for reasons not the contractor’s responsibility, and additional work is required, KHIDI and the contractor will sufficiently negotiate conditions and costs before proceeding. 5) Administrative burdens: KHIDI will not require the contractor to bear responsibilities or costs arising from KHIDI’s administrative procedures, complaint resolution, or environmental management that KHIDI should bear. 6) Liability and warranty limits: KHIDI will not unduly reduce its own liability nor excessively increase contractor liability (including damages and defect-liability) beyond statutory or reasonable levels. 7) Delay penalties: KHIDI will not impose delay damages at levels exceeding those prescribed by national or local contract statutes (지체상금 수준을 국가계약·지방계약법령 등에서 정한 수준 이상으로 부과하지 않음). 8) Subcontracting law compliance: If performing work via subcontract, the contractor must comply with the 하도급법; KHIDI may consider 하도급법 violations by the contractor when selecting vendors in future processes. 9) Prohibited/unfair subcontracting practices: The RFP enumerates types of unfair acts under 하도급법, including failure to issue contracts to subcontractors, failure to pay subcontractor amounts within statutory periods, failure to adjust sub‑payments proportionally when KHIDI adjusts the prime contract payment, imposing unfair transaction conditions (special terms), unjust determination or reduction of subpayment, unfair cancellation of orders, unfair returns, improper demands for technical data, unauthorized use of technical data, managerial interference, and retaliatory acts. 10) Subcontractor payment mechanism: To prevent nonpayment of subcontract amounts or wages, the contractor must directly pay subcontractor amounts/labor costs or use a direct‑payment system that creates equivalent payment effects (e.g., 하도급 지키미). 11) Complaint / whistleblower system: KHIDI operates an online report center and an anonymous reporting system (레드휘슬) for grievances or unfair treatment by KHIDI staff; report targets include unfair treatment, abuse of position, law violations for private gain, and other company suggestions or corrective needs. 12) Reporting process and privacy: Reports are submitted via KHIDI’s main website (www.khidi.or.kr) or KHIDI Helpline (www.redwhistle.org) and are handled confidentially; personal data of reporters will not be disclosed and false/unclear reporter information may cause non‑acceptance; personal data are protected under 개인정보보호법 제3조 (privacy principle) and will not be used for purposes other than complaint handling.

question: What specific responsibilities, activities and required deliverables must the PMC produce for each main project component: (a) the national (parliament) broadcasting system, (b) the regional council linkage infrastructure, (c) training and public-awareness (capacity building), and (d) project management & performance management?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) National (parliament) broadcasting system (Output 1.1): a) Responsibilities/Activities: select and support equipment procurement vendors (Activity 1.1.1) including support for PC (Project Contractor) selection and equipment installation work; develop the citizen-facing parliamentary broadcast application systems (Activity 1.1.2) including upper/lower house broadcast relay system and public legislative information service; support local procurement and remodeling works necessary for broadcast infrastructure (Activity 1.1.3) including local bidding and remodeling support. b) Required deliverables/outputs: PC 제안요청서; 기자재 세부 사양서; 기자재 구성도; 기자재 설치를 위한 최종 점검 결과 보고서; 개발계획서; 시스템 설계서; 테스트 결과서; 개발 완료보고서; 운영 매뉴얼; 상용 S/W 조달계획서; 상용 S/W 국내검수 결과서; 상용 S/W 설치 결과서; 상용 S/W 운영 매뉴얼; 상용 S/W 교육 결과서; 감리결과 시정조치 결과보고서; 설계 요구사항 정의서; 사업수행평가서; 공사검토보고서; 현장결과보고서. 2) Regional council linkage infrastructure (Output 2.1): a) Responsibilities/Activities: select and support procurement vendors for equipment to build electronic meeting linkage between the Senate and regional councils (Activity 2.1.1); support local bidding and remodeling for regional council meeting room remodeling and installation (Activity 2.1.2). b) Required deliverables/outputs: PC 제안요청서; 기자재 세부 사양서; 기자재 설치를 위한 최종 점검 결과 보고서; 설계 요구사항 정의서; 사업수행평가서; 공사검토보고서; 현장결과보고서. 3) Training and public-awareness (Output 3.1): a) Responsibilities/Activities: organize and conduct invited (overseas) training, in-country training, and public-awareness (citizen outreach) activities (Activities 3.1.1–3.1.3). b) Required deliverables/outputs: 초청연수 계획서; 초청연수 결과보고서; 현지연수 계획서; 현지연수 결과보고서; 대국민 인지제고 계획서 (홍보방안 포함); 대국민 인지제고 결과보고서 (홍보방안 포함). 4) Project management and performance management: a) Responsibilities/Activities: overall project management including quality, communications and risk management, and performance management/monitoring & evaluation. b) Required deliverables/outputs: 사업 수행계획서(국문); 사업 착수보고서(국/영문); 분기별 활동결과 보고서(국문); 중간보고서(국/영문); 연차점검보고서(국문); 최종보고서(국/영문); 전문가 파견계획서(국/영문); 전문가 파견결과보고서; 사후관리계획서(국/영문); 성과관리계획서(국/영문); 기초선 조사보고서(국/영문); 종료선 결과보고서(국/영문); 성과관리 결과보고서(국/영문). 5) Cross-cutting scope items (required of the PMC across components): support PC/vendor selection and operations, support system integration of hardware and application software (including coordination for supply of commercial software), support for infrastructure remodeling design requirements and local bidding, produce management and monitoring documentation, and provide expert dispatch planning and reporting as part of implementation and aftercare.

question: What specific information-security, remote-development, and data-handling requirements must the contractor comply with during the development, testing, remote maintenance, and after project completion for the HoGye Sports Center reservation system (covering access control, logging, certifications, secure coding, audits, personnel, artifact handling, and liability)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Apply secure coding and personal-data protection measures — implement 시큐어 코딩 for member-management and personal data handling to comply with the strengthened Personal Information Protection law. 2) Follow government system guidelines and software-development security — build the system in accordance with the '행정기관 및 공공기관 정보시스템 구축 운영 지침' (considering integrity, consistency, confidentiality, availability) and apply '소프트웨어 개발보안' per the cited clauses (제 50 조 ~ 제 53 조). 3) Regular security checks and security education — perform periodic security inspections and provide security training for technical staff involved in the project. 4) Personnel control and approval — project personnel cannot be arbitrarily changed during the contract; any changes must be reported to and approved by the procuring agency. 5) Controlled use of networks, equipment, and media — use of internal/external networks, access to computing equipment, and use or removal of storage media during the task require prior approval from the procuring agency's supervisor. 6) Confidentiality and data destruction at project end — all materials and information acquired during the task must not be used for other purposes, disclosed, or removed; upon project completion they must be deleted/destroyed immediately in the presence of the procuring agency supervisor. 7) Prohibition of unauthorized actions — prohibited acts include unauthorized access to agency networks/systems, installing unauthorized (or malicious) programs, intentionally creating or leaving exploitable vulnerabilities, or collecting information without permission. 8) Liability for security incidents — the contractor is liable for damages and legal responsibility if security incidents occur due to the contractor's negligence, intent, or poor security practices during or after the contract. 9) Compliance with supplier security rules and censorship of protected information — the contractor must follow the provided [별표 1] 사업자 보안업무 처리기준 and other prescribed information-protection requirements. 10) Remote-development / remote-maintenance prerequisites — remote online development and online maintenance are permitted only if the contractor provides written agreement to the listed security measures. Those measures require: a) access only from designated terminals with personnel access control; b) designated terminals be dedicated exclusively for the online-development/maintenance connection and block other Internet use; c) connections routed through the procuring agency's installed online-service control system to protect and control communication channels; d) preservation of connection logs for at least 1 year. 11) Security inspections during and shortly after contract — the contractor must undergo the procuring agency's regular or ad-hoc security inspections (including unannounced checks) during the contract and up to the period described (inspections within the period up to 30 days after contract end as specified). 12) Remote-work location review and certification advantage — the contractor may propose remote work locations that meet the security requirements; the procuring agency will review and may reject noncompliant sites. If the contractor holds valid information-protection certifications or software-process quality certifications, its proposed remote-site plan may receive preferential review. 13) No subcontracting — the project forbids subcontracting; the contractor cannot transfer duties, responsibilities, or authorities related to the task to a third party. 14) SW deliverable reuse constraints and assurances — if the contractor requests SW artifacts for reuse, the procuring agency will provide them only if they do not contain designated non-disclosable information; the contractor must delete any non-disclosable information from supplied artifacts and submit a representative-signed assurance to that effect. 15) Records and deliverables — the contractor must produce and submit all project artifacts (plans, reports, etc.) to the procuring agency and bear all costs to create those artifacts, while ensuring security controls on those deliverables.

question: What specific technical, compliance, testing, deliverable and contractor-obligation requirements must a bidder satisfy for the 2024 Pyeongtaek Bus Information System (BIS) project (including standards to apply, field-test and inspection rules, required hardware/software deliverables, subcontracting limits, and post-delivery responsibilities)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Standards and interoperability: apply the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport (MOLIT) notices and technical standards—specifically 『버스정보시스템의 기반정보 구축 및 관리요령(국토부 고시)』 and the 『대중교통(버스) 정보교환 기술기준』—and ensure compatibility/interworking with the Gyeonggi-do traffic information center (BMS/BIS) via the 수도권 버스정보 연계시스템. 2) ITS node/link rules and inspection: apply 『지능형교통체계 표준 노드·링크 구축 관리지침』 and 『지능형교통체계 표준 노드·링크 구축 기준』; coordinate ITS-standards application inspections with an ITS standard-application verification and ITS performance-evaluation organization designated/published by MOLIT per the traffic system efficiency law (Article 27) and its enforcement decree (Article 24-2). 3) Inspection and testing cost responsibility: all costs arising from applying standards, guidelines, and inspections (including ITS verification/performance tests and accredited equipment test reports) are borne by the contractor. 4) Field-test and performance-evaluation requirements: include a concrete field-test and performance-evaluation plan in the proposal; perform field tests in coordination with the client according to presented evaluation items, criteria and schedule; conduct unit-performance tests at completion of each unit process with the client's attendance; if tests fail, correct the system and re-run tests until passing; after unit completion, conduct an overall system performance evaluation in consultation with the client. 5) Proposal content-binding and amendment: submitted proposal content is binding and becomes part of the contract; missing items may be requested and added by the client and will have equivalent effect as part of the proposal once accepted. 6) Required hardware and system deliverables (minimum as specified): install 55 BITs (with detailed counts: LCD 32" 6 units; LED single-sided 3-row×12-column: 40 units; LED single-sided 4-row×12-column: 5 units; LED double-sided 4-row×12-column: 4 units); supply 20 BIT LCD monitors; 46 in-BIT NVRs; 2 control/operation PCs; 2 Oracle DB licenses; develop and improve application software including center SW and operational terminal improvements and add intercity-bus destination guidance. 7) Center and field system scope: center system must provide BIT installation, improve/extend existing center BIS S/W functions, analyze existing system status and problems and propose remedial designs, design countermeasures for weaknesses in bus information collection/processing/provision, improve data accuracy, and integrate/complete GIS and standard node-link base information linkage; field-system development must integrate and operate the already-installed BIT field equipment. 8) Quality of equipment and documentation: major equipment/facilities must be accompanied by test reports from accredited testing organizations (produced by manufacturer) and associated costs are contractor's responsibility. 9) Structural and environmental design requirements: all structures (particularly steel) must include anti-corrosion systems (e.g., rust-preventive powder coating) and waterproofing measures; design must reflect corrosion and waterproof prevention. 10) Warranty and maintenance obligations: contractor must immediately repair or replace defective delivered devices discovered after acceptance, and supply-free correction/maintenance for operating programs during the warranty period. 11) Regulatory permits and responsibility for approvals: contractor must obtain any required electrical/communication permits or inspections necessary for system operation; costs borne by contractor. 12) Intellectual property and patent indemnity: if supplied equipment/methods involve patents, contractor must ensure no disadvantage arises to purchaser and assume all responsibility for use of third-party IP in the service. 13) Applicability of higher-grade standards: where multiple legal/technical grades apply, the contractor should preferentially apply the grade that is more favorable for ensuring project quality. 14) Contractor qualifications and participation constraints: bidders must meet statutory qualifications (local government contract law), be registered as software businesses per the Software Industry Promotion Act (articles cited), possess direct-production confirmation certificates for information-system development services and for bus/vehicle information display devices, hold ICT construction registration under the Information and Communications Construction Business Act (Article 14) before electronic bid submission, and may form a consortium (max 2 firms) if a single entity cannot meet all requirements. 15) Exclusion of large software companies: because project amount is under 2 billion won threshold, large and mid-sized software companies are prohibited from participation per relevant government notice. 16) Consortium and organizational documentation: consortiums must submit MOUs/agreements and a project organization chart including participating subcontractors; failure to present these may void technical/financial evaluations for the relevant parts; changes to participating firms require client consultation. 17) Subcontracting rules and approvals: subcontracting requires prior approval from the client per the Software Promotion Act and related guidelines; software subcontracting may not exceed 50% of the software portion of the project (subject to statutory exceptions); bidders must submit a subcontracting plan at bid and contract signature; subcontract approval is evaluated against detailed appropriateness criteria and is granted only if scoring ≥85, though approval may still be denied for operational infeasibility. 18) Transparency on subcontract payments: if subcontracting is allowed, the prime contractor must state the subcontract payment ratio relative to its proposed price in the proposal to prevent unfair subcontract payment determinations. 19) Proposal and evaluation constraints: evaluation is by combined scoring (technical proposal 80%, price proposal 20%); only bidders with combined scores ≥70 (and technical-score meeting ≥85% of its allocated maximum) proceed to negotiation; evaluation results and detailed failed negotiation outcomes are not publicly disclosed and bidders cannot contest technical evaluation results. 20) Project schedule and deliverable timing expectations: the project is a software development project governed by appropriate software project-period estimation rules and must be completed within the contract period (start to 2024.10.31. as indicated), with milestone activities including contract, commencement report, procurement/installation, commissioning, trial operation, and final acceptance, to be coordinated with the client. 21) Proposal obligations regarding on-site verification: proposal must include concrete plans for the required field tests and performance evaluations and must accept that all costs for testing, inspections, and standard compliance activities are the contractor's responsibility.

question: What are the detailed maintenance, staffing, security, performance, data-quality, and testing requirements (including referenced requirement IDs) specified in the RFP for the 2024 Integrated Social Information System operation support, and what operational access constraints are stated for maintenance personnel?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Maintenance execution requirements (MPR-001 – 유지보수 요구사항): general maintenance obligations to keep the integrated social information system operational, including ongoing function and performance improvements and responding to user requirements. 2) Maintenance work execution conditions (MPR-002 – 유지보수 업무수행 조건): conditions under which maintenance must be performed (organizational/operational constraints are specified in the RFP). 3) Incident/Failure management general requirements (MPR-003 – 장애관리 일반 요건): regular preventive inspections and rapid incident/fault response to minimize system downtime (explicitly calls for 정기 예방점검 및 신속한 장애대응). 4) Integrated system maintenance (MPR-004 – 통합사회정보시스템 유지보수): maintain system functions, perform feature and program changes required by IT environment changes (e.g., web browser changes), and implement functional improvements to increase operational efficiency. 5) Performance management (MPR-005 – 성능 관리): improve and manage system performance metrics—performance and functionality, data accuracy, and average response time (explicit performance targets implied by requirement to 개선 성능·기능, 데이터의 정확도, 평균 응답시간 개선). 6) Data quality management (MPR-006 – 데이터 품질관리): maintain and improve data quality, handle database and data classification/code changes, and ensure data standardization and accuracy for system processes. 7) Test management (MPR-007 – 테스트 관리): planning and execution of testing activities to validate maintenance changes and functionality. 8) Maintenance human resource requirements (MHR-001..MHR-003): MHR-001 requires proposing organization and staffing for maintenance (조직 및 인력운영 제안); MHR-002 covers投入 인력 관리 (management of personnel assigned to the project); MHR-003 requires an emergency contact/activation plan (비상연락체계 가동) to support rapid response. 9) Security requirements (SER-001, SER-002): comply with information security obligations tied to the project (사업 추진에 따른 정보보안 준수사항) and submit/implement a security management plan (보안관리 방안); strengthen information security and personal data protection, and perform periodic inspections and fixes (정보보안 및 개인정보보호 관리체계 정립 및 주기적 점검·보완). 10) Quality requirements (QUR-001..QUR-003): ensure system reliability (시스템 신뢰성), usability/ease of use (시스템 용이성), and guarantee interoperability and reliability (상호운용성 및 신뢰성 보장). 11) Functional maintenance expectations (from system scope and unit tasks): maintain and improve many named modules (e.g., 결재관리, 인사복무관리, 예산관리, 종사자관리, 자산관리, 게시판관리, and multiple 사업관리 modules) so their functions (조회·관리, 발급, 집계, 실적/사례 관리 등) remain accurate and performant. 12) Operational access constraint for maintenance (운영현황 관련): detailed server/전산자원 configurations are security-classified and not publicly disclosed; if needed, bidder personnel may view detailed assets only by visiting the procuring agency and submitting a security pledge (보안각서) — i.e., on-site inspection after security pledge. 13) Standards and evaluation references to be followed: maintenance and technical work must follow referenced standards and evaluation criteria indicated in the RFP (e.g., 소프트웨어 기술성 평가기준 and 행정기관 및 공공기관 정보시스템 구축·운영 지침), and comply with stated legal/contract provisions. All items above are enumerated in the RFP as MPR-001 through MPR-007, MHR-001 through MHR-003, SER-001 through SER-002, and QUR-001 through QUR-003, and are supported by sections describing preventive checks, rapid incident response, performance/function/data accuracy improvements, program changes for IT environment shifts, and requirements for data and test management.

question: What are the detailed functional components, integration points, non-functional requirements, and maintenance/training obligations specified in the '봉화군 재난통합관리시스템 고도화 사업' scope of work?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) GIS-based Disaster Integrated Management System: a) GIS 기반의 계측·관측정보 통합 수집 및 관리; b) 계측·관측장비 및 재난예·경보시설의 위치 및 상태 정보 관리; c) 기상정보 및 유관기관 수집정보의 수집·표출·통합관리(유관기관 연계 정보는 활용정보 및 사용자 편의성을 고려하여 표출). 2) Integrated Situation Propagation (통합상황전파) System: a) 기존 운영 중인 재난 예·경보시설과 연계한 재난방송(통합상황전파) 기능 구축; b) 계측·관측장비 및 예·경보시설의 위치·상태 관리 기능; c) 재난예·경보(방송) 발령 및 위기상황 경보방송 전파 기능; d) 모바일 앱 연계로 정보 제공 및 홍수모형분석 서비스 제공; e) 안정적인 경보발령체계 구현을 위한 디지털 데이터방송기술(DMB EWS) 및 LTE 기반 무선 경보방송 구축. 3) Integrated Linkage System (통합연계시스템): a) 수위계 등 계측기, 재난예·경보장치 등 상황전파시스템의 연계 운영; b) 수집 데이터 기반 현장 운영시스템의 원격 제어 및 관리 기능; c) 이기종 시스템과의 안정적인 연계를 위한 네트워크 구성; d) 시험운영을 통한 시스템 연계 검증 및 상시운영체계 마련; e) 기상청·행정안전부 등 유관기관과의 데이터 연계 및 수집·관리. 4) Alert Coverage Expansion and Enhancement (경보발령 범위 확대 및 고도화): a) 사각지역·음영지역 최소화를 위한 무선 방식을 활용한 경보장치 확대 구축; b) 재난경보방송의 가청 범위 확대(사각지역 해소); c) 유선 및 무선(LTE, DMB(EWS)) 방식을 지원하는 경보장비 활용을 통한 경보전파 확대. 5) System integration and operational requirements: a) 재난정보의 통합 운영 및 시스템 간 통합연계 모듈 개발(분산 관리 중인 재난정보 통합·수집·공유); b) 신속한 상황전파 및 경보상황 전파 체계 개선(노후 예경보시설·통신망 개선 포함); c) 사용자·운영자 편의성을 고려한 정보 표출 및 활용성 확보; d) 시험운영, 안정화·검수(시험·시운전)를 통한 안정적 운영 전환. 6) Data management and analytics: a) 장기간 재난위험정보의 DB 축적 및 분석을 통한 재난관리 업무 효율성 제고; b) 실시간 상호 공유 가능한 데이터 기반 마련. 7) Maintenance, training and deliverables: a) 사업수행 업체는 제안서에 따른 사업수행, 사업진도 및 참여 핵심인력 관리; b) 사용자/운영자 교육, 기술이전 및 하자보수 등 유지·보수·하자 책임 수행; c) 시험운영·안정화·검수 후 사용자 교육 및 사업 완료 보고서 제출 등 산출물 납품(착수계 제출, 공정보고, 성과품 납품 등 행정절차 포함). 8) Project constraints affecting work scope: a) 사업기간은 착수일로부터 7개월(210일); b) 사업금액 및 계약방법(제한경쟁입찰·협상에 의한 계약) 등 계약 조건이 명시되어 있음.

question: What is the complete, detailed scope of operational and maintenance requirements the vendor must perform for the 경희대학교 산학협력단 인포21 정보시스템 (including linked systems and 공통관리시스템)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Service scope and targets: operate and maintain the 인포21 연구행정시스템 (including some integrated general-administration modules such as accounting and HR), 공통관리시스템, and all internal/external linked systems and their data processing. 2) Day-to-day operation and corrective maintenance: receive and process user requests (students, faculty, staff) and reflect changes in the system; fix system errors and perform required data processing. 3) Scheduled operational support: provide operation support aligned to 산학협력단 business schedules. 4) Interface/linked-system support and development: provide continuous operation/maintenance for integration tasks; support and develop system linkages when software, data, or operating environments change; implement linkage development for newly introduced external systems. 5) Support for new/changed functions: operate/maintain any portions newly or additionally developed and recognized by 산학협력단 during the contract period. 6) Regulatory/procedure-driven changes: implement modifications or new development arising from changes in laws, regulations, templates, procedures, or organization. 7) Functional/UI/performance/security/usability improvements: perform function supplementation, UI improvements, performance enhancements, and improvements to data security and accuracy to increase user convenience. 8) Development/operation environment optimization: manage and optimize the development/operation environment and development platform. 9) Proactive monitoring and preventive measures: maintain optimal system state through preemptive preventive actions and continuous monitoring. 10) Incident and security response: respond to and remediate system incidents, outages, and security breaches; report results. 11) Joint response for linked-system failures: coordinate and perform joint incident response when linked systems fail involving development/integration aspects. 12) Documentation and knowledge maintenance: produce and update required materials such as online help, operational manuals, user manuals, and FAQs. 13) Reporting and deliverables: prepare and submit operation/maintenance reports on weekly, monthly, and yearly cycles (mandatory), and provide ad-hoc reports upon 산학협력단 request. 14) Risk management and quality assurance: identify risks, propose risk management indicators and responses, manage deliverables, and conduct quality-assurance activities for operation/maintenance outputs. 15) Organizational and communication responsibilities: work within the stipulated 추진체계—coordinate with 산학기획실 경영지원팀장 and 담당자 for overall management, schedule verification, request handling, and issue resolution. 16) Security measures and training: establish internal security measures, apply secure SW development practices, and conduct security education. 17) Compliance and governance: strictly comply with 산학협력단 regulations and related administrative processing guidelines. 18) Platforms and tool familiarity required for operation/maintenance: handle development platforms and tools (엔코어 Meta#, 엔코어 DA#, Eclipse, 넥사크로 Studio, OZ Report, 티베로 DBMS tools, SPARROW for code inspection/vulnerability analysis, ASTA for impact analysis, eCAMS for configuration/build/deploy) and operate on runtime platforms (Tibero 6.0 DBMS, JEUS WAS, WebToB web server, eGovFrame framework, Ksign Access for SSO, UI frameworks JSP/넥사크로/OZ Report, and APM Jennifer). 19) External linked systems to be supported: maintain integrations with listed external systems (예: 마크프로, ZEUS, KRI, 통합이지바로, 통합RCMS, 신한카드(RND카드), 국립보건연구원, 식품의약품안전처 등) and any additional linkages added during the contract. 20) Inclusive improvement activities: undertake any other activities necessary to improve system usability and effectiveness as part of the operation/maintenance service.

question: What are the detailed functional and non-functional requirements, integration points, and operational constraints specified in the RFP for the next-generation portal and academic information system (covering Portal, Mobile, 학사행정, 전자계약, 그룹웨어·전자결재, 규정관리, 경영통계, 챗봇, AI선배, and 개인정보영향평가)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) General project constraints: a) Project duration: complete within 24 months from contract; b) Free maintenance: 12 months from project end; c) Budget: 11,270,000,000 KRW (VAT incl.) with 3-year split payments (~30% 2024, ~40% 2025, ~30% 2026); d) Procurement: restricted competitive bidding (negotiated contract); e) Multi-year execution and payment over three years. 2) Portal system (functional requirements and integration): a) Integrated login (SSO reuse of existing SSO); b) Integrated/intelligent search across portal, homepage and campus information systems, including menu/screen indexing and attachment/document search; c) MyPage (user personalized page), notices/alerts, schedule management, community and bulletin-board functions; d) User-specific information services and widgets for personalization; e) Direct access to major functions of academic/administrative/research systems from portal; f) Integration services such as webmail, chatbot, electronic approval, academic/administrative services; g) Search must prioritize results by searcher identity (role-based ranking), support indexing of each system menu/screen to enable system access linkage, and provide similarity-based search ranking and search-result recommendation; h) Authentication: support simplified authentication and application of secondary (2-step) authentication; i) Unified user management across portal, homepage, and campus information systems; j) Personalization services (per-identity and per-user). 3) Mobile services: a) Provide mobile portal (app and mobile web) with integrated login, integrated/intelligent search, MyPage, notices/alerts, schedule management, university information, space/equipment reservation, personalized/recommended information, academic and administrative information; b) Mobile portal app to be rebuilt as a hybrid app by integrating the existing 'Hoitt' app, with some services added or removed; c) Include push (alarm) functionality; d) Include mobile course registration system (mobile 수강신청 시스템 included under 학사). 4) 학사행정시스템 (academic administration) functional requirements: a) Common management: master/reference data (기준정보) management, authority/permission management, user management; b) Core academic modules: student records (학적), curriculum (교과), class management (수업), grades (성적), graduation, teacher certification (교직), registration (등록), scholarships, military service (병무), health/insurance (보건/공제), international language institute; c) Student data integration across systems; d) Coverage for undergraduate, graduate, and medical (의학계열) students; e) Integration/links with related systems: KUchive (비교과/역량), LMS, library, dormitory, internship, CossHUB (혁신융합대학), etc.; f) Course registration system including mobile course registration. 5) 전자계약시스템 (electronic contract): a) Apply to all campus contracts (HR, procurement, construction, academic, etc.); b) Manage contract templates (main/department templates) and related documents; c) Predefined contract forms per contract type for entering contract information; d) Manage contract/signature information and progress/status; e) Link contract workflow stages with portal electronic approval to show approval progress at each stage; f) Provide viewing/printing of finalized contracts; g) Provide automated detection and notification of contracts eligible for automatic renewal before expiry; h) Allow vendors to manage vendor information and contract contacts; i) Support e-signatures for non-contract items (e.g., committee meeting minutes). 6) 그룹웨어·전자결재시스템 (groupware & e-approval): a) Full electronic approval functions: drafting, designating approval lines, requesting approvals, processing approvals, storing approval documents; b) Include integrated bulletin board, knowledge management, and collaboration services (existing portal common/collaboration services); c) Enhance electronic approval for drafts generated by administrative systems. 7) 규정관리시스템 (regulation management): a) Enhance English version of existing regulation management system; b) Support registration/modification/deletion of regulations and automatic generation of comparison tables between new and old clauses; c) Regulation search and linking related regulations and higher-level laws; d) Integration with electronic approval and integrated search. 8) 경영통계시스템 (management statistics / analytics): a) Build an integrated data repository; b) Provide visualization/dashboards (overall and by domain); c) Generate statistical reports (by department and key indicators); d) Support data extraction needed for public disclosure and higher education statistics. 9) 챗봇 (chatbot) requirements: a) Expand service target to include faculty, staff, and Sejong campus students; b) Reflect user feedback from the first-phase project; c) Enhance GPT-applied model(s); d) Provide complete English-language service for all functions. 10) AI선배 (AI-senior) requirements and architecture: a) Unify data extraction/loading and datamart creation approach with the management statistics system; b) Enhance architecture for continuous and parallel execution of Python-implemented models; c) Integrate AI선배, portal services, and chatbot to redesign recommendation and statistical data-provision functions. 11) 개인정보영향평가 및 개인정보 보호 요구사항: a) Implement privacy impact assessment (PIA) to investigate, predict, and review impacts of system construction/operation/changes on personal data and to derive improvement measures; b) Use PIA to prevent privacy incidents and guarantee data subject rights; c) Verify that technical, managerial, and physical safeguards for personal information files are appropriately applied and present improvement measures if issues are found. 12) Non-functional and operational expectations: a) Provide multilingual support (explicitly English) for specified systems (챗봇, 규정관리 영문 고도화, 전체 기능 영문 서비스 for 챗봇); b) Reuse and integrate with existing systems and assets where specified (existing SSO, Hoitt mobile app); c) Deliver personalization, recommendation, and role-aware search behavior; d) Ensure cross-system integrations (portal ↔ e-approval, portal ↔ academic/admin systems, electronic contract ↔ e-approval, management statistics ↔ AI선배); e) Provide system-wide data consistency to support real-time, reliable data for management decision-making as a stated expected effect. 13) Scope coverage note: a) The system must cover services and users across Seoul and Sejong campuses including students (inc. graduates), faculty, staff, researchers, and specific campus audiences (e.g., Sejong students for chatbot).

question: What are the required scope-of-work items and key technical/operational constraints that a proposer must satisfy when implementing the '고양도시관리공사 관산근린공원 다목적구장 회원 통합운영관리 시스템' according to the RFP (i.e., list the functional deliverables, hardware/equipment procurement requirements, integration requirements, framework/technology constraints, and procurement/contract restrictions)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Reuse of existing systems: The project must be implemented by 100% utilizing the currently operating 고양도시관리공사 체육시설 web예약시스템 and 고객정보통합시스템 (precondition). 2) Customer/member system licenses: Provide latest-version 고객정보통합시스템 (회원관리시스템) center additional license(s). 3) Reservation site licenses: Provide center additional license(s) for the already-built 통합예약 홈페이지. 4) Hardware integration: Provide H/W 연동 프로그램 to interface the new operational system with required hardware. 5) Unmanned operation support: Provide programs and technical support for 무인화 운영 (unmanned operation). 6) Apply e-Government framework: Use the latest 전자정부프레임워크 (version 3.9 or higher) with 2-level compatibility grade. 7) Functional continuity: Implement and integrate basic functions of the existing 운영시스템 and provide necessary linkage and补strong (연계 및 보완) to those baseline functions. 8) Administrative access controls: Implement differentiated administrator access rights, ability to change and delete rights (권한변경 및 말소) to strengthen personal data protection and security features. 9) External system interfacing: Ensure stable and flexible integration with 외부시스템 such as PG 결제 and SMS 발송. 10) 안내데스크 and ticketing equipment procurement and installation: Procure and install all 안내데스크 부가 장비 and 무인발권기 (2 sets). 11) Access control procurement and installation: Procure and install 입퇴장 출입통제시스템 (2 sets). 12) Access control backend equipment: Procure and install 입퇴장 출입통제시스템 중계서버 및 부가장비 일체. 13) Contractual/organizational constraints: The project disallows 공동계약 및 하도급 (no joint contracts or subcontracting). 14) Technical-holder agreement: Bidders must review the attached 기술지원 협약서; the awardee must enter into a 기술사용 협약 with the 기술보유자 (㈜혁산정보시스템) and submit the agreement at contract signing. 15) Legal and procedural compliance: The work must follow applicable laws and guidelines cited in the RFP (e.g., 소프트웨어진흥법, 지방자치단체를 당사자로 하는 계약에 관한 법률, related 행정안전부 예규 and 고양도시관리공사 시행내규) and the project has undergone required software project reviews/impact assessments per those laws. 16) Project schedule and warranty constraints: Deliverables and implementations are expected within the 과업기간 (90 days from start) and include a 무상하자보증기간 of 1 year from completion (these are operational constraints affecting delivery and post-delivery responsibility).
