question: Based on the RFP, what are the detailed functional and operational requirements, scope of work, objectives, constraints (including schedule, budget, contract and payment terms), affected usage scale, and expected effects for the "실시간통합연구비관리시스템(RCMS) 연계 모듈 변경 사업"?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional requirements and specific change requests: a. Modify the ZEUS/ uZeus–RCMS integration module to a latest module/type to resolve transmission errors caused by changes in research account/item classifications after the enactment of the National R&D Innovation Act (effective 2021-01-01). b. Improve transmission functionality related to VAT handling for research projects (부가세 연구과제 전송 관련 개선). c. Improve detailed transfer-transmission for research expense items (연구비 집행 건) — specifically for 출장비 (travel expenses), 회의비 (meeting expenses), 외부 전문기술 활용비 (external professional technical service fees) — so details are correctly sent to RCMS. 2) Scope of work: a. Change/upgrade the ZEUS–RCMS linkage module (ZEUS-RCMS간 연계 모듈 변경). b. Implement the VAT-related transmission improvements. c. Incorporate the detailed transfer-transmission improvements for specified expense categories. 3) Project objectives (expected functional/operational outcomes): a. Improve usability through uZeus–RCMS linkage module changes and functionality improvements (업무 편리성 제고). b. Maximize operational efficiency via business-process redesign (업무 프로세스의 재설계). c. Increase user convenience through direct integration with RCMS (RCMS와의 직접 연계). d. Provide services that enable organic inter-organizational workflow linkage (조직 간의 업무를 상호 유기적으로 연동되는 서비스 제공). 4) Constraints, schedule and contractual/payment terms: a. Project period: within 3 months from contract signing (계약체결일로부터 3개월 이내). b. Project budget: 54,450,000원 (VAT included). c. Contracting method: limited-competition bidding with negotiation (제한경쟁 입찰(협상에 의한 계약 체결)). d. Payment terms: 50% advance payment (선금 50%) per GIST contract rules (광주과학기술원 계약업무요령 제47조), remaining balance paid upon final acceptance/inspection (잔금: 최종검수 완료시 지급). e. Proposal should follow schedule details referenced in the RFP's 추진일정표. 5) Affected usage scale / current usage baseline: a. As of September 2024, system usage covers a total of 75 projects across 6 government ministries and 11 specialized agencies (총 75개 과제, 6개 부처, 11개 전문기관), with the RFP listing counts per ministry/agency. 6) Expected effects / benefits to be achieved by the work: a. Eliminate duplicate corrective work for RCMS transfer/transmission errors (RCMS 이체 전송 오류 건에 대한 수정작업의 중복 업무 해소). b. Simplify administrative procedures for self-account transfers approval (자계좌이체 승인 업무에 대한 행정절차 간소화). c. Increase user convenience through direct RCMS integration (RCMS와의 직접 연계를 통해 사용자 편의성 증대).

question: According to the RFP, what is the complete scope of work, required deliverables, staffing/cost breakdown, contractual/payment conditions, existing technical environment access constraints, and key project objectives/expected outcomes that a vendor must account for when preparing a proposal for the '학사시스템 기능개선 사업'?
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following requirements and constraints that a proposing vendor must account for: 1) Project identification and period: - Project name: 학사시스템 기능개선 사업. - Project period: within 5 months from contract signing (refer to the RFP's 추진일정표 for schedule details). 2) Contracting method and participation constraints: - Contract method: 공개경쟁입찰 (협상에 의한 계약체결). - 공동수급불가 (joint/consortium participation is not allowed). 3) Budget and cost breakdown (all amounts as stated in the RFP): - Total proposed price (including VAT): 157,300,000원. - Detailed cost items: a) 설계 (업무분석자): 53,000,000원 — noted as 총 11 M/M. b) 개발 및 테스트 (응용SW 개발자): 90,000,000원 — noted as 총 11 M/M. c) 소계 (these items): 143,000,000원. - The stated 합계 157,300,000원 is the 견적서 제안가 (VAT 포함). 4) Payment terms: - 선금 (advance): 50% of contract value (per 광주과학기술원 계약업무요령 제47조 선급금지급). - 잔금 (balance): paid upon completion of final inspection (최종검수 완료시 지급). 5) Scope of work / required deliverables: - System improvements to reflect the 학사 조직개편 (학사 조직개편에 따른 시스템 개선). - Build/implement the 학위 연계 과정 system (학위연계과정 시스템 구축). - Provide services that enable inter-organizational (조직 간) processes to be organically linked (조직 간의 업무를 상호 유기적으로 연동되는 서비스 제공). - Deliverables should support the objectives below (see item 6) and be consistent with the detailed 요구사항 및 요구사항 상세 sections referenced elsewhere in the RFP. 6) Project objectives and expected outcomes vendors must meet: - Improve usability and convenience through 학사 시스템 기능 개선. - Maximize operational efficiency via 업무 프로세스 재설계. - Enhance user convenience by aligning the system with 학사조직 개편 and 학위 연계과정 changes. - Provide rapid development and service delivery in response to organizational changes. - Stabilize and improve functionality (안정화 및 기능향상, 기능개선을 통한 업무 효율성 제고). - Establish stable system operation through improved management. - Reflect user requirements to increase internal and external user satisfaction (대내·외 사용자 만족도 제고). 7) Existing technical environment and access conditions vendors must consider: - Network and related system configuration diagram exists but must be viewed on-site after obtaining approval from the contracting agency (내방하여 주관 기관 승인 후 직접 열람). - Current software inventory (S/W 현황) listed includes: a) DB: Oracle 11g Enterprise Edition 50Users (도입년도 2012) with a note '150 user'. b) DB: 암호화 프로그램(KSIGN) (도입년도 2012). c) E-mail: Web Mail (도입년도 2015). d) E-mail: 대량메일시스템 (도입년도 2015). e) E-mail: 스팸스나이퍼 (도입년도 2010, noted as upgrade). 8) References and mandatory cross-checks: - The RFP instructs proposers to reference the 추진일정표 within the proposal documents. - Detailed 요구사항 총괄표 및 요구사항 상세 sections are included elsewhere in the RFP and must be strictly followed when defining deliverables and technical responses. 9) Other administrative notes vendors must follow: - The vendor must prepare proposals consistent with 제안요청 필수사항 and 제안서 작성 및 준수사항 sections (listed in the RFP TOC). - Intellectual property, 보안특약, and SW 산출물 반출 절차 are referenced in attachments and must be observed (붙임/별표 sections referenced in the TOC).

question: Summarize the complete Scope of Work required by the RFP: list each module or work package to be newly developed or improved, describe the required sub-functions for each module, and enumerate all required system integrations, interface and security/operation constraints called out in the document (include counts of requirement categories where specified).
ground_truth: The Scope of Work includes six primary modules/work packages, required integrations/interfaces/security constraints, and project-level constraints and requirement counts as follows: 1) Modules / Functional Deliverables (newly built or improved): 1.1 Institution Human Research Ethics (기관생명윤리, IRB) — (new build) • Clinical research review application. • Receipt/acceptance of IRB clinical research applications. • Notification/registration of IRB clinical research review results. • IRB clinical research registry/ledger and information management. • Change (modification) request processing and history management. • Submission and management of clinical research results reports. 1.2 Animal Experiment Ethics (동물실험윤리, IACUC) — (new build) • Animal experiment plan approval application. • Receipt and communication of review/approval results. • Animal experiment plan registry/ledger and information management. • Management of change/approval for experiment plan modifications. • Management of experimental animal/materials import requests (실험동물 물품 반입신청서). • Submission of experiment termination reports. • Submission/management of carcass disposal result reports. 1.3 National R&D Research Fund Compliance (국가연구개발사업 연구비 사용기준 준수) — (new build) • Prior meeting plan (안) application for compliance with R&D fund rules. • Corporate/research fund card payment (지급) application and linkage to prior meeting plan. • Purchase-card (구매전용카드) usage application and ledger management, including storage, loan, return tracking. • Electronic (tax) invoice issuance request handling and linkage. 1.4 Research Plan / Technical Readiness Management — (new build) • Registration and management of technical readiness/goals (TRL, BRL, ATL) for major projects. • Registration and stage management of TRL/BRL/ATL for contracted (수탁) projects. • Management/display of technology readiness level fields within research agreements (TAB). 1.5 Electronic Approval Form Integration (전자결재연동) — (interface work) • Integration of various new application forms (stated as 10 types of new forms) with the organization’s electronic approval (전자결재) system so that submissions are processed and routed via the e-approval workflow. 1.6 Research Notebook Management (연구노트 관리) — (function improvement) • Research notebook ledger management for new issuance, loan, return, and handover (인수인계). • Notebook ledger list management for new/loan/return/handover states. • Per-project research-notebook status view (tab) and summary management. 2) Required System integrations, interface and platform features: • Single sign-on (SSO) / 통합로그인 integration (including external SSO). • Two-factor authentication (OTP) as 2nd authentication. • VPN access for external users (가상사설망) for external user access. • User information & permission control (user roles: administrators, business staff, general users, external users). • Portal / 업무포털 (EP) features to be supported (as part of system): notices, research status, personal schedule, approval info, working hours, rules/regulations, user management, document info, bulletin boards, mail management, work management, collaboration, my tasks, square, popup management, environment settings, etc. • Integration with internal/external systems enumerated in the document: E-BRANCH, Card system (카드시스템), Web mail (웹메일), Electronic tax invoice (전자세금계산서), NTIS, RCMS, 통합이지바로, and National Tax Service (국세청). • Electronic approval linkage for 10 kinds of new application forms. 3) Non‑functional / architectural / operational constraints and expectations called out: • Design must consider interoperation with the existing integrated information system and reuse existing systems and infrastructure where applicable. • Standardize and systematize previously manual or non-linked data for ease of communication, sharing, and data management. • Provide user-centered, customized UI/UX for usability. • Work location (remote development) is negotiable / to be mutually agreed and budgeted in the project. • Intellectual property: principle of joint ownership of developed software and explicit procedures for artifact export are specified. • Warranty / defect liability: vendor responsibility for defects for 1 year after project completion. • Subcontracting is not allowed (하도급 불허). • Only small software vendors may participate (사업금액 < 2 billion KRW rule applied; here 20억 미만 so only small SW firms can bid). 4) Project-level constraints and parameters: • Contract form: negotiated contract (limited competitive bidding). • Project period: within 5 months after contract. • Estimated budget: up to 140,000,000 KRW (VAT included). • Development must follow the software development project appropriate-period calculation guidance attached. • Technology evaluation emphasis: technical capability vs price weight 90:10. 5) Requirement counts by category (as provided): • Functional (SFR): 24 requirements. • Performance (PER): 5 requirements. • Interface (SIR): 5 requirements. • Data (DAR): 10 requirements. • Test (TER): 5 requirements. • Security (SER): 4 requirements. • Quality (QUR): 1 requirement. • Constraints (COR): 4 requirements. • Project Management (PMR): 3 requirements. • Project Support (PSR): 3 requirements. • Total listed requirement items: 64. These items and constraints define the explicit functional modules to be delivered, the integrations to be implemented (SSO, OTP, VPN, e-approval, and external systems named), UI/UX and reuse expectations, and contractual/operational constraints that must be adhered to during design, development, testing, delivery and 1-year warranty.

question: List and synthesize all required deliverables and specific sub-requirements defined in the RFP across the Consulting (CSR), Data (DAR), Security (SER), Quality (QUR), Constraints (COR), Project Management (PMR) and Project Support (PSR) requirement categories. For each requirement ID, provide the requirement name and any detailed sub‑content or specified deliverable(s) given in the document.
ground_truth:
The requirements include: 1) Consulting Requirements (CSR):
   - CSR-001: 디지털트윈 현황 및 환경 분석
     • 세부 내용: 국내외 정책·법·제도 조사 및 분석 (BIM, 디지털트윈 관련 정책·법·제도); 국내외 디지털트윈 현황 및 환경 분석 (국내외 산업·철도 디지털트윈 동향 파악 및 사례 분석); 디지털트윈 환경 분석에 따른 시사점 도출.
     • 산출정보(지정결과물): 법·제도 분석서, 환경 분석 보고서.
   - CSR-002: 국내 BIM, 디지털트윈 관련 표준정보체계 검토
     • 세부 내용: 국내 표준정보체계 동향 분석(중앙부처·지자체·타 공공기관 유사사례 분석, ‘BIM 기반 통합플랫폼 개발’ 국가 R&D 성과물 분석); 국내 표준 연계·활용 방안 검토.
     • 산출정보: 국내 표준정보체계 동향분석서.
   - CSR-003: openBIM 기반 국제표준 동향 검토 및 도입 방안 도출
     • 세부 내용: ISO 16739, 19650, 29481 등 BIM 관련 국제표준 동향 분석; 철도인프라 표준정보체계에 국제표준 적용 방안 도출; 공단의 ISO 19650 도입 방안 도출.
     • 산출정보: 국제표준 동향 분석서, ISO 19650 도입 방안보고서.
   - CSR-004: 철도인프라 표준정보체계 개발방향 도출
     • 세부 내용: 현행 철도인프라 정보체계 분석 및 개발 방안 도출; openBIM 기반 디지털트윈을 위한 철도인프라 표준정보체계 개발 방향 도출.
     • 산출정보: 표준정보체계 개발 방안 보고서.
   - CSR-005: 공단 내부 시스템 및 데이터 운용 현황 분석 (요약명칭)
     • 요구사항: 공단 내부 기존 시스템 등 및 데이터 운용 현황 분석(세부 산출물은 목록에 명시됨).
   - CSR-006: 공단 내부 시스템 및 데이터 연계성 도출 (요약명칭)
     • 요구사항: 공단 내부 기존 개발중인 시스템 및 데이터와 디지털트윈 플랫폼 연계성 도출; 시스템 연계 방안 도출.
   - CSR-007: 디지털트윈 플랫폼 기술요건 분석
     • 요구사항: 디지털트윈 플랫폼의 기술 및 서비스 요구사항 도출·분석.
   - CSR-008: 철도인프라 디지털트윈 플랫폼 구축 방안 수립
     • 요구사항: 디지털트윈 데이터 기반 협업 방안과 플랫폼 시스템 구축 방안 수립.
   - CSR-009: 디지털 전환 경영전략 수립
     • 요구사항: 공단 경영전략·비전에 디지털 전환 반영을 위한 의견수렴 및 거버넌스 체계 정립, 경영 제언.
   - CSR-010: 세부실행계획 및 로드맵 수립
     • 세부 내용: 핵심과제 도출 및 우선순위 결정, 단계별 기간·예산·조직 등 세부추진계획 수립을 통한 중장기 로드맵 수립; 서비스 모델링 제시(기술요건 및 서비스 요구사항 반영).
   - CSR-011: 컨설팅 요구사항 (총괄·통합 항목)
     • 요구사항: 컨설팅 요구사항 전체를 포괄하는 항목으로 목록에 포함.
2) Data Requirements (DAR):
   - DAR-001: 데이터 표준화
   - DAR-002: 데이터 표준 관리
   - DAR-003: 데이터 구조 설계
   - DAR-004: 데이터 구조 검증
   - DAR-005: 데이터 구조 관리 방안
   - DAR-006: 데이터 값 검증 방안
   - DAR-007: 데이터 관리체계 수립
   - DAR-008: 데이터 개방 관리체계
   (각 DAR 항목은 데이터 표준·구조·검증·관리·개방 등 데이터 전주기 관리 방안 수립을 요구함.)
3) Security Requirements (SER):
   - SER-001: 사업의 보안 일반요구사항
   - SER-002: 보안규정·법규 및 지침 준수
   - SER-003: 참여 인력에 대한 보안
   - SER-004: 내부자료 및 산출물에 대한 보안관리
   - SER-005: 지식재산권 반출 및 지식재산권 공동 귀속
   - SER-006: 사무실 및 장비 보안관리
   - SER-007: 개인정보보호 대책
   - SER-008: 제재조건
   - SER-009: 소프트웨어 개발보안
   - SER-010: 보안 취약점 조치
   (요구사항은 규정·법규 준수, 인력·물리·자료·소프트웨어 보안 및 취약점 조치·IP 관리 등을 포함.)
4) Quality Requirement (QUR):
   - QUR-001: 품질보증 방안 및 수행
     • 요구사항: 품질보증(품질관리) 방안 수립 및 수행에 대한 요구.
5) Constraints (COR):
   - COR-001: 관련 규정 준수
   - COR-002: 하도급 계약 사전 승인
     • 요구사항: 관련 규정 준수 의무 및 하도급 계약 시 사전 승인 필요.
6) Project Management Requirements (PMR):
   - PMR-001: 사업수행 일반사항 준수
   - PMR-002: 사업수행계획서 작성
   - PMR-003: 사업수행조직 구성
   - PMR-004: 보고 및 산출물 내역
   - PMR-005: 사업수행 환경 및 장소
   - PMR-006: 프로젝트 관리방법론
     • 요구사항: 사업수행계획서·조직·보고·산출물·작업환경·관리방법론 등 프로젝트 관리 전반에 대한 준수·제출 의무.
7) Project Support Requirements (PSR):
   - PSR-001: 기술지원
   - PSR-002: 행사 및 보고회 지원
   - PSR-003: 하자보수
     • 요구사항: 기술지원·보고회 등 행사 지원 및 하자보수(사후지원) 제공.

Notes: The above list is strictly derived from the RFP text. Where detailed sub‑content or deliverables were provided in the document, they are included (notably CSR-001 through CSR-004). Other items are listed by their exact IDs and names as specified in the RFP.

question: Based on the RFP, what are the concrete technical, security, data-migration, access-control, monitoring/integration, and operational-deliverable requirements for the cloud-based 해양자료관리시스템 and its infrastructure?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Cloud infrastructure and DB conversion: deploy the system on the cloud currently used by 국립인천해양박물관; convert the existing database management system to a form suitable for the cloud environment. 2) Security / monitoring integration: install a cloud security-monitoring (보안관제) solution, perform threat detection, and transmit threat-detection results to the 해양수산사이버안전센터. The RFP explicitly references use of the 해양수산부 ‘위협관리센서’, 윈스(WinS) products, and 가상사설망 (VPN) products from 윈스 and 엑스게이트 for this integration. 3) Strengthened security and stability: build a cloud-based computing environment with enhanced security and stability to guard against information leakage and loss (영구적 저장 및 사이버사고 대비). 4) System functional scope (to be supported on the cloud system): implement a web-based maritime collections management system tailored to the museum’s holdings, including workflows for acquisition (구입, 접수), transfer/receipt (이관, 수탁), donation (수증), registration (대표번호 등록, 수집자료 등록), inventory/출격납, 전시, 대여, 보존처리, 열람/복제, 보험 관리, 저작권 관리, 수집처 이력관리, 미등록자료 검색, 키워드 검색, 통계(자료구분별, 격납처별 국내/국외, 출납원인별, 고빈도 출격납자료 등). 5) Data migration and standardization: migrate existing holdings data prepared in Excel and HWP (한글) — lists, 명세서, 사진자료 등 — into the new system (초기 데이터 구축). Standardize holdings data so the collections can also be used on the museum’s public website (누리집). Provide capability to export holdings to Excel/HWP style outputs. 6) Identity, access, and audit features: implement system-management modules including 공통코드 관리, 메뉴 및 권한관리, 그룹 권한관리, 담당자/부서 관리, 시스템 설정 관리, and 접속이력 관리 (connection/login history). Define and enforce access permissions for users and for data to increase security. 7) Network/security components: incorporate virtual private network (가상사설망) products (윈스, 엑스게이트) as part of the cloud security design and ensure the cloud security-monitoring solution interoperates with the referenced sensors/products. 8) Operational requirements & deliverables: provide administrator and end-user training (관리자 및 실무자 교육) to ensure early adoption and usability improvements; produce required project artifacts — 착수보고서/사업수행계획서, 주간보고서 및 수시보고서, 시험결과보고서 (tests results to be submitted within 14 days after testing), 완료보고서, 운영자 매뉴얼 and 사용자 매뉴얼 (to be submitted within 10 days after 검수), and a 보안 확약서 — and follow the specified reporting cadence (weekly reports, 단계별 reports: 착수/중간/완료, and ad-hoc reports). 9) Testing and acceptance scope: final acceptance (검수) covers all delivered 산출물, program files, and the education/training provided; 검수 is to be conducted within the timeframe stated after 완료계 접수 (with provisions if immediate 검수가 불가능). 10) Project management obligations: proposer must submit a detailed schedule from start to finish, and implement project-goal management, progress/change management, regular/irregular reporting, and risk/problem identification processes as part of the contract execution.

question: Summarize the detailed hardware, software, licensing, deployment redundancy, deliverable and security/standards requirements specified in the RFP for the IP-based call center and related components (IP PBX, media gateway, CTI, IP recording, IP-IVR, DB/security tools, and related licenses).
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following detailed requirements: 1) Hardware (ECR-001) - IP PBX: CPU Xeon 1P/4C 3.3 GHz or higher; Memory >= 16GB; HDD >= 1TB * 2; OS: Linux family; IPv4/IPv6 TTA-certified product; call server and power (power supply) redundancy; quantity: 2 sets. - IP phones: 100 units. - Media Gateway: Main/headquarters: control unit redundancy and embedded server redundancy; PRI capacity 240CH; >= 10 universal slots per shelf; quantity: 1 set. Branch/remote sites: power redundancy; PRI 60CH per branch; >= 4 universal slots per shelf; quantity: 3 sets. - CTI Server: CPU 1P/8C or higher; Memory >= 32GB; HDD >= 1TB * 2; OS: Linux family; server and power redundancy; quantity: 2 sets. - IP Recording Server: Memory >= 32GB; HDD >= 1TB * 2; OS: Windows Server 2019 or later; server and power redundancy; quantity: 2 sets. (CPU field in excerpt is incomplete/unspecified.) - IP-IVR Server: CPU 1P/8C or higher; Memory >= 32GB; HDD >= 1TB * 2; OS: Windows Server 2019 or later; server and power redundancy; quantity: 2 sets. 2) Software / Solution Requirements (ECR-002) - IP Exchange (switch) software: vendor-provided high-availability (manufacturer redundancy) solution; licenses: IP phone licenses 100CH, IP-IVR licenses 100CH, recording integration license 100CH; quantity: 2 sets. - CTI Middleware Solution: vendor high-availability solution; counselor/agent licenses: 100 agents (including administrator); IP-IVR Port license: 100CH; CTI middleware engine; exchange interface and accessory-solution integrations; quantity: 2 sets. - IP Recording Solution: high-availability configuration; recording licenses 100CH; recording file encryption/decryption module; Non-ActiveX module; statistics & monitoring module; real-time listening module; quantity: 2 sets. - IP-IVR Solution: dual/secondary system configuration; IP-IVR license: 50CH per server; statistics & monitoring module; IVR scenario development and recording; scenario editor provided; TTS playback support; TTS channels: 4 channels; quantity: 2 sets (servers). - Database encryption: DB encryption solution (Unix, 4-core) quantity: 1. - Report tool: OZ Report (4-core) quantity: 2. - Personal data protection: server filter quantity: 1 and web filter quantity: 2. - DB access control: DB access control (4-core) quantity: 2. 3) Redundancy and High-Availability Expectations - Multiple components explicitly require server and power redundancy (IP PBX, CTI, IP recording, IP-IVR, etc.). - Manufacturer-provided/hardware/software redundancy solutions are required for IP exchange and middleware. - The target deployment is designed for redundancy/double sites (central + metropolitan) and mentions dualization for stability and failover. 4) Licenses and Capacities - General capacity targets: 100 IP phone channels; 100 IP-IVR channels (licensed); 100 recording channels; 100 CTI agent licenses (incl. admin). Specific IVR licensing expressed as 50CH per server. Media gateway PRI sizing: 240CH for main, 60CH per branch. 5) Deliverables / Acceptance Artifacts - For hardware: delivery completion report, technical support commitment, system configuration diagram. - For software: delivery completion report, technical support commitment, system configuration diagram, and TTA verified ver.4 (or higher) security certification for internet telephony products. 6) Standards and Security Constraints - Internet telephony system must use products certified to Korean Information and Communication Technology Association (TTA) verified ver.4 or higher security standards. - Must comply with the National Information Security Basic Guideline (국가정보보안기본지침) Article 46 (internet telephony security). 7) Additional Notes Specified in the RFP - Non-ActiveX support for recording solution and modules for statistics, monitoring, and real-time listening are required. - Encryption/decryption module for recorded files is required. - Integration interfaces between CTI, PBX/exchange, IVR, and recording are required. - Several items specify platform OS requirements (Linux for PBX/CTI; Windows Server 2019+ for recording and IVR).

question: What are the comprehensive functional, system, content-development, maintenance, security, diagnostic, and learner-engagement requirements bidders must satisfy for the 2024 e‑learning system operation (covering LMS/server, cyber/mobile academy, content counts and types, diagnostics, support, quality control, and information security)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) System build and operation: a) Build and operate an e‑learning system including mobile support (cyber/mobile 연수원), with LMS lease/operation and immediate service/startup after contract; b) Provide a server operation plan, error-handling manual, and dedicated personnel for stable server operation; c) Ensure timely system delivery (expectation: build in time for 2024.3 application and 4월 education start); d) Offer server lease and stable hosting for LMS and other services. 2) Core system features and learner services: a) Provide LMS (학습관리시스템) functionality and 학사관리 요구사항; b) Operate learning events (“학습 이벤트”); c) Provide a curation/recommendation service (“큐레이션 서비스”) using learning data and big‑data to recommend popular/interest content; d) Operate social learning features (“소셜러닝”) including video/photo uploads and Q&A to convert tacit knowledge into sharable content; e) Provide “나의 학습노트” functionality; f) Support real‑time (video) education and gamification options; g) Support mobile-optimized microlearning and always‑available mobile content; h) Provide learning-promotion services (e-mail and KakaoTalk notifications) to improve progress and completion rates. 3) Content development and management: a) Develop 60 new 직무 콘텐츠 차시 (new sessions) and 10 department‑specific mandatory courses (부서별 필수 콘텐츠); b) Manage 공단 소유 콘텐츠: 146 existing courses must be managed/maintained; c) Provide content update/maintenance and timely updates for existing content; d) Expand script/subtitle (자막) functionality for existing and new content; e) Convert offline/practical lectures into online formats (video shooting, real‑time streaming) and support e‑book production for manuals and job texts; f) Support professional certifications, external content integration, telephone foreign‑language courses, and book‑learning services per demand. 4) Functional learning supports and diagnostics: a) Operate 직무지식진단 and 역량진단 (competency diagnostics) including provision of pre/post diagnostics (상·하반기 연2회 역량진단) and present level‑based tailored job courses based on diagnostics; b) Provide 직무·자기개발 맞춤형 콘텐츠 recommendations based on learner data and diagnostics; c) Provide improved 직무지식진단 with pre/post evaluation and statistics management to show competency changes; d) Provide competency model (국민연금공단 역량 모델) based TRM presentation and support for improving the competency diagnosis program. 5) Quality assurance and project processes: a) Present education/content evaluation and quality management plan (교육콘텐츠 평가 및 품질관리 방안); b) Provide content inspection and acceptance procedures (콘텐츠 검사 및 검수); c) Provide free defect repair (무상하자보수) within 20% of development scope for all deliverables; d) Include project support items such as 동영상 촬영 and real‑time (화상) lecture support. 6) Management, maintenance and data transfer: a) Provide scope of management and 수행사항 for maintenance (관리 범위, 수행사항); b) Support transfer of existing 공단 programs, content and data at handover; c) Provide handover and transitional support after contract end (contract termination handover period noted as 협의 후 1년 in places). 7) Security, privacy and compliance: a) Present and strictly manage information security and personal data protection plans (정보보안, 개인정보보호 규정 준수 및 보안 관리 방안); b) Include compliance with relevant laws and regulations for information security and personal information protection as part of operations; c) Ensure secure handling during content/program/data migration and ongoing operation. 8) Learner engagement and program design: a) Offer microlearning and blended learning designs linking online microlearning with offline practical courses to improve effectiveness; b) Package and update statutory mandatory trainings for efficient delivery and ensure content includes required mandatory elements and updates; c) Provide learning‑inducing activities, events and promotional plans to increase learner interest and immersion. 9) Operational constraints and budgets: a) Bidders must not exceed specified budgets for the two business parts when proposing prices (교육과정 운영 and 콘텐츠개발/시스템운영); b) Some schedule and scope items may be adjusted after negotiation with the 공단 (상기 내용은 공단과 협의 후 일부 조정 가능).

question: What is the comprehensive scope of work — i.e., the specific modules, programs and tasks — that the proposer must develop or modify to implement the 고시 개정 for 사업장 사회보험료 지원 according to the RFP?
ground_truth: The scope of work includes the following detailed development and modification tasks grouped by functional area: 1) Income-related systems and validations: develop and enhance income-related programs (기준소득월액, 종합소득금액, 재산 등) to reflect the 고시 개정 and 법·지침; implement support-exclusion and verification systems for income; unify exclusion criteria for income; modify handling for 일용, 상용, 연 또는 월 작업 기준; implement programs to decide support-eligibility using 국세청 종합소득 연 작업 linkage; implement logic to apply support-exclusion when 종합소득 상한으로 제외 and to perform 직전월 소급 지원제외 처리. 2) Retroactive and period-handling logic: implement routines to handle 상용·일용 사회보험료 소급 지원, including exclusion if 상용 was not supported in the retroactive month; determine 연금보험료 지원 소급월 eligibility limits (e.g., 36개월 초과 판단) and corresponding program adjustments; ensure when a 사업장이 매년 1월 말일 기준 계속 지원으로 변경되는 경우 징수 고지 예정 및 실지원 생성이 가능하도록 처리. 3) 신규가입자 판단 시스템: develop/modify modules to judge 신규가입자 eligibility based on 사업장 규모 and 고시/지침; retain existing judgment criteria and add re-evaluation/reverification logic; support exclusion rules for 재신청 사업장 and incorporate additional/changed criteria when specified. 4) 사업장 동일성 인정기준 개선: implement systems for business identity (동일성) recognition — including linkage for 탈퇴된 사업장 and 가입자 계속 지원 reconciliation; add 지사 신청 workflow with additional 증빙서류 upload and 본부 담당자 확인 processing; implement management for 대상자 whose 지원율 changes due to 동일성 인정, reflecting changes at 자격 마감 for support decision and exclusion processing. 5) 일용근로자 지원기준 변경 대응: update 자격 및 징수 시스템 for changes to 일용근로자 support criteria; handle 상용·일용 소급 지원 자격·징수 adjustments; implement logic to exclude months where 상용 was not supported in the retroactive month and to decide 소급월 eligibility per 36개월 초과 rule. 6) 실태조사 시스템 개발 및 보완: develop 실태조사 결과등록 and 관리 including 결과 통지 이력 관리 (평생고객이력); implement 실태조사 안내용 서식 출력 및 재전송 기능 and other improvements. 7) 원부·증명서·모바일·안내문 통합 기능: enhance 사업장 및 가입자 자격·징수 원부 programs; modify/produce 소득공제용 납부확인서, 가입내역 안내서, and other documents; develop and enhance 통합안내문 발송 across channels (모바일, 카카오, MMS, 국민비서 알림 서비스 등). 8) 징수(징수 고지·환수·결손처분 등) 시스템 보완: modify 징수 고지, 환수, 결손처분 programs; update handling for 과오납금, 차감 잔액, 공제 잔액, 상계충당; implement 지사/일/월/년/수시 작업 및 관련 화면 개발·보완; develop/upgrade 징수 검증 프로그램; incorporate 지사 제안사항 및 요구사항 화면 기능 반영. 9) 통계 및 검증시스템 보완: develop/upgrade 자격·징수 통계 및 검증 프로그램 per 고시 개정; implement 체계적인 검증시스템 for 지원 결정, 징수결정, 실지원, 환수 등 업무별 검증; develop 지사/일/월/년/수시 작업별 검증 및 통계 화면 및 프로세스. 10) 체납처분 시스템 고도화: enhance 체납처분 프로그램 for expanded support types; develop/modify 체납처분 종합원부(환수, 체납처분, 결손처분내역); develop/modify 미납자 프로그램; generate 환수금 시효완성 예정 사업장 명부; implement 재산 조사, 납부독려관리, 체납처분 승인 관리시스템; implement 압류 집행/해제관리, 개인회생관리, 법원경매관리, 배분금전 관리, 부동산압류, 자동차 전자촉탁, 예금채권관리 등 관련 기능. 11) 차세대 통합플랫폼 반영: ensure 신규 및 보완사항을 차세대 통합플랫폼에 적기 반영; account for 변경된 자격 테이블 설계 in the 차세대시스템; build 차세대 플랫폼에 사업장 동일성 인정기준 시스템 including 지사·본부 입력 및 확인 화면과 동일성 인정에 따른 가입자 지원율 판단 관리시스템. 12) 2025 고시 개정 사전 반영: develop programs to pre-apply 2025 고시 개정 내용 (소득 및 지원율 변동, 지원 기간 상한 적용 등); implement batch processing to apply support-rate and 신규·기존 기준 변경 across 대상자; prepare for 2025년 연금보험료 지원 관련 징수 프로그램 보완 and for program changes driven by 공단 및 고용노동부 지침 변경. 13) Cross-cutting implementation and operational requirements: follow 정보화사업 프로세스 절차 및 투명성 강화; perform 협업 개발 between 정보지원실 자체 인력 and 외주용역 개발자 and 긴밀한 협업 with 가입지원실 for 업무 프로세스 개선; accept 보안 서약서-based secure viewing of 현 시스템 현황 if required; reflect 지사 테스트 및 자료 정확성 검증 and 본부/지사 테스트 roles during 개발 단계별 산출물 검토 및 프로그램 테스트. 14) Testing, screens and usability: develop required 작업별(지사, 일, 월, 년, 수시) 화면들, implement 검증·통계·검증프로그램과 테스트 케이스 to support 업무 검증, and incorporate 지사 요구 화면 기능. 15) Deliverables and timeline considerations: implement analysis/design/구현/테스트 산출물 per project 추진일정 and the 소프트웨어 개발사업 적정사업 기간 (계약일로부터 180일) and account for 기능점수(833.5FP) 규모 which may change during analysis·설계. These items together define the explicit modules, program logic changes, interfaces, reporting/printing/notification features, verification and enforcement workflows the proposer must deliver or modify as specified in the RFP.

question: What is the detailed Scope of Work (key tasks and modules) required by the RFP for the 'Records Management System Integration and Security Environment' project?
ground_truth: The Scope of Work is organized into five major workstreams with specific tasks and modules to be developed: 1) Records-management User Page Overhaul (이용자 페이지 전면 개편): a. Build main and sub user pages (메인/서브 페이지 구축). b. Revise and reorganize page contents (컨텐츠 개편). c. Implement record transfer functionality (기록물 이관 기능 구현). d. Implement record appraisal/evaluation functionality (기록물 평가 기능 구현). e. Develop additional/auxiliary user-side features (부가 기능 구현). 2) Integrated Records Utilization Environment (기록물 통합 활용 환경 구축): a. Optimize search engine and indexing (검색엔진/색인 최적화). b. Improve search result relevance and quality (검색결과 향상). c. Implement a document viewer (문서 뷰어 구현). d. Implement a video/visual records viewer (영상 뷰어 구현). e. Strengthen request and approval workflows/features (신청/승인 기능 강화). f. Develop additional/auxiliary utilization features (부가 기능 구현). 3) Integrated Records Security Environment (기록물 통합 보안 환경 구축): a. Implement unified permission/authorization framework (권한체계 구현). b. Implement audit trail and evidence/logging functions (감사증적 기능 구현). c. Develop additional/auxiliary security-related features (부가 기능 구현). 4) Performance Improvements and Other Function Development (성능 개량 및 기타 기능 개발): a. Source code and query tuning (소스/Query 튜닝). b. Implement performance monitoring environment (성능 모니터링 환경 구현). c. Implement and strengthen statistical/analytics functions (통계 기능 구현/강화). d. Implement maintenance/operation management functions (유지보수 관리 기능 구현). e. Integrate administrator functions (관리자 기능 연동). f. Strengthen e-history/e-archive content management features (e-역사관 컨텐츠 관리 기능 강화). g. Implement manual/documentation management features (매뉴얼 관리 기능 구현). 5) Data Standardization and Management (데이터 표준화 적용 및 관리): a. Cleanse and migrate electronic record user DB (전자기록관DB(이용자) 정비/마이그레이션). b. Cleanse and migrate electronic record admin DB (전자기록관DB(관리자) 정비/마이그레이션). c. Cleanse and migrate electronic record content DB (전자기록관DB(기록물) 정비/마이그레이션). d. Perform data quality diagnosis and fix DB errors (데이터 품질진단 수행 및 DB 오류 개선 등). These workstreams together define the RFP's required deliverables: a full user-page redesign, integrated search/viewing and approval capabilities, strengthened permission and audit mechanisms, performance tuning and monitoring, enhanced admin and content-management tools, and comprehensive DB cleanup/migration and data-quality remediation.

question: List and describe, by requirement category, all the specific functional, security, data, constraint, performance/quality/testing/interface, strategy/methodology, project-management, and support requirements the proposer must satisfy for the '대용량 자료전송시스템 고도화' project according to the RFP (include scope-of-work items such as migration, module redevelopment, transmission/process changes, and user/account/logging requirements).
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Strategy & Methodology (STA): STA-01 Apply technologies and standard frameworks - proposer must describe applied technologies and frameworks, considering future scalability, practical feasibility, realizability, innovation and modernity of the proposed technologies. STA-02 Development methodology - propose the development methodology and procedures; list experience; map methodology to deliverables and submission schedule; explain full lifecycle, tools and techniques (analysis, design, development tools), and project management practices (risk, quality, schedule, resource, configuration management); maintain architecture similarity to existing system and preserve existing functions unless changes are agreed with the client; ensure systematic management from project start to finish. STA-03 Information integration plan - present approaches for information linkage (as required). 2) Functional / System Requirements (SOR / SFR): SOR-01 System and system operation requirements - overall system operation obligations. SFR-01 Large-volume data transfer management - develop/enhance management of large data transfers. SFR-02–SFR-05 Safety-mail features - implement safe-mail general/request/receive/send processes and improve safe-mail processes and usability. SFR-05 / SFR-06 Mail/data import and export - develop new large-data import (반입) functionality for external researchers and improve export (반출) processes; increase import/export capacity and optimize transmission processes. SFR-07 User convenience features - provide browser-based, multi-environment-accessible services (web browser delivery) and other user-friendly functions. SFR-08 Account management - strengthen user and administrator account management. SFR-09 General management - administrative functions. SFR-10 Policy management - policy control. SFR-11 Approver (결재자) management - implement approver management. SFR-12 Imported-data antivirus scanning - perform vaccine/antivirus checks on imported data. SFR-13 Received-data antivirus scanning - perform vaccine/antivirus checks on received data. SFR-14 Other functions - any additional functional requirements identified. Additional scope items specified in 사업범위: redevelopment of integration modules for replaced/legacy devices; data migration from old infrastructure to new; maintain existing data-transfer system functionality with minimal configuration changes; remove VPN functionality and change large-mail authentication scheme; compress/executable-file controls and enhanced logging for imports/exports; capacity expansion for large-mail and large-data transfers; transfer-speed improvements via inter-network transmission technology enhancements; workflow improvements for import data handling; and preservation of existing functions unless removal/change is agreed with the client. 3) Security Requirements (SER): SER-01 Security technology application - apply appropriate security technologies. SER-02 Follow secure coding guidelines. SER-03 Common security general requirements - include logging/audit requirements and account/audit control improvements as described in scope (strengthened logging, account management, audit trail). Additional security scope: protect against malware and hacking through improved security features; apply 국방부 directives and security countermeasure requirements where applicable. 4) Data Requirements (DAR): DAR-01 Data standardization. DAR-02 Compliance with data standards and standards management. DAR-03 Data structure design, validation and management. DAR-04 Data value and migration validation - verify values and migrated data during data transfer. DAR-05 Data management framework. 5) Constraints (COR): COR-01 Apply the e-Government standard framework. COR-02 Comply with the Personal Information Protection Act (개인정보보호법). COR-03 Submit software project information to the SW project repository. COR-04 Intellectual property joint ownership and promotion of SW output reuse. COR-05 Propose a technology-application plan (기술적용계획). 6) Performance, Quality, Testing, Interface (PER / QUR / TER / INR): PER-01 System performance general requirement. QUR-01 Quality management approach - proposer must present quality control/assurance plans. TER-01 Integrated testing - perform integration tests. TER-02 Acceptance/inspection testing - perform 검수 시험. INR-01 Interface standards compliance. INR-02 Information system interconnection - ensure linkage with other information systems. 7) Project Management Requirements (PMR): PMR-01 Management methodology - present project management approach. PMR-02 Schedule planning - detailed schedule (note: contract period is up to 5 months). PMR-03 Configuration management - versioning and change control. PMR-04 Workplace coordination and enablement of remote-site development - agree on worksite arrangements and support remote development. 8) Project Support Requirements (PSR): PSR-01 Quality assurance (품질보증). PSR-02 Test operation and training - provide test operation and user/administrator education and training. PSR-03 Maintenance and warranty (하자보수) plan - provide maintenance and post-deployment defect repair. PSR-04 Confidential security and contingency plans - provide confidentiality, emergency responses and business continuity measures. 9) Additional Scope & Operational Expectations: - Minimize configuration changes to existing software for efficiency and speed of delivery. - Provide web-browser based services considering diverse user environments. - Ensure migration and re-integration of legacy devices and data, including redevelopment of integration modules for replaced/old equipment. - Maintain or consult before removing existing functionality; engage client in change decisions. - Produce and submit specified deliverables per the development methodology and agreed schedule, including test reports (착수, 중간, 완료 보고 marked in schedule). - Enable enhanced logging, account and policy controls (무단연람체계, 결재자관리, 사용자 용량관리) and strengthen controls over compressed/executable files for import/export. - Ensure antiviral scanning for imported and received data and validation of migrated data values and structures. All items above must be addressed in the proposal and detailed in the 업무분석 stage, with any extra-required functions explicitly identified by the proposer.

question: What are the detailed functional, integration, data migration, security, and non‑functional requirements specified in the RFP for the GKL groupware, records management, and internal messenger systems?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Groupware functional requirements: a) Portal must display key information per system, provide links to each system and notifications; b) Electronic approval must support creation, viewing, management and distribution of electronic documents (drafting, approval, electronic send/receive), mobile submission from groupware devices, document distribution and original-document disclosure; c) Mail must support internal/external mail send/receive and integration/data linkage with internal/external dedicated webmail systems to improve work convenience; d) Integrated features such as bulletin boards (segregated Pages for sharing), meeting-room/resource reservation and schedule management, and an integrated search UI connected to e-approval and records-management systems. 2) Mobile and SNS requirements: a) Mobile environment must support the same groupware functions as desktop (parity of capability); b) The mobile SNS (별별얘기) must support employee search, organization chart, major schedules, CSR, management goals & performance, leave requests, pay inquiry, certificate requests, timeline, notices, etc. 3) Records management functional requirements: a) Record viewing: application/approval workflow for record access and electronic-document permission management; b) Record appraisal/review: functions for appraisal, disposal, and reclassification workflows; c) Record transfer: features to transfer electronic documents generated by the e-approval system; d) Classification management: create/delete/manage classification trees; e) Access control: secure viewer to control download/print and to enforce viewing restrictions; f) Auditing: generation of logs for record viewing, printing and related actions; g) Preservation format conversion: convert electronic documents to the National Archives standard preservation format (PDF); h) Development of connectors/adapters for integration with e-approval and public disclosure (원문정보공개). 4) Messenger and messaging system requirements: a) Rebuild the enterprise messenger to provide stable service; b) Implement a new employee-only messenger integrated for both internet and internal networks. 5) Data migration requirements: a) Migrate existing produced electronic-approval documents and other target documents (existing e-documents) into the new system (electronic document migration / 이관); b) Ensure migration includes preservation of necessary metadata and supports subsequent records-management transfer processes. 6) Integration / interface requirements: a) Provide customization and interfacing to connect with existing and new systems (기관환경 최적화) including IT service management (ITSM), accounting & budget, procurement & asset systems, messenger, webmail, proposal system, emergency reporting, electronic contracts, integrated search solutions, and e-approval/records-management linkage; b) Enable linkage with a next‑generation electronic document distribution system (전자문서 유통시스템) and modernize document distribution flows. 7) Security and policy compliance requirements: a) Remove non‑standard controls (e.g., ActiveX) and IE dependencies and address related security vulnerabilities to comply with government‑recommended policies; b) Implement document-level protection (secure viewer, download/print control) and logging; c) Align with external security controls already in place (DB access control, DB encryption, server security, DRM, print security) as part of the overall environment. 8) Non‑functional and operational requirements: a) Web‑based architecture to enable operation in diverse web environments and seamless integration with existing systems; b) Prioritize user convenience and redesign business processes to improve usability; c) Improve management efficiency and system stability — minimize failure points and ensure stable service delivery; d) Provide necessary customization to optimize the institution environment; e) Support integrated search across systems (electronic approval, records management, etc.). 9) Existing environment / interoperability constraints: a) The solution must interoperate with the current information‑system stack as listed (examples given: virtualization Vsphere, HP DL380 servers, Oracle DBMS, JEUS WAS/WEB, Windows AD, existing groupware/ubiflow, Haram-i for 원문공개, Talkon for SNS/messenger, DRM, PDF conversion and integrated-search products); b) Detailed system/infrastructure diagrams and version information are restricted and available only under security non‑disclosure/onsite review per the referenced guidelines.

question: Summarize in detail the contractor's required responsibilities, staffing/shift constraints, monitoring/control/recording/analysis/documentation obligations, provided/required equipment and training, operating locations and excluded areas, systems to be used, and schedule constraints for operating the 2025 중이온가속기용 극저온시스템 during 가동기간 and 휴지기간 according to the RFP.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Overall scope and period: a) The contract covers operation of the 중이온가속기용 극저온시스템 for 2025 (2025-01-01 to 2025-12-31) and must support both 가동기간 (operation/cooling/beam service) and 휴지기간 (maintenance/standby) as described; b) Actual assignment of 가동기간 vs 휴지기간 may change per the 연구원’s operational plan (Table 2 schedule is indicative). 2) Staffing and supervision: a) Contractor must provide an appropriate number of qualified operators for the tasks; b) During 가동기간 a 24-hour operation is required; 24-hour shifts are to be manned with 2-person teams as a baseline (2인 1조); c) During daytime in 가동기간 at least one task/supervising operator must be present in the control room; d) During 휴지기간 operation is normally daytime (주간) and staffing should reflect that; e) Contractor must manage and supervise personnel and the personnel assigned to this contract. 3) Monitoring duties (가동기간): Contractor must continuously monitor the cryogenic system to ensure safe/stable operation using the control system and/or field devices. Specific monitoring tasks listed (Table 4) must be performed: 1. Check alarm messages; 2. Check major sensor trends (temperature, pressure, flow, speed, etc.); 3. Know and familiarize with normal operational values of key sensors (temperature, pressure, flow, speed, etc.); 4. Detect abnormal operational conditions; 5. If research staff request on-site confirmation, observe/confirm values and report the situation (use provided radio communications); 6. Verify correct operation of control logic; 7. Temporarily or continuously observe field conditions when requested by 연구원 (limited to non-radiation areas); 8. Other monitoring needed for operational awareness, including periodic field patrols. 4) Control duties: Contractor must perform cryogenic system control tasks during both 가동기간 (24h control) and 휴지기간 (for maintenance support). Control tasks include those necessary to maintain safe and stable operation and to support maintenance activities; tasks not specified in the document will be decided by 협의 between 연구원 and contractor. 5) Recordkeeping and analysis: a) Contractor must record operational situations whenever they change and must record key sensor values at periodic time intervals (the specific items and recording intervals are determined by 연구원 and may change with operating conditions); b) Records must be maintained as electronic files; c) On request by 연구원, contractor must perform analyses of the recorded key values—analysis scope, methods and deliverable formats are determined by 연구원. 6) Documentation, training and reporting (주로 휴지기간 obligations): During 휴지기간 the contractor must focus on integrating and documenting operational experience and must: a) Prepare and revise the cryogenic system operation manuals (운전 매뉴얼 작성 및 개정); b) Provide operation training (극저온시스템 운전 교육); c) Hold performance/reporting meetings (성과보고회 개최); d) Perform documentation of integrated operational experience (문서화). 7) Operating targets (devices and areas): Contractor must operate the devices listed in Table 3, including but not limited to: a) SCL3 and SCL2 cryoplants (including compressors, regeneration systems, 2 K systems and all ancillary equipment) located in the cryogenic equipment building and helium compressor building; b) Cryogenic distribution systems: TBx (in cryogenic building), SCL3 LINAC distribution (SCL3 tunnel/ISOL section — valve boxes, superconducting cavity cold maintenance modules, vacuum pumps for valve-box insulation), SCL2 LINAC distribution (SCL2 tunnel/IF section — similar items); c) Recovery systems: external purifiers (external), recovery compression system (helium compressor building), gas bag (helium compressor building), helium tanks (external — including gaseous helium quantity management), liquid nitrogen system (external — including LN2 quantity management). 8) Locations and exclusions: a) Operation locations are not limited to the cryogenic equipment building 2nd-floor control room; they include field operations in the cryogenic equipment building and helium compressor building; b) Radiation areas (SCL3/SCL2 LINAC radiation zones) are excluded from allowed operation locations — field observations are limited to non-radiation areas as noted. 9) Control/monitoring systems and provided equipment: a) Contractor will use the 연구원’s established control systems: WinCC GUI for SCL3 cryoplant, SCL2 cryoplant and recovery system; CS-studio GUI for SCL3 and SCL2 LINAC monitoring (Table 5); b) 연구원 will provide the contractor with computers, monitors, keyboard, mouse, desks and chairs to access the installed control systems; c) 연구원 will provide basic user training for the installed control systems and the contractor must possess the background knowledge necessary to understand that training; d) For recording/analysis tasks, contractor is expected to have necessary portable computing accessories (the document specifies notebooks and keyboard/mouse accessories for recording/analysis). 10) Communications: 연구원 will supply radios for on-site communications; contractor must use radio communications when relaying field confirmation or status as requested by 연구원. 11) Formats and constraints: a) All records must be electronic files; b) The set of key measurement items, recording intervals, and analysis deliverable forms are determined by 연구원 and may be adjusted depending on operating conditions; c) Any operating tasks not explicitly described in the RFP are to be agreed between 연구원 and contractor before execution.

question: What are the comprehensive technical and functional requirements for the '설비 온라인 시스템' to be implemented (including real-time monitoring, data collection protocols, Lot tracking, interfaces with the new process management system, H/W·S/W environment, and non-functional/operational constraints) as described in the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Real-time equipment monitoring and communication management: implement 설비 통신 온라인 기준정보 관리, 설비별 상태 및 리소스 조회, 통신 및 테스트 기능, 및 설비별 로그 분석 및 데이터 확보 기능 to enable real-time monitoring and diagnostics of FAB equipment; 2) Data collection protocols and support: build SECS / Non-SECS data collection system with SECS 통신 지원 for process equipment data 수집 및 분석 체계 마련; support PLC 통신 and 기타 설비통신 프로토콜 through HMI 장치; 3) Lot tracking and Carrier handling: design, install and integrate Carrier ID 인식 장치; provide Carrier 정보 표시 및 작업자 인터페이스 화면; build Carrier 정보 기반 공정관리시스템 인터페이스 and LoT Tracking 환경; 4) Integration with 新공정관리시스템: provide interfaces for Recipe 관리 및 이력 관리 환경 by 연계하여 공정결과 및 조건데이터의 관리체계 확립; ensure middleware-level integration for JSON-based communication with EAP and other systems; 5) HMI and data acquisition stack: prepare HMI 장치 통신, SECS통신, PLC통신 프로토콜 구현 및 데이터 수집 체계 구축 to unify data flows from equipment to centralized systems; 6) System architecture and platform requirements: DB: Oracle 19c (新공정관리시스템 Database; 본 사업 DB는 Instance 분리 제공 가능); Middleware: Kafka 3.x.x for JSON-based 연동 (EAP 등 연계대상); OS/Virtualization: Windows DataCenter on Hyper-V (VM 및 OS 제공 가능 — Windows Server 및 Open OS(Rocky) 제공 가능; 제공 Spec 별도 협의); Web/WAS: WebTob 5.x Standard (Web), Jeus 8.x Standard (WAS) (TmaxSoft); 7) Data governance and analytics planning: design 데이터 수집, 데이터 분석, 데이터 가공 모델을 K-MDS 연계 고려하여 제시; 설비 특성 진단 및 데이터 취합을 위한 개선 방향과 분석 모델 설계; 8) Future automation and scalability: propose 설비자동화 및 데이터 분석 모델, 인프라·시스템 구성 및 단계별 구축 방향 제시 to support 확장성 및 향후 스마트化; 9) Operational and project constraints / non-functional requirements: 사용자 중심 시스템 구축 및 현업 중심 TFT 운영, 원활한 의사소통(주간/월간/수시 회의), 표준화 지침 준수 및 구성요소 표준화, 시스템 유지관리 효율성 고려한 최적 구축 방법론 적용, 표준화된 아키텍처로 시스템 확장성·사용편의성 확보, 운영 중인 시스템과 新공정관리시스템 간 업무 연속성 보장 및 연계 가능한 시스템 구축, 목표 시스템에 대한 정확한 이해 및 위험요소 사전관리로 계약기간(사업기간) 내 안정적 수행; 10) Deliverables and scope constraints: provide 설비온라인 시스템 구축(기술원 보유 장비·설비 대상), SECS/Non-SECS 수집 및 LoT Tracking 환경, 공정데이터(Recipe/이력) 관리 연계, 미래 설비환경 개선진단 및 목표 시스템 모델, 단계별 이행방안 및 소요예산·기대효과 산정.

question: Synthesize the RFP's detailed technical, functional, security, testing, constraint, project-management, and post-deployment requirements for the file-encryption solution. In other words, what exactly must the vendor deliver and comply with (scope, modules, verification, security measures, standards/constraints, management/delivery obligations, and maintenance/training expectations)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Scope / Target Systems: a) Apply file encryption to all existing attachment files (일괄 암호화). b) Apply file encryption / decryption (암·복호화) modules to multiple university services: 학부 학사포털, 대학원 학사포털, 평생교육원 학점은행 학사포털, 연구행정·업적관리 시스템, 학생경력관리 플랫폼, and the program that queries attachment file storage. c) Use the university's virtualized infrastructure (전산원에서 운영 중인 가상화 인프라); instance specs to be finalized during requirements/design. 2) Functional Requirements: a) Support bulk encryption of existing files and ensure post-encryption file count matches pre-encryption count (SFR-001). b) After bulk encryption, verify decryption via the introduced DRM API service. c) Integrate / apply encryption/decryption modules into existing systems (SFR-002) so files are recorded and managed only by the university's authorized/approved systems. d) Provide an overall strategy/plan for encryption solution adoption and application (PLR-001). 3) Planning / Strategy Requirements (PLR-001 specifics): a) Present a comprehensive adoption and application strategy. b) Strategy must explicitly include: method for encrypting existing files, approach for integrating or supporting integration of 암/복호화 modules with university systems, and mandatory provision of encryption-solution certificates. c) Demonstrate understanding of the university's business characteristics and reflect per-service detailed requirements to minimize risks and ensure accurate service. d) Ensure system extensibility and maintainability so future systems can more easily adopt the 암/복호화 module. 4) Security Requirements: a) Comply with security requirement categories (SER-001 책임 및 보안 기본사항, SER-002 관리적 보안 대책, SER-003 기술적 보안 대책) — i.e., define responsibilities and basic security measures, managerial security controls, and technical security controls as required by the RFP. b) Strengthen file-system security to reduce personal data leakage impact: encrypted files must be unreadable even if original files are exposed. c) Provide required encryption solution certificates (authentication). 5) Testing and Performance Requirements: a) Meet TER-001 (성능 및 테스트) — perform performance testing and validation that the deployed system meets objectives. b) Verify DRM API-based decryption works after bulk encryption. c) Conduct verification of file encryption application (파일 암호화 적용 검증) during the schedule phases. 6) Quality Requirements: a) Ensure functional implementation accuracy (QUR-001). b) Follow quality management requirements (QUR-002). c) Meet system quality requirements (QUR-003). 7) Constraints and Standards (COR items): a) Ensure system implementation flexibility (COR-001). b) Prepare 기술적용계획표 및 결과표 (COR-002). c) Comply with the Personal Information Protection Act (개인정보보호법 준수) (COR-003). d) Adhere to web standards and compatibility (COR-004). e) Follow secure coding / software development security guidelines (시큐어코딩) (COR-005). f) Observe intellectual property ownership provisions (지적재산권 귀속) (COR-006). g) Comply with public SW project restrictions on large-company participation (COR-007), joint-supply restrictions (COR-008), subcontracting limits (COR-009), contract termination rules (COR-010), and responsibility clauses (COR-011). 8) Project Management Requirements: a) Define and operate an appropriate project execution organization (PMR-001). b) Provide system trial operation (시스템 시험운영) (PMR-002). c) Define defect-latency / warranty (하자보수 기간) (PMR-003). d) Provide deliverable (산출물) management plan (PMR-004). e) Follow the RFP's staged schedule: system analysis, bulk encryption of existing files, application of modules to existing systems, encryption application verification, and final acceptance (사업 검수 완료). 9) Project Support, Maintenance and Training: a) Provide education and technical support (PSR-001). b) Provide defect repair / warranty services (PSR-002 / PSR-005 as applicable). c) Provide ongoing technical support to ensure smooth operation and stabilization (PSR-003). d) Fulfill other specified support matters (PSR-004). e) Prepare and submit SW project repository data (SW 사업정보 저장소 데이터 작성 및 제출) (PSR-005). 10) Deliverables / Verification Artifacts: a) Encryption solution strategy document including integration approach and maintainability considerations. b) Bulk-encryption results and reconciliation showing pre- and post-encryption counts match. c) DRM API decryption verification evidence. d) Certificates for the encryption solution. e) Test reports (performance and functional), quality management records, and required 기술적용계획표/결과표. f) Documentation and deliverables required for acceptance and for SW project repository. 11) Administrative / Procurement Notes: a) The project is a software-development-type procurement following the standard duration estimation guideline. b) Contracting is by negotiated limited competitive bidding (협상에 의한 계약 제한경쟁입찰). 12) Non-functional / design-level expectations: a) Improve security such that even if original files are leaked, contents cannot be opened. b) Enhance maintainability and extensibility so future systems can adopt the encryption/decryption module with ease. c) Use communication, collaboration, reporting (보고회/시연) in analysis/design/validation phases as part of management strategy. 13) Implementation obligations related to system environment: a) Coordinate with the university's IT center providing virtualized environment and finalize instance specifications in requirements/design phase. 14) Mandatory adherence clause: a) Proposer must study and base proposals on all RFP-provided materials and may propose additional unlisted requirements at their discretion, but must comply with all specified RFP question: What are the specific functional and non‑functional requirements and operational constraints for the upgraded APC‑HUB homepage and online education system (covering TTS, video playback and optimization, admin/management features, 3D exhibition content, security, compatibility, maintenance, testing and training) as specified in the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Homepage functional requirements: the homepage (English) must be upgraded to apply latest web standards, accessibility and compatibility so it works correctly across multiple web browsers and a variety of devices including mobile; improve homepage banners and card designs; implement user‑friendly UI/UX and performance improvements; add 3D online promotional/exhibition content management features (change 3D exhibition background, add 3D objects, and support on‑click 3D object interactions such as descriptions and animations); and provide overall homepage maintenance (including vulnerability checks). 2) TTS (Text‑to‑Speech) functional requirements: build an automatic TTS conversion system that converts Korean and English text contained in slide notes of PPT, HanShow, PDF (lecture slide notes) into Korean or English speech; integrate the TTS with existing lecture materials so slide notes are rendered as audio during playback. 3) TTS administration requirements: provide administrator web‑page functions to allow admins to change TTS system settings and perform management/editing tasks related to the TTS conversion system (i.e., add admin controls for configuration and editing). 4) Video playback and optimization requirements: implement video resolution selection to let learners choose video quality (examples noted: 1080P, 480P) according to network conditions; optimize video delivery selection based on network environment. 5) Playback behavior and controls: enable random playback mode for online education videos (current system plays sequentially only) to improve learning efficiency; display a progress bar (learning progress indicator) during education content playback; and for videos already marked as "completed," remove forward/backward movement restrictions so learners may freely seek and repeat desired sections (whereas prior/uncompleted videos remain restricted from forward skipping). 6) Admin/content management requirements: improve detailed content editing functions so administrators can effectively modify content that currently cannot be edited via the admin page; allow admins to toggle display of quizzes and surveys (On/Off); provide admin control to enable/disable the player’s anti‑cheating detection features (On/Off). 7) Security and maintenance requirements: upgrade web security technologies to defend against new hacking methods and vulnerabilities; perform ongoing vulnerability checks and maintenance in coordination with the agency that manages the servers (National Information Resources Service, Gwangju Center); homepage maintenance must include vulnerability scanning and remediation as agreed. 8) Compatibility, accessibility and standards constraints (non‑functional): the system must comply with up‑to‑date web standards, be cross‑browser and cross‑device compatible (including mobile), and meet accessibility requirements to ensure equal access for persons with disabilities and the elderly. 9) Operational environment and coordination constraints: coordinate in advance with the National Information Resources Service (Gwangju Center) because that center manages the servers for the hub; follow their procedures/manuals (e.g., the referenced integration manual for hosted institutions) for environment setup and deployment. 10) Testing, QA and delivery obligations: perform unit tests, completion testing, performance testing and final server‑integration (server linkage) tests; final operational test must be completed with the National Information Resources Service; provide user operation training (user operational education) prior to handover; submit deliverables and complete acceptance checks at project close. 11) Project management/contract constraint: the work includes maintenance and any other items agreed during the engagement (i.e., "other agreed matters"), and must be executed in accordance with the project schedule and acceptance/testing milestones specified (unit tests, completion & tests, server final tests, user training, result submission and project close).

question: What are the system-level technical, security, integration, testing, and operational requirements that proposals must satisfy for the MILE platform according to the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Development environment and standards: implement the system within Daejeon University's existing integrated information system development environment and apply the university's standard development guides; the system must integrate with the university's IT resources. 2) Future-oriented, non-disruptive design: design a future-oriented architecture that can realize the final target system and be applied without requiring changes to the overall system structure. 3) Data encryption: encrypt major fields (e.g., resident registration numbers, passwords) — these must be processed in encrypted form. 4) Integrated data design: new MILE functions must be designed integratively to support user information unification and organic data linkage. 5) Stakeholder collaboration and requirements acceptance: detailed planning and configuration must be done in cooperation with the university and actively incorporate the university's requirements. 6) Impact analysis and safe changes: analyze functions that directly or indirectly affect existing integrated systems, identify issues, and improve them so there are no operational problems. 7) Mandatory additional development: if necessary to meet the project's purpose, complete additional development even if not explicitly documented in the RFP; such items must be considered and included in the proposal. 8) Use of university equipment and DB migration: build using equipment owned by the university and, if needed, perform migration of existing operational system databases. 9) Security vulnerability handling: during development, implement countermeasures for all known security vulnerabilities. 10) High availability and solution stability: propose solutions and components that can guarantee 365-day continuous (no-downtime) support, with stability, reliability, and efficiency; include installation, testing, and stabilization work in the proposal. 11) Extensibility: propose solutions/SW that allow future new business to be added without changing the overall system structure. 12) Ancillary equipment and SW specifications: provide detailed specifications and functions for all accompanying equipment and software, clearly distinguishing between proposed (standard) specs and maximum specs. 13) Latest, well-supported SW: all proposed software must be up-to-date products that integrate with the university's IT resources, enable optimal operation, and offer the best possible technical support. 14) Minimum baseline composition: proposed software must at least meet the basic specifications presented in the RFP. 15) Required SW inclusion: include all software that the university's configuration requires, ensuring every demanded function is met. 16) Integrated operations & monitoring: provide an integrated management proposal for heterogeneous servers, networks, DBs, etc., supporting predictive fault detection, rapid fault response, performance analysis, and efficient resource utilization. 17) Code quality and script simplification: involve a script-analysis expert to minimize complex or obfuscated coding; simplify scripts, enforce coding rules, and improve coding structure. 18) Comprehensive test planning: prepare systematic and efficient test plans covering personnel, data, procedures/methods, schedule, tools, and system optimization measures. 19) Phased testing with legacy systems: perform stepwise testing (unit tests, interface/connection tests, integration tests) in conjunction with existing core/period systems. 20) Minimize service disruption: analyze the current operating environment thoroughly and present a schedule that minimizes business interruption due to system construction. 21) Mobile app maintenance plan: provide an outsourced maintenance/operation plan for mobile applications.

question: What are the specific functional requirements (SFR-001 to SFR-008) specified in the RFP for the 기업 재생에너지 지원센터 홈페이지 개편 및 시스템 고도화 사업? Provide a comprehensive list including each requirement ID, name, definition, and the detailed contents.
ground_truth:
The requirements include:
1) SFR-001 — '재생 e 매칭 지원' 기능 고도화
   - 정의: ‘재생 e 매칭 지원’ 기능 강화를 위한 고도화 내용
   - 세부 내용: ○ 계약유형(REC/PPA)에 따른 세분화된 입력 항목 개발(발주처와 협의) ○ 채팅/댓글 등을 통한 소통 창구 마련 ○ 매칭 후 거래 진행 상태 단계 표출(협의중, 계약서 작성중, 계약완료 등) ○ 재생에너지 계약 지원 콘텐츠 업로드 게시판 신설 및 내용구성

2) SFR-002 — '재생에너지 사용 자가진단' 기능 고도화
   - 정의: ‘재생에너지 사용 자가진단’ 기능 내 자가진단툴 도입 및 개선
   - 세부 내용: ○ 재생에너지 사용 자가진단툴 고도화(7월 완료) 기능 온라인 구현 ○ 직접입력 값 외에 자동추세(단가하락 및 요금 상승) 선택 옵션 추가 ○ 재생에너지 사용으로 인한 편익 발생 시점 및 비용편익 계산 ○ 자가진단 결과화면 디자인 및 저장기능 추가 — 자가진단 웹페이지 창을 축소할 경우 관련 내용이 보이지 않는 부분 조치

3) SFR-003 — 콘텐츠 추가·보강
   - 정의: 신규 콘텐츠 추가 및 보강
   - 세부 내용: ○ 메인페이지 공시정보 추가·확대(RE100용 REC 거래가격, RPS REC 거래가격, LCOE, SMP, 산업용 전기요금, 배출권가격 정보 등) — 전력거래소 및 한전과 정보제공 등에 대한 협의 후 추가·변경 가능 ○ 공급망 재생 e 사용요구 관련 기업애로접수 게시판 신설 ○ '재생에너지 활용 컨설팅' 하부메뉴로 컨설팅 우수사례 게시판 신설 ○ 자료실 게시판 등 홈페이지 내 동영상 업로드 기능 추가

4) SFR-004 — 홈페이지 메인/서브 화면 디자인 전면 개선
   - 정의: 홈페이지 디자인 전면 개선(UX/UI)
   - 세부 내용: ○ UI/UX 개선 — 색상, 폰트, 레이아웃 등 디자인 요소가 브랜드 아이덴티티와 일관성 유지 ○ 모바일·태블릿·PC 등에서의 접근성을 고려한 반응형 디자인 ○ 효과적인 메시지 전달을 위한 콘텐츠 구성 및 배치 계획 ○ 정보의 가독성 향상 및 주요정보 접근 편의성 제고

5) SFR-005 — 관리자 기능 강화 및 통계 시스템 구축
   - 정의: 통계 시스템 구축 및 보고서 출력
   - 세부 내용: ○ 재생에너지 매칭 지원 게시판 통계 구축(구매자 및 판매자 정보 통계, 구매/판매 수요 물량 정보 통계, 매칭 후 계약 절차진행 현황 통계 등) ○ 각 메뉴 이용에 대한 데이터 관리 및 통계분석 기능(각 메뉴 이용자 정보 및 이용자 수 등) ○ 누적 판매/구매된 에너지 관련 정보 등 ○ 상기 데이터 활용을 위한 보고서 출력 기능 ○ 재생에너지 수요기업과 공급기업의 DB 구축 및 업데이트 가능토록 개발 — 다운로드 기능 포함

6) SFR-006 — 기타 플랫폼 연계 지원
   - 정의: 기타 플랫폼 연계 지원
   - 세부 내용: ○ 플랫폼 연계를 통한 서비스 제공 지원 — 예시: 한국에너지공단의 재생 e 사용확인서 자동발급 연계 등

7) SFR-007 — 개인정보보호 요구사항 준수
   - 정의: 개인정보보호 관련 요구사항 준수
   - 세부 내용: ○ 개인정보보호 자가진단/체크리스트 작성 지원 및 보안 점검 ○ 웹 표준 개발 가이드 기준, 데이터 보안 정책 준수 ○ 개인정보보호법 등 웹 개발 관련 법 준수

8) SFR-008 — 시스템 사용, 유지보수 및 지원
   - 정의: 시스템 사용에 필요한 지원 및 유지보수
   - 세부 내용: ○ 사용자/운영관리 매뉴얼, 가이드 등 운영 필요 자료 제공 ○ 홈페이지 개편 후 1년간 지속적 관리 및 유지보수 지원 ○ 정기/비정기적인 사용자 요청에 따른 웹페이지 내용의 수정 ○ 홈페이지 메뉴별 기능 및 온라인 서비스에 문제가 발생할 경우 긴급 복구 지원

question: What is the detailed scope of work (functional tasks and responsibilities) required for operation, maintenance, and user support of the Integrated Information Center, the nationwide games systems, and related portals as specified in the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Stable operation and maintenance of the Integrated Information Center (통합정보센터) and its server management. 2) Ensure smooth linkage and integration between the Integrated Information Center, the nationwide 장애인체육대회 홈페이지 (information website), participant-registration, draw (대진추첨) and competition-record (경기기록) systems. 3) Provide athlete-centric features: individual performance lookup (선수 개인의 실적조회) and management of sports-grade change history (스포츠 등급 변경 이력 관리). 4) Web registration and approval: validate, standardize and unify registered/approved data (웹 등록 및 승인 데이터 검증 및 통일화). 5) Bear costs and provide mechanisms for personal authentication for Integrated Information Center login (본인인증 비용 부담). 6) Provide and bear costs for remote support services for the Integrated Information Center (원격지원서비스 제공 및 비용 부담), including telephone support. 7) Operate Kakao channel remote-support and telephone-response services to assist users (통합정보센터 카카오채널 원격지원서비스, 전화응대서비스). 8) Create and maintain base/master data for newly created sports (신규 종목경기단체 생성에 따른 종목·경기등급 등 기초데이터 생성) and ensure data unification with the competition system (체전경기시스템과의 데이터 통일화). 9) Operate and maintain competition systems: participant-application and draw systems (참가신청 및 대진추첨 시스템 운영), competition-record systems (경기기록시스템 운영), and apply event-specific rules. 10) Organize and support systematic operational staff for nationwide games (운영 인력의 체계적인 구성 및 지원). 11) Reflect new events and competition-rule changes in systems (신설종목 및 경기규정 변경 반영). 12) Support design, review and simulation for a new comprehensive scoring system (신규종합점수체계 설계 안 구성·검토 및 동계·하계·학생 체전 점수 제공 및 시뮬레이션 지원). 13) Maintain website and competition-record systems per event according to each competition's participant guidelines (대회별 참가요강에 따른 홈페이지 및 경기기록시스템 유지보수). 14) Provide printing and issuance services for various competition printed materials (e.g., registration cards, certificates, 상장 발급) and handle issuance and mailing, with associated costs borne (인쇄 제작물 발급 및 발송 용역 및 비용 부담). 15) Include operation and maintenance of ancillary services: sports support portal (스포츠지원 포탈 사이트 운영 및 유지보수), e-Book service, document conversion related to the games (문서 변환작업 및 운영), and general information provision. 16) Provide ongoing user convenience services such as phone consultations and other remote support channels (원격지원서비스 전화상담 등 사용자 이용 편리성 제공).

question: Summarize the detailed requirements for system equipment composition, compatibility, licensing, product selection, installation-time acceptance, and installation/testing expectations for the new database servers and related software to be deployed in the disaster recovery system.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Capacity and quantity: All hardware and system software capacities and quantities must meet or exceed the specifications and quantities stated in the RFP. 2) Compliance with institutional policies: Introduced equipment and software must be applied/ported/added/upgraded to conform with the ordering institution's security policies, system management/operation policies, and backup policies. 3) Compatibility: Newly introduced products must be compatible with products currently in operation. 4) Licensing: Licenses for newly introduced products must be carefully reviewed and proposed to match the current system composition and the proposed number of servers, CPU cores, and capacities; license provisions should allow for reallocation when possible. 5) Time-gap consideration: Proposed servers must take into account the time difference between contract signing and installation. 6) Product selection and references: Proposed products should be the latest offerings with industry peer reference sites; proposals must use such up-to-date products. 7) Acceptance baseline: Conformance of performance and specifications will be judged based on the installation time (the installation time is the baseline for evaluating performance/spec compliance). 8) Mandatory conformance and approval: Products must meet the required performance and specifications; final approval is subject to mutual agreement between parties. 9) Installation and testing expectations: During product installation and testing, if faults, security vulnerabilities, functional deficiencies, etc., are discovered that cause significant defects for use, these issues are subject to the RFP's installation/testing scrutiny and remedial actions (i.e., such defects are not acceptable and must be addressed).
