question: Summarize all required technical and project-related requirements specified in the RFP, including counts per requirement category and the main content/expectations for each (functional, performance, interface, data, test, security, quality, constraints, project management, project support, and system equipment composition).
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) System Equipment Composition (ECR) — count: 1. Requirement: Follow the Administrative Safety Ministry notice (2023-27) to prioritize using the e‑Government Standard Development Framework (egovframe) unless there is a special reason (e.g., higher cost or maintenance difficulty). Hardware model list is provided (Lenovo ES-2697, Lenovo X3650 M5 x2, Oracle ZF3, HP DL360G10) but detailed specs require on‑site viewing. 2) Functional Requirements (SFR) — count: 9. Requirement: Specify mandatory system functions and user operations via hierarchical functional analysis tied to data needs. Explicit functional improvements called out elsewhere in the RFP include: adding detailed sub‑processes within the pre‑registration (가등록) workflow; subdividing search and statistical functions and improving error tracking; adding new operator/monitoring functions (tracking data logs from registration/’national ownership’ onward); refining account/group management for stronger security; developing tracking of storage/transfer status per repository and per media; redeveloping existing integrated/installed APIs; and handling other requested feature changes. 3) Performance Requirements (PER) — count: 5. Requirement: Define processing speed/time, throughput, dynamic/static capacity, and availability targets (i.e., expected non‑functional performance metrics). 4) Interface Requirements (SIR) — count: 4. Requirement: Define system-to-external interfaces and user interface needs, including software/hardware/communication interfaces, protocols for data exchange with other systems, and user‑centric aspects (usability and user experience). 5) Data Requirements (DAR) — count: 4. Requirement: Describe initial data build and data conversion targets and methods, identify data subject to transformation, and specify data that require special security handling for system services. 6) Test Requirements (TER) — count: 2. Requirement: Provide performance testing (BMT) for introduced equipment and test/check that the built system operates correctly against targets (integration/acceptance testing and related test items). 7) Security Requirements (SER) — count: 6. Requirement: Ensure confidentiality and integrity of information assets by controlling access to data, functions, and operations. RFP also requires enhanced user log tracking and account group segmentation to strengthen security and enable traceability from registration onward. 8) Quality Requirements (QUR) — count: 5. Requirement: Specify quality management and evaluation targets covering reliability, usability, maintainability, portability, and security. 9) Constraint Requirements (COR) — count: 4. Requirement: Document pre‑identified technical, standards, business, or legal constraints affecting design, construction, or operation of the target system. 10) Project Management Requirements (PMR) — count: 5. Requirement: Define management methods and phased execution plans to ensure smooth project execution (planning, selection, analysis, design/development, testing, education, final inspection, deliverables submission, and completion reporting are implied in the schedule). 11) Project Support Requirements (PSR) — count: 7. Requirement: Describe support needed for smooth operation including system/service stabilization and operation, training and technical support, defect repair/warranty and maintenance, and other operational support tasks. 12) Aggregate: total 52 requirement items across categories. Additional contextual expectations from the RFP: use an optimized system performance based on actual operating environment analysis, improve user satisfaction via detailed requirement analysis, and deliver documentation/training and handover including technical transfer and defect repair obligations.

question: Based on the RFP, what are the required functional and non-functional technical requirements, data/document standards, system interfaces, scalability expectations, and deployment constraints the proposed 실손보험 청구 전산화 시스템 must satisfy? Provide a comprehensive, itemized list derived from the document.
ground_truth:
The system requirements and constraints specified in the RFP include the following items grouped by category. All items are taken directly from the RFP text.

1) Functional requirements
  1.1. Enable 요양기관 (병의원 및 약국) to transmit 보험금 청구에 필요한 서류 electronically to 보험사 upon the insured patient's request (‘‘진료를 받은 보험가입자의 요청에 따라 요양기관에서 보험사로 보험금 청구 필요서류를 전자적 방법으로 전송’‘). 
  1.2. Provide a 전송대행기관 role that receives 전자문서 from 요양기관 and forwards them to 가입보험사 (‘‘전송대행기관은 요양기관으로부터 전자문서를 수신받아 가입보험사로 전달’’). 
  1.3. Convert / normalize 요양기관 서류 into a 표준화된 레이아웃 so that 보험사에서 확인이 가능하도록 제공 (‘‘요양기관의 서류를 보험사에서 확인이 가능토록 표준화된 레이아웃으로 변환 사용’’). 
  1.4. Support issuance and transmission of the specific claim document types used for 실손의료비 청구: ① 진료비 영수증, ② 약제비 영수증, ③ 진료비 세부내역서, ④ 처방전 (these are listed as 필수서류). 
  1.5. Support interfaces for existing usage patterns: integration with 요양기관 단말기 / 키오스크 / 무인단말기 workflows that allow patients to select documents and transmit to insurers (as in current 무인단말기 이용 방식). 
  1.6. Coexistence/interoperability with insurer mobile/web direct-claim flows (where patients currently upload images/pdf via insurer apps), i.e., the system must accept/route electronic documents to insurer systems that currently also accept image/pdf submissions.

2) Security and data handling (non-functional) requirements
  2.1. All transmitted electronic documents must be encrypted in transit (explicit requirement: ‘‘전송되는 전자문서는 암호화되어야 함’’).
  2.2. Documents must be converted to and stored/transmitted in a 표준화된 레이아웃 so insurers can verify them (supports consistent data presentation and processing).

3) Interoperability and integration requirements
  3.1. The system must integrate with a wide variety of EMR systems used by 요양기관: many hospitals use commercial EMR packages while 일부 대형병원 use 자체 개발 EMR (EMR vendor landscape noted: 병원급 자체개발 350개, 병원급 이상에 서비스하는 EMR업체 55개; 의원급 자체개발 27개, 의원급에 서비스하는 EMR업체 43개; 기타 보건기관·약국 EMR 16개). The RFP explicitly notes that 요양기관 정보시스템 수정이 필요함 and that integration with many EMR vendors will be required (‘‘요양기관 정보시스템에 대한 수정이 필요함’’).
  3.2. Provide interfaces to deliver standardized electronic documents to 보험사 systems (보험사에서 확인 가능하도록 전송).
  3.3. Support receipt of electronic documents originating from EMR-generated records and from kiosks/단말기 used at 요양기관.

4) Scalability, performance and scope expectations
  4.1. The system must accommodate nationwide participation: 대상 요양기관 규모 phased rollout—1단계 (’24.10.25) 대상 병상 30개 이상 약 7,725개 요양기관; 2단계 (’25.10.25) 의원·약국 등 약 93,472개 요양기관 (명시된 확산 계획). 
  4.2. The system should be designed with the operational scale in mind given current claim volumes: the RFP notes 연간 약 1억건을 초과하는 보험금 청구가 이루어지고 있으며 and 처리되는 수억장의 종이서류가 존재—implying high-throughput processing and document handling requirements.
  4.3. Support for 33 participating 보험사 (손해보험·생명보험 포함, 총 33개 보험사 명시).

5) Deployment schedule and contractual constraints
  5.1. Contract/project duration: 계약일로부터 19개월 총 사업기간 (구체 단계: 1차: ’24.04~10.25, 2차: ’24.10~’25.10.25); 2단계 일정은 1차 경과에 따라 조정 가능 (RFP 명시). 
  5.2. Implementation must support the 법률 시행 일정 arising from the 보험업법 개정: 공포 ’23.10.24 → 병원급 시행 ’24.10.25 (1단계) → 의원·약국 시행 ’25.10.25 (2단계). The system must enable the One‑Stop 전산청구 architecture mandated by the law (i.e., 요양기관↔전송대행기관↔보험사 흐름).

6) Operational / business objectives the system must enable (implicit non-functional goals called out in the RFP)
  6.1. Reduce 종이서류 사용 및 관련 사회적 비용 by enabling electronic issuance/transmission. 
  6.2. Reduce 수기 입력 및 보관업무 for insurers (자동화로 업무 프로세스 개선 및 인건비 절감). 
  6.3. Reduce 요양기관 원무과 업무 부담 from 반복적 서류발급 요청 by enabling electronic issuance and forwarding.
  6.4. Improve consumer convenience via One‑Stop 전송대행기관 so patients need not perform multiple visits or manual uploads/faxes.

7) Constraints and implementation issues explicitly noted
  7.1. Many 요양기관 use commercial EMR products; therefore, EMR vendor cooperation and possibly software modification at 요양기관 will be required (explicit ‘‘요양기관 정보시스템에 대한 수정이 필요함’’). 
  7.2. The system must support phased rollout (hospital-first then clinics/pharmacies) per legal deadlines and the stated institutional counts. 
  7.3. The transmitted documents must be standardized and encrypted; adherence to those two constraints is mandatory (stated as requirements).

Note: The RFP also references attachments ([붙임1] 외주용역사업 보안특약 등) and evaluation/contracting sections (제안서 효력, 평가기준 등), which imply additional security and contractual requirements, but the explicit technical items above are those directly listed in the provided RFP excerpt.

question: Summarize the full Scope of Work required by the RFP for the 'Uzbekistan–Kyrgyzstan Climate-Response Smart Irrigation System' project, including all technical design and investigation tasks, construction and procurement responsibilities, commissioning and deliverables, project management duties, and expert deployment requirements specified in the document.
ground_truth: The Scope of Work in the RFP comprises technical, managerial, procurement, commissioning, reporting, and expert-deployment tasks as follows: 1) Overall project management and coordination: 1.1. Prepare a project implementation plan based on host-country requirements and detailed field surveys. 1.2. Conduct consultations with the host-country government to enable smooth project execution. 1.3. Select local partner firms and manage contracts (design, construction, equipment supply), including verifying division of responsibilities, progress-based payments, and handover procedures. 1.4. Establish and run effective reporting lines between design firms, contractors, and the project manager. 1.5. Create and operate project publicity (e.g., project webpage) to maximize project visibility. 2) Construction scheduling and site supervision: 2.1. Develop detailed construction schedules (공정관리) consistent with the project implementation plan. 2.2. Dispatch experts at critical construction milestones for on-site construction supervision (시공관리) and quality assurance. 2.3. Monitor and manage design changes arising during construction and implement quality-improvement measures. 2.4. Review and confirm disaster prevention and site safety measures; perform progress inspections and interim acceptance tests (기성 검사). 3) Design review and detailed engineering (실시설계): 3.1. Review basic design deliverables produced earlier: survey results, geotechnical investigation outputs, sluice/gate analyses, and water demand estimations. 3.2. Provide technical review results and agree on actions with GGGI. 3.3. Perform field investigations and base-data collection needed for detailed design and cost estimates: meteorological and hydrological data, existing river and hydraulic facility conditions, irrigation water usage and cropping systems, and relevant local laws/guidelines. 3.4. Conduct detailed site topographic surveys: existing-condition survey, longitudinal profiles, and cross-sections. 3.5. Perform geotechnical investigations at pump and gate installation sites: borehole investigations and compensation studies. 3.6. Produce full detailed designs covering hydraulic analyses (catchment characteristics, long-term runoff analysis, flood analysis), water supply calculations (agricultural water demand), and detailed civil/structural, mechanical (pumping equipment), electrical, and auxiliary facility designs including: location, capacity/format, and equipment specifications. 3.7. Prepare design drawings, quantity takeoffs, bill of quantities, cost estimates, specifications (시방서), and construction plans; coordinate and finalize with relevant agencies. 4) Bidding, procurement, and equipment supply: 4.1. Prepare bid documents for detailed design consultants and for construction contractors. 4.2. Support selection of local design and construction firms (입찰계획 수립, 입찰서류 작성, 현지 입찰 진행). 4.3. Procure and position major equipment (중요 기자재 배치 및 공급) that are not locally procured by the contractor; support customs clearance and transport in consultation with the client (통관 및 운송 지원은 수원기관과 협의). 5) Construction works (시설물 구축): 5.1. Execute construction of one pumping station and one gate structure (양수장 1개소, 수문 1개소) through selected local constructor(s). 5.2. Provide on-site supervision and construction inspection by dispatched experts to ensure conformity to design and specifications. 5.3. Verify suitability of local and imported construction materials: check specifications and test results. 5.4. Manage commissioning (시운전), prepare operation/maintenance manuals, and complete as-built and handover documentation (준공도서 검토 및 준공검사, 시설물 인수인계). 6) Design supervision (설계감리): 6.1. Verify that design consultants apply host-country laws and design standards, assess design methods for appropriateness, constructability and economic feasibility, and perform supervision of deliverables (내역서 등). 7) Deliverables and submission timings: 7.1. Design bid result report — submit at contract signing (계약 체결시); format: Korean; submission: official letter. 7.2. Design completion report including design documents and drawings — submit at design completion; copies and language: Korean and English; submission: official letter and bound copies. 7.3. Construction bid plan / construction bid documents — submit before local contractor solicitation (현지 시공사 공모 전); Korean; official letter. 7.4. Construction contractor selection result report — submit within (specified) weeks after selection; Korean; official letter. 7.5. Expert dispatch plan — submit one week prior to dispatch (파견 주전); Korean; official letter. 7.6. Expert dispatch result report — submit within one week after dispatch end (파견 종료 후 주내); Korean; official letter. 7.7. Inception report — submit within specified months after contract (계약 후 개월 이내); Korean; official letter. 7.8. Monthly progress reports — submit by the specified day each month (매월 일 이내); Korean; official letter. 7.9. Annual performance report — submit within specified months after end of annual contract (연차계약 종료 개월 이내); Korean; bound official letter. 7.10. Annual contract completion/settlement documents — submit before end of annual contract (연차계약 종료 이전); Korean; bound official letter. 7.11. Final report — submit within specified months after project end (사업종료후 개월 이내); Korean and English; bound official letter. 8) Expert deployment and local staffing: 8.1. Deploy Korean experts to manage and supervise the project in-country; establish a local office and hire local experts to collaborate with Korean specialists. 8.2. Korean experts: overall management and technical specialties as per the project staffing plan (전문가 파견 월수 및 인력 명시됨 in RFP). 8.3. Local experts — planned disciplines and primary tasks: - Civil/Geotechnical (토목): liaison with agencies, administrative support, and on-site civil works management. - Water Resources (수자원): support design, construction supervision, and contractor selection related to hydraulic works. - Mechanical/Electrical (기계전기): support design, construction supervision, and contractor selection for mechanical and electrical works. - Operator/Drivers (운전기사): dedicated local operators for operations. - Administration (행정): support surveys, reporting, and general administrative tasks. 8.4. Prepare and submit expert dispatch plan and dispatch result reports as required in deliverables. 9) Quality, safety, and regulatory compliance: 9.1. Ensure construction and designs comply with host-country laws and guidelines and with agreed technical standards; design review must check applicability of local laws and design standards. 9.2. Implement quality control, safety management, and technical guidance across construction activities. 10) Other tasks: 10.1. Provide monitoring of surveying and geotechnical investigation activities and detailed evaluation of design documents. 10.2. Propose financing options for scaling up through the broader project objectives (as part of overall project outcomes, using GGGI methodologies) where relevant to project deliverables. These components form the RFP-mandated scope: site investigations and surveys, detailed engineering (civil, mechanical, electrical), procurement of major equipment, construction and supervision, commissioning and manuals, deliverable reporting in specified languages/formats and timings, contract and partner management, and a two-tier expert deployment model (Korean + local experts) with defined discipline roles.

question: Provide a comprehensive synthesis of the chat counseling system requirements and constraints specified in the RFP: include the key functional requirements (with SFR IDs/names and the detailed task descriptions given), non‑functional/performance requirements (PER IDs/names), interface, data, testing, security, quality, constraint and project management/support requirements (IDs/names and counts), the required system/environment components (installed commercial packages and platform stack), and any integration or procurement constraints noted.
ground_truth:
The requirements and constraints in the RFP can be summarized as follows. (IDs and names are quoted exactly as in the RFP where provided.)

1) Key functional requirements and major tasks (detailed task descriptions + SFR list):
   - Major tasks / functional descriptions from "주요 과업내용":
     1) Build a web‑based proprietary chat function and implement channel and channel‑switching so real‑time chat can be routed from the 1397 call center, web (homepage), and app.
     2) Provide chat counseling that requires no separate installation for basic consultations; implement optional personal information authentication when needed.
     3) Provide 1:N counseling capability so a single counselor can handle multiple chat sessions simultaneously.
     4) Develop convenience features requested by counselors (collect and implement counselor requirements for usability).
     5) Because the project includes direct purchase of commercial software (SW직접구매), perform any additional modification/development required to integrate the directly‑purchased SW into the system.
     6) Act as the system integrator for integrating the separately procured SW; the integrator bears responsibility for integration problems (except where problems are caused by the separately procured SW itself).
   - Functional requirement items (SFR IDs and names):
     1) SFR-상담-001: 상담관리 (직접구매)
     2) SFR-상담-002: 상담설정관리 (직접구매)
     3) SFR-상담-003: 상담통계 (직접구매)
     4) SFR-상담-004: 채팅상담 (직접구매)
     5) SFR-상담-005: 채팅상담 QA (직접구매)
     6) SFR-상담-006: 채팅상담 솔루션 추가 개발
     7) SFR-연계-001: KIPOS 시스템 연계
     8) SFR-연계-002: 챗봇 시스템 연계
     9) SFR-연계-003: IVR 시스템 연계
     10) SFR-공통-001: 기능분야공통
     11) SFR-공통-002: 시스템관리
     12) SFR-공통-003: 게시판 및 공지사항

2) Non‑functional / Performance requirements (PER IDs and names):
   - PER-001: 성능 일반 요구사항
   - PER-002: CPU 사용률
   - PER-003: 메모리 사용률
   - PER-004: 네트워크 성능 최적화
   - PER-005: 웹페이지 응답

3) Interface requirements:
   - SIR-001: 시스템 인터페이스
   - Additionally, functional SFR items require interfaces/integration with KIPOS, the chatbot system, IVR, and external interfaces (the environment lists external interface systems such as iGate, MCI, EAI).

4) Data requirements (DAR IDs and names):
   - DAR-001: 데이터 표준 수립 및 상위표준 준수
   - DAR-002: 데이터 표준 관리
   - DAR-003: 데이터 구조 설계
   - DAR-004: 데이터 구조 검증
   - DAR-005: 데이터 구조 관리
   - DAR-006: 데이터 값 검증
   - DAR-007: 데이터 관리체계 수립

5) Testing requirements (TER):
   - DAR-008 TER-001: 데이터 개방 및 메타데이터 관리체계 테스트 수행 및 시험 운영
     (i.e., test and pilot operation of data opening and metadata management system)

6) Security requirements (SER IDs and names):
   - SER-001: 보안관리 및 규정 준수
   - SER-002: 시스템 구축 보안요건
   - SER-003: 보안 점검
   - SER-004: 참여인력에 대한 보안관리

7) Quality requirement:
   - QUR-01: 품질관리 조직 및 품질보증

8) Constraints and procurement/integration constraints (COR and other constraints called out in text):
   - The RFP notes 3 제약사항 (COR) (count = 3) in the requirements summary (no individual COR names listed in the excerpt).
   - Software separation/procurement constraint: Certain commercial software items will be procured separately via direct purchase (나라장터 직접구매) and provided to the system integrator; the selected integrator must integrate those SW components and is responsible for integration issues except when caused by the separately procured SW itself.
   - Project duration constraint: 사업기간 is within 4 months from contract signing.
   - Budget constraint: 사업예산 up to 230,000천원 (including VAT); SW direct purchase amount listed separately (103,400,000원).
   - Contract/procurement method: 제한경쟁(협상에 의한 계약), 긴급공고 (restricted competition by negotiation; urgent announcement) — affects schedule and procurement process.

9) Project management & support requirements and organizational roles:
   - Counts: 프로젝트 관리 요구사항(PMR) = 8 items; 프로젝트 지원 요구사항(PSR) = 4 items (no individual PMR/PSR IDs listed in the excerpt).
   - Roles and responsibilities (as listed):
     1) 서민금융진흥원 (사업 전담 현업부서): project planning, contract request, project management and support, provide requested materials, schedule management, requirements definition by work area.

10) System environment / installed commercial packages and platform stack (explicitly listed):
    - Development language: Java (JSP, EJB 등), C

    - WAS(Web server): JEUS(WEBTOB) (TMAX 등)

    - 비대면, PPR: Inzi (eFIMS, mScan, sID, iForm 등) (인지소프트 등)
    - Direct‑purchase chat SW items listed (to be procured via 나라장터): Tele‑Talk 5.0 Package; Tele‑Talk 5.0 Web Chat Module; Tele‑Talk 5.0 Admin License (2); Tele‑Talk 5.0 Agent License (10).

11) Additional operational notes related to requirements:
    - The design/process (e.g., chat→phone conversion flow) may be changed at design stage.

In sum, the RFP specifies a web‑based chat counseling system with detailed SFR items (including integration with KIPOS, chatbot and IVR), explicit performance and security requirements, defined data and testing obligations (including metadata/data opening tests), a fixed short delivery window and budget, mandatory integration of directly‑purchased commercial chat software (with integrator responsibility), and a listed platform and commercial package environment that the integrator must accommodate.

question: What technical, architectural, integration, and security standards and constraints must bidders comply with when designing and implementing the 서영대학교 차세대 교육혁신지원시스템 (3단계)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Web front-end standard: adopt HTML5 (No ActiveX) and ensure PC and mobile consistency with an HTML5-based standard UI/UX. 2) UI/UX standardization and optimization: propose unified UI/UX reflecting university identity, consider interoperability, maintenance convenience, and accessibility (웹 접근성). 3) Development environment constraints: migrate UI tool from NexacroPlatform v14 to NexacroPlatform N; use electronic government standard framework EZworks upgraded from v2 to EZworks v3.9; maintain same development environment as 2nd-phase project. 4) All systems must be converted to web services to strengthen mutual interoperability and compatibility. 5) Single sign-on / integrated login: improve legacy operating environment to support integrated logins. 6) Database consolidation: integrate databases to ensure data integrity and support unified data operation. 7) Data management and analytics: implement baseline data operations, time-point data history management, detailed analysis and data standardization to support accurate university statistics and decision support/analytics. 8) Mobile (adaptive) app support: provide adaptive mobile apps for students and staff supporting various smart devices (smartphones, tablets) and ensure mobile/PC feature parity. 9) System integration and external interfaces: support integration with on-campus systems (e.g., 증명발급, 은행수납처리 results) and external agencies (e.g., 한국연구재단, 한국장학재단, 병무청); handle inter-system linkage issues and take responsibility for related problems. 10) Functional coverage: reflect functionality of existing systems (TIS, YES, 학생통합/학생종합정보시스템, 역량기반 교육과정/성과기반, 현장실습운영시스템, M-CT인증관리시스템) or implement equivalent functions where direct reuse is not possible. 11) Security & legal compliance: comply with information security and personal data protection laws and guidelines; follow 행정기관·공공기관 정보시스템 구축·운영 지침 (행정자치부고시 제2015-45호). 12) Security standards and guides: implement OWASP Top 10 and OWSAP Guide, W3C standards for browser/OS compatibility, KISA/한국정보보호진흥원 information protection guidelines, 행정안전부 web application development security guide, mobile e-government app source code security verification guidance, and 행정안전부 software development security guide. 13) Copyright compliance: adhere to copyright law, its enforcement decree and rules. 14) Project management requirement: select and use a project management tool for project execution; all reports and review meetings must be based on data from that tool. 15) Deliverables and lifecycle responsibilities: vendor must provide end-to-end services (analysis, development, application, education, stabilization), be responsible for integration/operational impacts of existing solutions, and provide technical support, training, defect warranty, and maintenance. 16) No base H/W or S/W provided: note the RFP states no basic H/W & S/W environment is provided (H/W 및 S/W 기본 제공 환경 없음), so bidders must account for that in their proposals. 17) Standardization of code and interfaces: standardize user interfaces and various code to improve productivity and ease operation/maintenance. 18) Accessibility to IT infrastructure details: university IT infrastructure details are available only by on-site inspection and require signing a "자료열람 방문자용 보안 서약서" (visitor security pledge) before access. 19) Annexed security obligations: comply with the detailed vendor security compliance and penalty criteria provided in the annexes (별첨: 용역사업 수행업체 보안 준수사항, 사업자 보안위규 처리기준, 보안 위약금 부과 기준).

question: What are the specific system development, integration, infrastructure, security, and functional requirements defined for the '학업성취도 다차원 종단분석 통합시스템 1차 고도화' project?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Data linkage and data-dam expansion: - Confirm and connect university internal digital data generation systems (examples given: electronic attendance system, LMS/online lecture system). - Identify and integrate additional campus data sources managed by departments (입학처, 교무처, 학생처, 미래혁신원, 전산정보원). - Expand the 'data dam' scope by acquiring linkable student-related digital data across campus systems. - During the project, field names, data formats, and descriptions from departmental DBs will be made available for review. 2) Infrastructure and deployment: - Ensure the cloud-hosted integrated system (currently on Naver Cloud) is stably operable as data-dam expands. - Provide appropriate infrastructure and DB configuration to support the enlarged dataset and system load. - Maintain existing campus-network topology: relay DB server (on internal network) for 입학처/교무처 DB linkage; gateway server (internal network) performing DB integration and VPN-based linkage between campus and cloud; integrated system server hosted on Naver Cloud. - Preserve VPN connectivity between gateway server and cloud for data exchange. 3) Security and privacy requirements: - Apply personal information de-identification and security measures when linking integrated-system data. - Acknowledge that full system diagrams and sensitive details are withheld; access may be granted under a security non-disclosure/pledge and supervised on-site review if necessary. 4) Functional enhancements (system high-level features): - Add finer-grained analysis units beyond admission-year: support per-academic-year and per-registered-semester analysis. - Apply a variety of data visualization tools to analysis results. - Provide role/authority-based differentiated menu/access control for system users. - Implement a Raw Data download feature to allow data extraction for analysis. 5) New task modules / pilots: - Implement pilot development for AI application (example: advanced profiling analysis for mid-term dropout prediction). - Build a mock admissions selection simulator to support strategy for new student selection (example use case: simulate changes in subject weightings for 정시 수능 per-subject ratios). 6) Required deliverable interactions and cooperation: - Coordinate with departmental stakeholders (입학처, 교무처, 학생처, 미래혁신원, 전산정보원) for data linkage cooperation and review of constructed components. - The vendor must perform confirmation of digital data generation systems and the necessary data connection work. 7) Non-functional and programmatic constraints: - Project duration constraint: contract period is 5 months from contract signing (stated elsewhere in the document as project schedule context). - Compliance note: the project follows relevant software procurement/change governance (e.g., provisions for 과업심의위원회 requests under 소프트웨어 진흥법 제50조) and must consider applicable software-contract management guidelines. 8) Scope clarification and exclusions: - The listed data examples (admission data, 학적, student activities, satisfaction survey, external datasets such as 대학생핵심역량진단평가 results and student-life/graduation data excluding sensitive PII) are illustrative; full field-level access will be provided during project execution for integration and mapping. - Sensitive infrastructure/system details are not published in the RFP but may be disclosed under security safeguards if required for proposal preparation.

question: From the RFP, synthesize the full technical and functional scope the proposer must deliver: list required system components/infrastructure, AI capabilities, data collection and analysis features, integration and interfacing requirements, reporting/statistics/report-generation features, operational/stability/security/backup requirements, and post-deployment maintenance/training obligations.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) System components and infrastructure: - AI 삭제지원 분산환경 인프라 및 통합 업무관리시스템 운영환경 구축 (distributed AI deletion-support infrastructure and integrated work-management operation environment). - AI 삭제지원 운영서버 구축 및 안정화 작업 (operation servers for AI deletion support and stabilization). - 빅데이터 분석 서버 구축 (big-data analysis server). - 하드웨어 시스템 서버, 콜시스템 구축 및 유지관리, IDC 입주 및 설치 (hardware servers, call system build & maintenance, IDC placement/installation). - 재난 대비 데이터 백업 (data backup for disaster preparedness). 2) AI capabilities and analytics: - AI 핵심기술 융복합분석 (AI core-technology convergence analysis). - AI 기반 검색 영상물 일치율 분석 및 일치 여부 판별 (AI-based matching/ similarity analysis and match determination). - AI 기반 아동·청소년 여부 판별 및 해당 영상 검출 (AI-based child/youth detection and detection of such videos). - 온라인 SNS 및 웹사이트 유포 피해촬영물 검색 및 피해 신고 영상 기반 유포물 검색 (online SNS/website search for distributed victim videos and search based on reported videos). 3) Data collection, crawling and management: - 웹크롤링 데이터 수집 / 검색 / 관리 (web-crawling data collection, search, and management). - 통합연계 및 시스템 고도화 지원을 통한 통합업무관리시스템 구축 (integration and system advancement to build an integrated work-management system). - 타 기관 피해촬영물 검색시스템 연계(영상 DNA 값 확인 요청 등) (linkage with external agencies’ search systems to check video DNA values for duplication review). 4) Evidence, reporting and statistics features: - 채증 이미지 추출 및 채증 보고서 생성 기능 도입 (evidence image extraction and evidence-report generation). - 통계페이지 고도화 (연도별 통계 마감기능 구축 등) (enhanced statistics pages including year-based statistics closing function). - 발행 보고서 관리 기능 구축 (삭제현황 보고서 예정 목록 및 생성통계 등) (published report management: deletion-status report listing and creation statistics). - 통계 추출 기반 보고서 생성/관리 기능 및 시각화 (automated report generation/management and visualization based on extracted statistics to replace manual report creation). 5) Existing workflow and user-facing functions to integrate: - 디지털성범죄 피해 상담게시판 기능 연동: 상담신청, 삭제지원 안내, 피해지원 내용 조회, 피해지원동의서 다운로드/확인, 피해촬영물 및 동의서 업로드, 설문 응답 (integrate counseling board functions: applications, deletion-support guidance, view support details, consent download/verify, upload victim media/consent, surveys). - 콜센터 연계 및 콜 시스템 커스터마이징 (call-center linkage and call-system customization). - 상담지원, 삭제지원, 통계 등 DB 및 보고서 생성 기능 구축 (DB and report-generation for counseling, deletion support, statistics). 6) Operational, performance and automation requirements: - 분산환경 효율적 운영관리를 위한 인프라 구축 및 안정화 (efficient operation/management of distributed environment and stabilization). - 업무 자동화 필요 (automation to resolve overload caused by per-URL evidence-image generation). - AI 삭제지원 시스템과 업무 시스템 연동을 통한 삭제지원 업무의 신속성 및 보안성 강화 (integrate AI deletion-support with work system to improve speed and security). - 장애 발생 사전 예방 및 발생 시 신속 처리·이력 관리 (prevention of faults and rapid handling with history management). 7) Security, privacy and compliance: - 시스템 관리를 통한 개인정보보호 및 정보보안 강화 (strengthened personal data protection and information security via system management). - 보안침해사고에 대한 사전 예방 점검 및 신속한 대응체계 확립 (prevention checks and quick response system for security incidents). - 사업 수행 시 관련 법령·지침 준수: 소프트웨어 진흥법 등 (adhere to applicable software laws and guidelines referenced in the RFP). 8) Integration, cooperation and constraints on contracting: - 통합연계 대상에 경찰청, 한국여성인권진흥원 등 타 기관 연계 포함 (integration/coordination with police, Korean Women’s Rights Institute, etc.). - 공동계약 허용(대표사 포함 2개사 이내) 및 하도급 허용하되 관련 하도급 규정 준수 (joint contracting allowed up to 2 members; subcontracting allowed but must follow regulations). 9) Post-deployment maintenance, training and responsibilities: - 전담사업자 역할: 계약 이행, 사업 사용자 교육 및 기술이전, 하자보수 등 (responsible contractor to perform contract, provide user training and technology transfer, and defect repairs/maintenance). - 통합업무관리시스템 구축 후 운영환경 지원 및 안정적 운영 보장 (support for stable operation of the integrated system after deployment). 10) Expected outcomes (to guide deliverables): - 삭제지원 업무의 신속성·보안성 강화, 업무 효율성 제고(채증보고서 등), 세분화된 통계지표 수립 및 개인정보·정보보안 강화 (faster and more secure deletion support, improved efficiency via evidence/reporting, refined statistical indicators, and strengthened privacy/security).

question: Based on the RFP text, what are the detailed functional, non-functional and integration requirements plus relevant contractual/operational constraints for the 2024 '지도정보 플랫폼 및 전문활용 연계 시스템 고도화' project?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Multilingual '매력서울지도' service: build a travel-attractive Seoul map with multi-language support aimed at foreign visitors and integration/reuse by Seoul's foreign-language website and Visit Seoul. 2) Map information platform (스마트서울맵) common-function upgrades: enhance platform common services to support richer map visualizations and broaden departmental usage. 3) Advanced visualization services: provide diverse and rich map visualization capabilities (including new visualization functions usable simultaneously by systems sharing urban-life maps). 4) Address–coordinate conversion (geocoding/reverse geocoding) enhancements: implement accurate 좌표↔주소 변환 for 사물주소 (object addresses) to support address-based location services and location registration modules. 5) Large-volume content visualization: support high-performance visualization for very large datasets (example: 가로수트리맵 with ~300,000 trees) and related Open API usage. 6) 가로수 트리맵 현장조사 시스템: develop a field-survey system for street-tree (조경과) data collection/management. 7) Feature-level map behaviors: support background map rotation and directional arrow display (for 산책길/둘레길 services), and enable indicating facility locations within parks where points may not be fixed. 8) Open API support and external integration: provide Open APIs and enable integration with multiple internal/external consumers listed (내손안에서울/서울사랑, 서울시 외국어 누리집, Visit Seoul, 서울의 공원 누리집, 서울 두드림길 누리집, 공간정보맵, 가로수트리맵, S-Map) for shared use of map content and multilingual map content linkage. 9) Standardized, cross-web-environment compatibility: deliver a standardized platform that can easily serve diverse web environments. 10) Usability for non-experts: design an open platform usable by non-specialist public officials and civic participants (enabling participation from 공무원 and 시민사회). 11) Support for increased and evolving demand: allow extensibility to accommodate annual discovery and publication of 30–40 new urban-life maps and varied map utilization needs. 12) Personalization/localization features: support personalized and localized tourism information and promotion of Seoul-specific attractive places. 13) Operational/contractual constraints and governance: the project is subject to 소프트웨어 진흥법 제50조 (requiring a 과업심의위원회 to finalize task contents and allowing the committee to be requested if contractual task changes are needed) and must follow the '소프트웨어사업 계약 및 관리감독에 관한 지침' related provisions for software development projects. 14) Non-functional performance and accessibility expectations implied in the text: high visualization performance for large datasets, stable Open API service for multiple departmental/institutional consumers, and platform availability across various web environments (implied requirement for reliability and interoperability).

question: What is the complete scope of work and the required functional and technical components the proposer must deliver for the Seoul Metropolitan Office of Education 3-year Intelligent Informatization Strategic Plan (ISP), including platforms, infrastructure, data/AI, cloud, automation, organization, legal/regulatory and standardization requirements?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) 3‑year ISP master plan: develop a comprehensive mid‑to‑long‑term (3‑year) intelligent informatization master plan defining vision, strategy, policy directions and goals for Seoul future education; produce phased implementation plans, annual roadmaps, and year‑by‑year execution measures (organization, personnel, budget). 2) Situation analysis and evaluation: analyze and evaluate current intelligent informatization capabilities and performance; identify problems and improvement directions; conduct SWOT analysis across technology, infrastructure, legal/regulatory and human resources; evaluate and analyze results of the 1st ISP and propose corrective/modification plans. 3) Stakeholder research and requirements elicitation: perform interviews and surveys (including teacher questionnaires and analysis) and collect school/teacher/student/parent opinions to derive high‑demand new tasks and user requirements. 4) Smart platform for protecting educational activities and complaint handling: design a smart integrated platform (smart notice / 통합공지 플랫폼) linked to education‑activity protection policies and an improved complaint handling (민원처리) system; analyze current school notice/complaint systems and derive improvement measures and community/participation‑centered communication models. 5) School digital infrastructure and workload reduction: produce mid/long‑term improvement and optimization plans for whole‑school networks (campus LANs, wired/wireless), analyze current wired/wireless status and problems, and propose operation/management, maintenance and support models for continuous, systematic professional support. 6) School information support system (Tech Center) optimization: analyze current Tech Center operations (organization, staffing, tasks, operations, project modes), identify issues, and design optimized organizational/operational/standardized management and staffing models for Tech Center reorganization. 7) RPA (work automation) roadmap: analyze current RPA pilot operations and technical verification, propose improvements, identify school‑applicable RPA tasks from best practices, and present scale‑up and activation plans for broader RPA deployment. 8) Data management & big data strategy: design a strengthened data management framework and utilization strategy (data processing, analysis, monitoring), propose data linkage between information systems and big‑data utilization approaches, and propose converting Seoul education materials into DB services. 9) Generative AI and data‑centric AI adoption: identify and propose phased, technology‑aware adoption plans for data‑centric generative AI use cases (personalized services based on data analysis/inference), discover AI use cases (including chatbot/education services), and plan educational/operational environments supporting AI‑based convergence education. 10) Cloud adoption and migration: define cloud computing adoption strategy and migration plans for existing information systems, propose how to apply cloud systems for learning and work processing, and develop consolidation plans to remove duplicated, distributed systems. 11) Benchmarking and case studies: investigate and analyze latest intelligent information system implementations and other agencies' operations to derive lessons and tasks for phased system introduction. 12) Standardization and interoperability: apply data linkage and technical standardization to enhance manageability and sustainability; design expandable future models that allow new tasks and prevent duplication via common frameworks and international standards consideration (cloud, AI, metaverse, etc.). 13) Legal and security compliance: prepare measures to revise or newly draft local ordinances in response to higher‑level law amendments; provide system management/operation approaches compliant with security‑related laws and guidelines. 14) Organizational restructuring and performance measurement: propose organizational restructuring for intelligent informatization across headquarters, affiliated agencies and education support offices; design performance measurement and evaluation methods and improvement plans for activities from the 1st ISP. 15) Resource estimation and implementation planning: estimate required personnel and budget by strategic task, list inputs (투입인력) and cost projections, and provide a detailed implementation schedule (phased milestones including start/interim/close reports and technical support). 16) Outputs and deliverables: produce stage‑wise deliverables (information environment analysis, informationization status analysis, target model, mid‑long term execution plans), reports from interviews/surveys, technical verification and improvement proposals (RPA, cloud, AI), case study analyses, legal/regulatory amendment proposals, and final ISP documents with roadmaps and execution plans.

question: What are the required system interface, data migration, and integration capabilities the proposed 인사정보 전산시스템 must provide to interoperate with the existing groupware, 전자결재, and ERP(G20) systems? Specify the data elements that must be linked or migrated, expected operational behaviors (including approval/document visibility and user/account/permission handling), migration expectations for 인사발령 and 인사기록카드, attendance/유연근무 연계, and any monitoring/security/management obligations mentioned in the RFP.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Mutual linkage of user/account/permission and electronic-approval related data: the new 인사정보시스템 must guarantee mutual correlation between the currently operated systems' electronic approval (전자결재), user accounts, user permissions, electronic approval document viewing rights, and other authorization data so these elements remain consistent and interoperable across systems. 2) Integration of groupware and ERP (G20) data: the 인사관리 시스템 must integrate data from groupware and the ERP 인사 program (I-CUBE G20) so that personnel information is unified rather than maintained separately, addressing current duplicated/offline work. 3) 인사발령(appointment) data migration plan: the proposer must present a plan for transferring 인사발령 data (인사발령 데이터에 대해 이관에 대한 방안 제시). 4) 인사기록카드 (personnel record card) linkage and update workflow: build linkage between 인사기록카드 and groupware/G20 so that updates are not manual; implement a process where an employee can request updates to their 인사카드, and changes are reflected only after administrator approval. 5) Attendance/근태관리 고도화 and flexible-work integration: implement a customized 근태관리 system supporting 유연근무제 (e.g., 시차출퇴근제, 재택 등) tailored to 세종테크노파크, and ensure this is linked with overall 인사정보 so policy/근태 data are consistent. 6) Detailed searchable personnel DB: stored 인사정보 and DB 자료 must allow detailed searches by various fine-grained conditions (다양한 세부조건에 따라 상세하게 검색할 수 있도록). 7) Data linkage and monitoring with internal/external systems: design flexible data linkage and monitoring capabilities so 연계기관 및 재단 내부 정보시스템과 데이터 연계 및 모니터링이 가능하도록 유연한 설계 및 연계프로세스를 적용. 8) Reduce offline/manual duplication: integration must eliminate duplicated manual updates between systems (groupware vs ERP) and minimize offline personnel work to improve efficiency. 9) Compatibility with existing S/W/DB platforms: account for current solutions—그룹웨어: 더존 Bizbox Alpha on CentOS with MariaDB; ERP: 더존 I-CUBE G20 on Windows Server with MS-SQL—when designing interfaces and migration. 10) Security and access to detailed configuration information: comply with the '행정기관 및 공공기관 정보시스템 구축‧운영 지침' (security restrictions per 제17조); detailed 전산자원 구성 is non-disclosed for security and can be inspected only after visit and signing a security agreement. 11) Project management & governance obligations for integration: submit and follow 사업수행 계획서 및 기술적용계획표 including 품질관리, 변경관리, 위험관리, and 보안관리 as required by the guideline (제7조 참조); the proposer must include plans for quality assurance of integration points, change control for interface/requirements changes, risk mitigation for data migration/integration, and pre/post security measures to prevent leakage of important information. 12) Standardization and extensibility: adopt designs ensuring system 확장성, 호환성, and 안전성 so future integration/expansion is possible (표준화 전략). 13) Operational behaviors for approval and workflow: ensure that electronic approval documents and related viewing/authorization behaviors are retained and interoperable after integration so workflow continuity is preserved across groupware, 전자결재, and the new 인사정보 system.
source_file: 세종테크노파크_세종테크노파크 인사정보 전산시스템 구축 용역 입찰공_parsed.json

question: What are the required post-deployment support, testing, documentation, training, quality and project-management obligations the 제안사 (proposer) must fulfill after completing the 강릉어선안전국 상황관제시스템 구축사업, based on the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Installation & Commissioning: the proposer must perform supply, 설치 및 시운전 (installation and commissioning) of supplied equipment and systems (stated generally in system responsibilities). 2) Cooperation with ancillary works: the proposer must fully cooperate with 전기공사 및 기타 부대작업 등 본 사업과 연관된 제반업무 (electrical works and other ancillary tasks related to the project). 3) Operation manuals: provide 상세 운용 매뉴얼 (detailed operational manuals) required for operation after construction. 4) User training: provide 운영유지에 필수적인 사용자 교육훈련 (user education/training essential for operation). 5) Warranty & emergency support: during the 무상하자 담보기간 (warranty period) the proposer must provide 시스템 긴급장애 조치와 후속 지원 (emergency fault response and follow-up support). 6) 시험(Testing) obligations: establish 시험 계획 수립 (test plan) (TER-001) and perform 단위/통합/성능 시험 (unit, integration, and performance tests) (TER-002). 7) 품질관리 (Quality) obligations: prepare 품질관리 계획 수립 (quality management plan) (QUR-001); ensure 시스템 구축의 정확성 (accuracy/ correctness of system construction) (QUR-002); and follow rules on 자재사용 및 승인 (material usage and approvals) (QUR-003). 8) 프로젝트관리 및 산출물: clarify 프로젝트 수행조직 (project organization) (PMR-001); submit 사업수행계획서 (project execution plan) (PMR-002); perform 일정관리 (schedule management) (PMR-003); submit required 산출물 (deliverables) (PMR-004); and implement 위험관리방안 (risk management measures) (PMR-005). 9) Site safety & security: comply with 현장‧안전관리 (site and safety management) (PMR-006) and 보안관리 (security management) (PMR-007). 10) Subcontracting control: obtain 하도급계약 사전승인 등 기타 (prior approval for subcontracts and related conditions) (PMR-008). 11) Project support & stabilization: provide 하자보증 및 상호운용성 (warranty and interoperability) (PSR-001); 사용자교육 (PSR-002); 운영(사용자)메뉴얼 (PSR-003); 기술이전 (technology transfer) (PSR-004); and 시험운영 및 안정화 (trial operation and stabilization) (PSR-005). 12) Inclusion of necessary ancillary materials: supply all 부수자재 및 부대설비 (converters, splitters, cables, etc.) required to achieve project objectives (explicitly required). 13) Compliance & responsibilities: adhere to applicable 제법규의 준수 (laws/regulations) (COR-001), respect 지식재산권 및 소유권 (intellectual property and ownership) (COR-002), and fulfill 책임이행 (responsibility performance) (COR-003). 14) Deliverables governance: all of the above (plans, manuals, test results, training records, warranty/support procedures, quality plans, and final acceptance artifacts) must be produced/submitted as part of the project handover and for approval by the 발주기관 (buyer), per the RFP’s requirements for 산출물 제출 and 설계서 승인 prior to execution.

question: Synthesize the primary technical, architectural, integration, and operational problems the ISMP-led re‑design of the '수산물 사이버 직매장' must solve. List each problem area with its specific issues as stated in the document.
ground_truth: The re-design must address the following problems: 1) System aging and end-of-service risks: the current system was built in 2014–2015 and H/W (Server, Storage, network equipment) and S/W (OS, DBMS) have passed their expected service life and are in EOS (End Of Service) status, increasing failure risk and limiting maintainability. 2) Need for modern, low-cost, high-efficiency architecture: the solution should incorporate new technologies (AI, Cloud 등 신기술) to enable rapid, efficient processing and flexible business expansion (저비용·고효율 시스템 설계, 유연한 업무 확장). 3) Network and security constraints from shared financial environment: sharing the network environment with credit/financial business causes overly strict security policy application (보안정책 과다 적용) and a switch bandwidth shortage — physical switch bandwidth is 1GB but practical available bandwidth is about 300MB (스위치 대역폭 1GB, 실가능 대역폭 300MB 수준). 4) Internal system non‑integration and administrative overhead: lack of integration with SSF (회계) and Shinhyup Bank (수협은행) and other internal systems leads to excessive, unnecessary administrative tasks (미연동에 따른 불필요한 행정업무 과다 발생). 5) Fragmented channel operations and inefficient processes: B2C and B2B channels are operated separately causing many simple, repetitive tasks and reduced operational efficiency (B2C, B2B 각 채널의 분절적 운영으로 단순·반복 업무 과다발생·업무효율 저하). Channel‑specific operations (Sh인스토어, 기프트몰, 임직원복지몰 등) need review to secure competitiveness. 6) User‑centered process redesign needs: consumers expect faster, more convenient online shopping due to new digital platforms (소비자 기대치 상승), and operators require redesigned business processes to respond quickly to growing user base and service changes (이용자 확대에 따른 서비스 운영방식 개선 등 업무 프로세스 재설계 필요). 7) Digital marketing and seller experience limitations: inability to utilize diverse digital marketing technologies limits customer acquisition and retention (다양한 디지털 마케팅 기술 활용 불가로 고객 증대 및 유지 한계). Sellers increasingly prefer platforms that make onboarding, marketing, sales, and settlement easy, so support for easy seller onboarding and integrated marketing/sales/settlement workflows is required (판매자 입점부터 상품 마케팅·판매·정산이 용이한 이커머스 플랫폼 선호). 8) Need for consolidation of member cooperative online malls: currently operated member cooperative online malls are fragmented and require an integrated approach (산재적으로 개별 운영하는 회원조합 온라인몰에 대한 통합 방안 필요).

question: What are the specific scope-of-work items, deliverables, technical/deployment requirements, operational integration points, and project constraints specified in the '사업범위' (Scope) and related sections for the 2024 Bus Information System expansion and functional improvement project?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Spatial scope: 울산광역시 관내의 버스정류소 및 교통관리센터(울산광역시 관내 전역). 2) Main deliverables: 제작·설치 대상 버스정보안내단말기(BIT) 총 130대(신설 60대, 교체 70대) 및 BIS 프로그램 기능개선 1식(문자 혼용 노선번호 표출 및 회차지 대기 서비스 표출)과 이를 현장 단말기에 적용하는 작업. 3) 현장 장비(현장시스템) 요구사항: - 기존 BIT 철거 70대. - BIT 제작 및 설치 상세 수량·형태: 소형 쉘터형 50대, 소형 독립형 30대, 중형 쉘터형 38대, 중형 독립형 4대, 대형 쉘터형 8대. - 통신주 설치 3개소. - 전원 및 접지 작업 60개소. 4) BIS(서버/소프트웨어) 요구사항: - BIS 프로그램 기능 개선 항목으로 문자혼용 노선번호 표시 기능 및 회차지 대기 서비스 표출 기능을 개발·적용. - 개선된 소프트웨어를 현장 단말기에 적용하여 노선 전면 개편 등 변화에 유연 대응하도록 함. 5) 운영 연계 및 데이터 흐름 요구사항: - 차량단말기에서 LTE 무선통신망을 통해 버스운행정보를 실시간 수집·가공. - 수집된 실시간 운행정보는 시민용(BIT, WEB, ARS, APP, 포털) 및 승무원용(차량단말기)에 제공되어야 함(실시간 정보 제공 체계 유지). 6) 추진·관리·협업 요건 및 역할분담: - 발주기관(울산광역시 교통기획과)은 사업수행 관리·감독 및 실행계획 수립·계약 체결. - 구·군(유관기관)은 버스정류소 쉘터 인프라 사용 협의 및 공사에 따른 도로점용 협의 수행. - 시행사(사업자)는 사업수행 전반, 시스템 개발중 발생하는 장애조치 및 지원, 계약내용 준수 및 발주기관 요구사항 이행. - 유지보수업체는 운영시스템 기술지원 및 설치 관련 지원 제공. 7) 프로젝트 제약사항: - 사업기간은 착수일로부터 5개월(적정 사업기간 산정기준에 따름). - 사업예산 및 계약 방식은 명시(사업예산: 금986,945,000원; 계약방법: 제한경쟁입찰(협상에 의한 계약))으로 사업수행 시 해당 예산·계약 절차 준수 필요. 8) 기능적 목적·요구 배경(설계 고려사항): - 시민 편의성 제고를 위해 외곽지역까지 BIT 단계적 확대 및 노후 BIT 교체로 무중단 서비스 제공 기반 구축. - 시내버스 노선 전면 개편에 유연히 대응하기 위해 기존 단말기에 문자 혼용 노선번호 표출 기능을 추가해야 함.
