question: 을지대학교 제안요청서에 명시된 비교과 관리 시스템 및 교육과정인증 관리 시스템의 기술적 요구사항(기능·비기능), 통합 요건, 및 필수 사용 기술 스택은 무엇인가? 상세히 나열하시오.
ground_truth: 요구사항에는 다음 항목들이 포함된다: 1) 기능적 범위 — 비교과 관리 시스템: 비교과 운영현황 및 대시보드 시스템 등 개발; 기존 비교과 시스템 전반을 수정·재개발. 2) 기능적 범위 — 교육과정인증 관리 시스템: 교육과정인증 신청, 평가, 관리 시스템 개발; CQI 보고서 작성·관리·통계 시스템 개발; 기존 교육과정 및 CQI 보고서 시스템 전반을 수정·재개발. 3) 공통 통합 요구사항 — 기존 교육정보전산시스템(학사정보시스템)과의 통합관리 가능성: 본교에 구축된 학사정보전산시스템과 통합관리될 수 있도록 시스템을 구축해야 함(즉, 기존 시스템과 함께 운영·관리될 수 있어야 함). 4) 데이터 연동 요구사항 — 유기적 데이터연동: 기존 교육정보전산시스템(학사시스템) 및 통합행정시스템(인사/급여시스템)과 유기적인 데이터 연동이 가능하도록 구축해야 함. 5) 보안·개발 품질 요구사항 — 시큐어 코딩 적용: 소스코드 전체에 대하여 소프트웨어 개발보안(시큐어 코딩)을 적용할 것. 6) 필수 기술스택 및 활용 기술(공통사항에 명시된 것): 서버/프레임워크로서 Nexacro(프레임워크) 활용, 레포팅툴로 Rexpert 활용, 데이터베이스(DBMS)로 Oracle 사용, WAS로 JEUS 사용(문서에 '활용'으로 명시). 7) 재개발·수정 범위 명시: 두 시스템 모두 기존 시스템의 전반적인 수정 및 재개발을 포함함(신규 모듈 개발뿐 아니라 기존 기능의 전면 개편 포함). 8) 산출물·구현 관점(암시적 요구사항 정리): 대시보드·운영현황 화면, 인증 신청/평가/관리 화면, CQI 보고서 작성·통계 기능 등 구체 모듈 구현. 9) 기간 관련 제약: 사업기간은 계약체결일로부터 2025년 4월 30일까지(프로젝트 수행 일정 제약으로 고려되어야 함).

question: According to the RFP text, what are the detailed functional and non-functional requirements, integration points, technical constraints, and project deliverables bidders must satisfy when proposing the 차세대 ERP 시스템 구축 사업 (next‑gen ERP)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional modules and capabilities: (a) HR: 인사정보관리, 인사발령, 근태관리 (with 근태기 실시간 연동), 연차관리, 교육관리, 인사 레포트; (b) Payroll: 급여관리 and payroll-related reporting; (c) Performance: 개인·조직 성과평가 기능 with 인사정보 연동 (성과관리시스템 개발 포함); (d) Financial/Accounting: 예산 및 재무·회계 관리, CMS/법인카드/홈택스 등 외부시스템 연동; (e) Electronic signature: 온라인 근로계약 체결 (계약서확인, 서명, 배포) with forms registry; (f) Mobile: 인사 모바일 연동 to improve usability (except 근태 결재 상신); (g) Groupware integration: 연동 of 지출결의서, 휴가신청 등 (maintain current approval workflows); (h) Common functions: user-defined reports (pivot support), Excel upload/download, file attachment with drag & drop and large-file support, process‑centric UI with 시각화된 프로세스 메뉴, in‑system user manuals, and per‑function usage statistics; (i) User scale: approx. 2,500 user licenses. 2) Non‑functional requirements: (a) Stability and high performance — guarantee 시스템 안정성 and performance; (b) Usability — 사용자 접근성 and ease of use; (c) Integration/consistency — 전사 차원의 통합된 정보 유지 및 분석 기반 확보; (d) Flexibility — support various user channels and rapid response to requirement changes; (e) Extensibility — software and maintenance/operation scalability for future growth; (f) Security and proven product selection — use 범용성·안정성·보안성·효율성 검증된 제품 and latest versions. 3) Integration & data requirements: (a) Real‑time integration with 근태기 (attendance devices); (b) Maintain existing approval processes when integrating groupware; (c) External system interfaces: CMS, corporate card, Hometax, and other external PGs; (d) Data migration: 이관 of existing ERP data to ensure 업무 연속성. 4) Technical constraints and standards: (a) Proposed system must use objectively verified, 최신 기술 및 버전; (b) Avoid reliance on deprecated platform components — current ERP iU Web base technologies (e.g., JDX 7.x, Apache/Tomcat 7.x) have 技術지원 종료 and pose security/maintenance limits; (c) Present a verified, web‑based standard 개발방법론 with concrete phases, activities and 산출물; (d) All S/W must include product name, specs, quantity, price, license counts, AS 정책, 무상/유상 유지보수 details, and vendor info. 5) Project scope, deliverables and tasks: (a) Supply and implement a 차세대 ERP 패키지 and develop/reflect 커스터마이징 and 성과관리시스템; (b) 구축 of 전자서명시스템 and 모바일시스템; (c) 그룹웨어 결재시스템 연동; (d) 업무 프로세스 분석 및 To‑Be 설계, 업무 간소화 and automation (eliminate manual/duplicate tasks); (e) 패키지 구축, 커스터마이징(개발), 개별 PG 테스트, 통합테스트 및 안정화, 사용자교육, and 정식 오픈 (target Mar 2025); (f) 클라우드 인프라 서비스 제공 (cloud service usage fee for 1 year included). 6) Project management, tools and responsibility: (a) Proposer must present 개발 장비·개발도구 보유현황 and 확보방안 and bear all development tool/equipment costs; (b) Provide 구체적 설계 구조, 성능 및 상세기능 제시 and applied 방안 for system 구성; (c) Propose 인력/운영 조직 improvement (IT 전담 인력 확보) as part of the plan; (d) Provide a methodology guaranteeing 안정성, 고성능, 유연성 and stepwise 발전방향. 7) Documentation, proof and evaluation artifacts: (a) Objectively evidence 신기술 or 자체 개발 기술 and prove they meet required functions/performance; (b) Provide 제품정보 및 설명자료 for all software/hardware; (c) Provide 사용자 매뉴얼 in the system and statistics on 기능별 활용현황. 8) Acceptance and operational constraints: (a) Ensure compatibility, security and maintainability given previous technology support termination; (b) Maintain existing 결재 프로세스; (c) Schedule flexibility: detailed 일정 may be adjusted post‑contract; (d) All additional or omitted items necessary for 사업 목적 should be proactively included by proposer and reflected via 협의 during the contract period.

question: Synthesize the project requirements that a proposer must satisfy to deliver the Android-based unmanned exhibition-guide system for 수도국산달동네박물관. Include functional system requirements, content-production workflow, deployment/operational requirements (device provisioning and user experience), security and confidentiality obligations, reporting and deliverable obligations (including testing), schedule/management constraints, and any procurement/evaluation constraints mentioned in the RFP.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional system requirements: a) Develop an Android OS–based exhibition interpretation (guide) system tailored to the museum's exhibits and artifacts; b) Provide location-based curation services using current ICT technologies to present theme-based exhibition narratives; c) Support multilingual exhibition content for foreigners to realize a universal exhibition environment; d) Enable non-contact (contactless) service modes to operate in parallel with other services. 2) Content-production workflow and content requirements: a) Conduct status analysis and planning/design for exhibition guidance and content; b) Collect source materials and perform content planning; c) Perform translation and proofreading (감수) for multilingual content; d) Record/audio-build content and perform construction (구축); e) Conduct historical/authenticity verification (고증) and content review/inspection (검수); f) Conduct demonstration (시연) and make revisions/corrections (보완). 3) Deployment and operational requirements: a) Supply/provide exhibition-guide devices for visitor rental service (납품 및 대여서비스 운영); b) Build required exhibition-guide infrastructure (서비스 인프라) and perform development/build activities; c) Ensure the system and devices consider museum artifacts and exhibition characteristics for a customized Android app experience; d) Operate functional testing and correction cycles to ready the system for exhibition use. 4) Security and confidentiality obligations: a) At project start, obtain and submit security pledges (보안각서) from the representative, advisory members, and all project participants; b) Establish and implement comprehensive security measures so there are no security disqualifications; c) All project documents and materials must not be used for purposes other than this project or leaked; they cannot be provided or loaned to others or institutions without prior approval from the procuring agency; d) When project participants change, perform thorough handover to prevent information leakage; e) The procuring agency may demand corrective action or participant replacement if security measures are violated; f) Include security-education and security-inspection related documents as part of required reporting. 5) Reporting, testing, and deliverable obligations: a) Submit a start/commencement report within 10 days of project start including: overall task execution plan, detailed monthly work schedule (세부 예정공정표), researcher roster with CVs and employment/experience certificates (이력서·경력증명서) and security pledges, and security-education/inspection records; b) Maintain and submit monthly/sequential progress plans and cooperate closely with the procuring agency; c) Provide at least one intermediate (midterm) report (frequency and timing negotiable with procuring agency) including progress, remaining-plan, and stakeholder feedback reflection; d) Submit final report no later than 10 days before project end; provide presentation materials at least 7 days before reporting meetings; e) Perform integrated testing, functional testing, and corrections; deliver test results and inspection reports; f) Provide the specified final deliverables (each in A4 format, 2 copies) and also supply all documents and materials on storage media in two sets. The listed deliverables include (but are not limited to): Development completion report (with program specifications and technical-application results), Security pledge/confirmation and security-measures implementation status, Menu composition diagram, Program list (programs, functions, file locations), Data specification, Operation manual for administrators (operation guidelines, maintenance, backup and recovery), Inspection report, Test result report (by test type and pilot operation), Basic documentation and software development outputs (specifications, manuals, deliverables requested by procuring agency), and various calculation/detail statements. 6) Schedule and management constraints: a) Complete the project within six months from the contract start date; b) Submit detailed monthly (M, M+1, ...) schedules/plans at project start and follow the planned phases (analysis, design, development/build, infrastructure setup, functional testing, content construction and validation, demonstration and refinement); c) Prepare and maintain sufficient professional staffing for the project and cooperate closely with the procuring agency; d) Minor omitted items necessary to achieve project objectives are the responsibility of the proposer; substantive changes to scope or fees require mutual agreement with the procuring agency. 7) Procurement and evaluation constraints (non-functional/contractual constraints): a) Procurement method is restricted-competition bidding (limited-competition) with negotiation-based contract award; b) Evaluation weighting is 90% technical evaluation and 10% price evaluation; c) The project restricts participation by large enterprises (대기업 참여 제한 사업).

question: Based on the RFP, what are the complete system requirements the bidder must satisfy, including functional (by module), non-functional (performance, security/authentication), system equipment and interface requirements, integration/data-structure expectations, and post-deployment testing, training and maintenance obligations?
ground_truth:
The requirements include:

1) Target scope and modules to be implemented
   - Build a "Committee Integrated Management System" supporting two committees: 도시계획위원회 (City Planning Committee) and 도시·건축공동위원회 (City & Architecture Joint Committee).
   - Support entire committee lifecycle: pre-meeting preparation, meeting execution, and post-meeting follow-up.

2) Functional requirements (SFR) — (12 functional requirements expected as per RFP)
   - User-role and permission management: define and implement user-specific privileges and functions for all user types.
   - Meeting preparation functions: meeting registration, agenda (안건) registration, meeting convening (소집), distribution of meeting materials, etc.
   - Meeting operation support: features to support meeting progress, agenda presentation/explanation, and agenda deliberation.
   - Post-meeting functions: result reporting and follow-up action management.
   - Document and artifact management: manage outputs per operation stage (meeting overview, submitted materials, minutes, meeting results, press releases, etc.).
   - Agenda history management: tracking and managing processing history (이력) for each agenda item.
   - Data utilization features: search, statistical analysis, and report generation based on stored artifacts and histories.
   - External-member access handling: provide mechanisms for external committee members to access the system via the external/internet network.
   - Strict access control to prevent arbitrary users from signing up: no open self-registration (회원가입 불가); issuance of temporary IDs where needed.
   - Main screen and usability: design main screen and UX improvements to support future expansion of committee operations.
   - Archive / knowledge base: build committee archive to store and allow reuse of related plans, standards, internal policies to support deliberations.
   - Any other mandatory functions derived from hierarchical analysis of unit tasks and associated data requirements (RFP requires deriving detailed functional items from system-level task decomposition).

3) Non-functional / Performance requirements (PER)
   - The RFP mandates at least one performance requirement category addressing static capacity and dynamic performance (processing speed/time, throughput, dynamic capacity). (The RFP states performance requirements must cover processing speed/time, throughput, and dynamic capacity.)

4) System equipment / composition requirements (ECR)
   - The bidder must specify required hardware, software, and network equipment to realize the target system. (RFP lists 5 equipment-related requirement items to be provided.)

5) Interface requirements (INR)
   - Define interfaces between the target system and external/internal systems and users: software-to-software, hardware and communications interfaces, and user interfaces.
   - The RFP requires specifying interfaces for integration with existing city systems (see integration list below).

6) Integration and data-structure expectations
   - Integrate with internal systems including: 인천광역시 업무정책포털 (Incheon City Business Policy Portal), 인천시 공간정보플랫폼 (Incheon Spatial Information Platform), UMS system, and other relevant systems to enable workflow and administrative procedure linkage.
   - Provide a data structure that can accommodate organizational changes (부서 등 조직개편에 대응한 자료구조체계 마련).

7) Security, confidentiality, and compliance
   - Implement security and management controls for system-registered materials and data (시스템 등록 자료에 대한 보안 및 관리 체계 구축).
   - Enforce strict user authorization: prevent arbitrary users from using the system; control external access (temporary IDs, no public signup).
   - Maintain confidentiality of all information obtained during project execution; the bidder bears civil and criminal liability for any internal data leakage.
   - The project follows requirements and procedures under the Software Promotion Act (소프트웨어 진흥법): task definition review board, potential task-change and contract adjustment procedures, and prior software project impact assessment (references to 법 제50조, 제43조 and related enforcement decrees and guidelines).
   - Security reviews and personal data protection cooperation shall be coordinated with the information officer (정보화담당관), including IDC system installation support (HW/SW).
   - Sensitive system architecture or system diagrams are omitted from public RFP but may be made available for viewing under NDA/security pledge and with an attending official.

8) Deployment, testing and acceptance
   - Conduct unit and integration testing (시험(단위, 통합)).
   - Perform pilot operation and stabilization (시범운영 및 안정화) prior to final acceptance.
   - Project schedule assumes delivery within 180 days from project start (project management, design, implementation, testing, pilot operation as per the M..M+5 schedule), subject to mutual agreement between the contracting authority and contractor.

9) Training, documentation and maintenance
   - Prepare administrator and end-user manuals and provide system training (관리자/사용자 매뉴얼 작성 및 시스템 교육).
   - Propose and deliver system operation and maintenance plans (시스템 운영 및 유지관리 방안).

10) Usability, scalability and future-proofing
   - Provide measures for improved usability and main screen composition to accommodate committee expansion and system sophistication.
   - Propose high-level plans for system scaling and functional expansion.

11) Contractual and procurement constraints
   - Contract type: restricted competitive bidding (negotiated contract); project budget and period are stated in RFP.
   - The project was pre-evaluated via software impact assessment and is subject to software project governance (possibility to request task-change reviews via 과업심의위원회 and subsequent contract adjustments).

12) Confidential handling of proposal materials
   - All matters arising before proposal submission are confidential; bidders must not disclose proposal-related information to other firms or external entities.

(Notes: Where the RFP gives counts or category names, the ground-truth lists those categories and their intended contents as specified. Specific numeric performance targets, detailed hardware models, or exact interface protocols are not provided in the excerpt and therefore are not enumerated here.)

question: What are the detailed security and product-compliance requirements specified in the RFP for the 인천일자리플랫폼 정보시스템 (covering security planning, authentication, backdoor prevention, product certification, network/security functions, mobile services, and applicable regulations)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Security planning: perform a risk analysis and establish/apply a security plan covering “service access and delivery”, “platform and infrastructure”, “element technologies”, and “interfaces and integration”. 2) Strong authentication: access to security‑sensitive services and data must be based on 공인전자서명 (certified electronic signature) or 행정전자서명 (administrative electronic signature). 3) Backdoor prevention and vulnerability handling: ensure network/network-security equipment contain no backdoors or malicious remote‑management functions; when security vulnerabilities are found, they must be improved and remediated (patches/firmware). Provide technical verification and operational methods for security functions (including commands/tests) and remove backdoors (apply non‑vulnerable firmware and patches). 4) Open‑source transparency: provide list of applied open‑source components and related functions. 5) Mobile services security: conduct vulnerability and weakness checks and remediation for mobile services (apps/web) in accordance with the 모바일 전자정부 서비스 관리 지침. 6) Backdoor technical verification checklist: verify compliance for identification & authentication, cryptographic support, information flow control, security management, self‑testing, access control (transmission data protection), and audit logging. 7) Product cryptographic module requirement: products whose main function is cryptography (e.g., PKI products) must embed and use 국정원 검증필 암호모듈. 8) Host/data protection specifics: host data‑leakage prevention (including media control) and any product with data‑storage functionality must use 국정원 검증필 암호모듈 where indicated. 9) Software/USB security: software‑based secure USB solutions must include 검증필 암호모듈. 10) Digital multifunction device requirement: for devices with non‑volatile storage, require complete secure deletion or encryption functionality. 11) Product families and required product types: require compliance for PKI, SSO, disk/file encryption, document encryption (DRM), mail encryption, link/segment encryption, keyboard encryption, hardware security token, DB encryption, and other products with built‑in cryptographic functions. 12) CC (Common Criteria) and international conformity: certain product groups must have CC certification (or security conformity verification if international CC) — specifically (network) intrusion prevention/blocking, (network) intrusion detection/prevention (including IDS), integrated security management, and web application firewall (WAF). 13) Network/security function requirements (list to be addressed/provided as applicable): DDos 대응, 인터넷 전화 보안, 무선침입방지, 무선랜 인증, 가상사설망 (VPN) with 검증필 암호모듈, 네트워크 접근통제 (NAC), 네트워크 자료유출방지, 망간 자료전송 보호, 안티바이러스, 가상화 보안 (PC/server), 패치관리, 호스트 자료유출방지(매체제어 포함), 스팸메일 차단, 서버 접근통제, DB 접근통제, 스마트카드, 소프트웨어 기반 보안USB, 디지털 복합기 보안, 소스코드 보안약점 분석도구, 스마트폰 보안관리, and CC인증 제품 여부. 14) Compliance with broader regulations/guidelines: adhere to 전자정부법, 국가정보보안기본지침(국가정보원) including 국가 사이버안전 매뉴얼, and 네트워크 장비 구축·운영사업 추가특수 조건(조달청 지침). 15) Documentation and evidence: provide 적용계획/결과 entries (or reasons and alternative technologies when partially/not applied) for each security/product item listed, and demonstrate technical measures, tests, and operational procedures for security features and vulnerability remediation.

question: Summarize the complete scope of work required by the 2024 'Dear My Gwangju' platform maintenance and enhancement RFP, including data-integration tasks, platform redesign and functional changes, infrastructure operation, promotional/activation support, and ongoing maintenance responsibilities.
ground_truth: The scope of work includes: 1) Converting five existing crawling integrations to API-based integrations (크롤링 방식에서 API 방식 5건 전환). 2) Expanding the set of institutions from which data is crawled (신규 크롤링 기관 확대). 3) Revamping the platform (디어마이광주, https://dmgj.kr/) to improve information provision both quantitatively and qualitatively (양적 정보 제공량 증대 및 질적 정보 제공 수준 향상), including a platform reorganization, system function modifications, and design improvements so that 2024 Gwangju cultural and arts information is unified into the Dear My Gwangju platform through cooperation with institutions and departments (2024년 광주 문화예술 정보 일원화 목적의 기관·부서별 협력에 따른 디자인 개선 및 시스템 기능 개편). 4) UI/UX and visual design improvements tied to the platform overhaul (디자인 개선). 5) Technical support for promotional and service-activation activities, specifically support for review/promotions (감상평 프로모션), app-utilization promotion (앱 활용 홍보), and activation of the Art Store (아트스토어 활성화 등 기술적 지원). 6) Conducting platform activation review/check meetings (플랫폼 ‘디어마이광주’ 활성화 점검 회의). 7) Ongoing platform operation support and maintenance (플랫폼 운영지원 및 유지보수). 8) Operation and management of platform-related IT infrastructure, including software and cloud services (플랫폼 관련 전산 인프라 (S/W, 클라우드 등) 운영·관리). 9) Providing proactive technical support to accommodate web environment changes and to support strategic business initiatives (웹 환경 변화 및 전략적 사업 추진에 따른 적극적인 기술 지원). 10) Deliver these services within the contract period specified (계약일로부터 2024.12.31.까지) as part of the maintenance and enhancement engagement.

question: Based on the RFP, what specific functional and architectural requirements, roles/responsibilities, supported data types, deployment approach, and key constraints must the GPA (Gwangju Policy Research Archive) system satisfy?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Roles & responsibilities: (a) 광주연구원 (Gwangju Research Institute) must develop the hub site and operate the service; (b) member institutions are responsible for implementing Open API–based programs to provide their completed reports to the hub. 2) Interface & integration: The system must accept institution-provided data in Open API format so that completed reports are provided by member institutions and automatically uploaded to the GPA homepage. 3) Archiving behavior: The service must automatically ingest and archive member institutions' completed research reports (including 자체 보고서 and 위수탁/commissioned reports) so that institutional policy-research outputs are centralized on one platform. 4) Supported content types: Common upload materials from institutions must include institution-commissioned research results, newsletters, press releases, and seminar materials/collections; separately, 광주연구원 will upload 광주정책포럼 materials and government project/contest trend information. 5) Integration with existing services: Existing policy-research archive sites (e.g., Navis and Point) should be linked/presented via banners on the GPA hub. 6) Deployment strategy and scalability: The project must support a phased pilot rollout limited to participating willing institutions (about 5 institutions initially) with an architecture that allows later high‑level enhancement (고도화) and expansion to additional institutions. 7) Operational constraints: The system development and handover must be completed within the project period (착수일로부터 5개월). 8) Budget and procurement constraints: Development must stay within the stated budget ceiling (금 43,000,000원, VAT included) and comply with the procurement restrictions (restricted-competition bidding, region-limited to Gwangju, contract by negotiation). 9) Scope emphasis: The primary objective is to build a policy-information sharing platform that consolidates policy research outputs across Gwangju municipal-affiliated institutions into a single, shareable archive (허브사이트) as described in the RFP.

question: Summarize all functional and non-functional requirements, deliverables, reporting/management obligations, content-production targets, operational constraints and compliance requirements the contractor must meet when operating and improving the '이음온라인' service according to the RFP.
ground_truth: The contractor must satisfy the following requirements and obligations: 1) Overall objective and scope: - Operate and manage the 이음온라인 platform, including content planning/production, curation, promotion, web/mobile UI·UX and functional improvements, monitoring, and pre-production for next-year early months (’25 Jan–Feb). 2) Detailed operation planning (PLR-001): - Produce an 이음온라인 세부 운영계획 based on environment analysis (운영분석, 장애예술 현장, 정책 동향) that defines menu purposes, content characteristics, and target users. 3) Governance and meetings (PLR-002): - Establish a planning committee of ~4 subject-matter experts (장애 예술, 콘텐츠, 정책 등) and run monthly planning meetings (월 1회) to decide 기획콘텐츠, 웹진 이음 이슈, and detailed content plans; expert pool and appointments to be coordinated with 장문원. 4) Curation content operation (DER-001): - Curate and provide content per menu with specified update frequencies and tasks:   a) 문화소식: update at least twice weekly (주 2회 이상), including user-submitted registration items.   b) 뉴스: ~20 domestic items per month; perform overseas article research and upload selected article translations (부분 번역문 업로드) for reference.   c) 미디어: ~10 items per month (영상, 오디오, 문서 등), including uploading curated materials and some 기획콘텐츠. - Curation scope includes all associated tasks: copyright/license confirmation and cost responsibility, error correction, freshness/updates, and information maintenance. 5) 기획콘텐츠 제작 (DER-002): - Produce original planning content (글, 영상, 오디오) about disability arts issues and uniqueness; contractor handles full production work: reporting, interviews, shooting, editing, proofreading, securing photos/illustrations/video/fonts/graphics, sourcing writers and paying fees, research and collection. - Accessibility (무장애) requirement: plan and produce barrier-free content from the planning stage; approximately 20% of total 기획콘텐츠 should be 무장애-type (final count and content to be agreed with 장문원). For videos, subtitles are mandatory (자막 필수 삽입). - Submit content planning proposals with concept, direction, and planned number of items with the proposal; final detailed plans will be negotiated. 6) 웹진 이음 제작·운영 (DER-003): - Analyze current webzine operations and produce a detailed plan. - Produce and operate 11 issues (’24 May ~ ’25 Mar) with per-issue composition and typical counts: Issue(이슈) 3–4 pieces (experts’ columns, roundtables, feature articles), Interview 1 (includes 1 video content per item), Review 2 (performances/exhibitions criticism), Trend Report 1, 이음 광장 (stories by disabled persons, ~3 items; includes contribution selection via public call). - Prepare monthly topic proposals (24년 월별 주제(안)) and the 52nd issue (’24.5월) 기획안 at proposal submission. 7) Monitoring (PLR related): - Form a 장애인 사용자 모니터링단 and conduct monitoring ~2 times to assess overall site use, content, and promotion; capture user needs and feedback. 8) Next-year pre-production: - Pre-produce content for ’25 Jan–Feb, including webzine issues scheduled for ’25 Feb–Mar; includes uploads, coding, and newsletter production. 9) 홍보 및 활성화 (PLR-003): - Perform site user analysis, define target audiences, and craft SNS-channel-specific promotion plans; run advertising and events to increase engagement. - Produce and manage SNS content and post/dispatch promotional content per channel operations:   a) 기관 블로그: 게시 상시 (웹진 이음 기사 게시).   b) 카카오톡 채널: at least 1 post per week (주 1건 이상).   c) 인스타그램 (@ieumonline): at least 2 story/post-type items per week (주 2건 이상). 10) 뉴스레터 production: - Produce and send newsletters introducing 이음온라인 content twice monthly (매월 둘째, 넷째 주 목요일) — total 22 issues; design and coding included. - Newsletter header design to be changed seasonally/for issues (3–4 times per year). - Upload newsletters to the 이음온라인 website. 11) Web promotional materials: - Produce website banners and physical standing banners for institutional facilities to promote webzine, events, surveys, etc. 12) Website operation and maintenance: - Operate and maintain web, mobile, and admin pages; provide stable web services and system operation (virtualized servers and web-hosting). - Manage webserver and DB server data; perform continuous monitoring, error checking, quality improvements, preventive measures, and immediate action on outages. - Support server and security system stabilization. - Produce promotional web content (popups, banner images). - Manage boards and comments (usage rules, notices, posts, Q&A). 13) Web accessibility and standards: - Renew web accessibility quality certification mark by complying with the 'Korean Web Content Accessibility Guidelines' (한국형 웹 콘텐츠 접근성 지침) through content updates and functional improvements. 14) UI/UX and functional improvements: - Improve design, layout, readability, accessibility, and aesthetics for web and mobile. - Improve menu structure for usability. - Improve page-specific design and content navigation for reading convenience. - Implement SEO improvements to increase portal search exposure. - Ensure optimal readability across various web browsers, operating systems, and user devices. 15) Deliverables and reporting obligations: - 착수보고 (Kickoff): submit detailed 추진계획 (content operation plan, schedule, personnel) as document within 7 days of contract start. - 중간보고: submit interim operations report (문서파일) in August 2024. - 월간보고: submit monthly operation results by the 10th of the following month. - 기획안 및 수시보고: provide planning meeting materials, promotion plans, issue response plans and results as needed. - 최종보고: within 10 days after completion, submit 과업수행결과보고 (detailed results, operational performance, stats, promotional event results, future recommendations) plus all original production data (photos, videos, images, production manuscripts, etc.) saved on one USB. 16) Formats and counts: - All routine reports and plans are 문서파일 (documents). Final production artifacts delivered on USB include documents and original media files. 17) Legal, IP, and compliance constraints: - Observe general instructions: perform tasks per the RFP unless 장문원 specifies otherwise; final task decisions via negotiation; engage in close prior consultation with designated staff. - Subcontracting or similar forms of outsourcing are prohibited. - Resulting deliverables and related IP/neighboring rights are governed by the Government contract rules (기획재정부 계약예규 용역계약 일반조건 제56조), with ownership determined by joint ownership or agreement between contracting parties. - Contractor is fully responsible for legal compliance in production (e.g., copyrights, patents, portrait rights); must indemnify and compensate 장문원 if third-party IP/portrait claims arise. - Contractor must keep confidential any information obtained and adhere to security rules; leakage causing social issues incurs civil/criminal liability. - Use provided materials only for contract purposes and implement internal security measures. 18) Change control and contract modifications: - Changes to scope, contract amount, or period per Software Promotion Act (소프트웨어 진흥법) procedures require submission of a 과업변경요청서 to request a 과업심의위원회; 장문원 should accept requests absent special reasons. - 장문원 can consider contract termination or legal measures if contractor: fails to meet agreed obligations on time, lacks capability to complete within contract period, or significantly underperforms planned schedule. 19) Security and responsibilities: - Contractor must follow any specific security measures requested by 장문원 and is accountable for breach consequences. - The contractor bears responsibility for resolving any problems arising during performance and must compensate for damage caused to 장문원. 20) Performance monitoring and quality assurance: - Continuous site monitoring, error correction, quality improvement tasks, and ensuring production meets specified accessibility and legal standards. 21) Miscellaneous operational details referenced in the RFP: - Content types include curated culture news, news, media, webzine, curation pages, notices, free board, newsletter subscription/viewing, registration guidance, and site introduction pages; tasks must respect menu-specific characteristics and audiences. - For webzine/interview items, include multimedia (e.g., interview article includes one video each) and plan production volumes considering event seasons or special circumstances (production counts/periods may be adjusted).

question: What are the comprehensive operational, functional, security/privacy, reporting, integration, maintenance and support requirements the vendor must satisfy according to the '과업범위' and '정보보안 및 개인정보보호' sections for operating the 2025 통합접수시스템 (Integrated Reception System)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Operate the 통합접수시스템 (integrated reception system) and perform maintenance and corrective activities during the contract period. 2) Implement function improvements reflecting user needs (examples given: UI/UX improvements, development of enterprise/기업담당자 login functionality, maintenance/adjustment of statistical functions). 3) Identify required items for system operation and maintenance and carry out necessary actions. 4) Inspect system operational status and perform performance and error improvements to stabilize the system. 5) When outages occur, perform rapid recovery, conduct root-cause analysis, take corrective actions, and submit an outage/incident report. 6) Inspect and improve internal and external interconnected systems and integration solutions. 7) Produce/update system manuals and keep various statistics current. 8) Manage configuration/version control of all system deliverables (형상관리). 9) Improve user interfaces and ensure data accuracy. 10) Optimize DB structure and perform query tuning for performance improvement. 11) Support server OS updates and related tasks when performing cloud operations. 12) Analyze and manage logs and support handling of complaints (민원사항) based on log analysis. 13) Execute specified direct expenses related to system operation (총 258,700천원) and manage/use items listed as direct expenses (examples: 대량접속제어 솔루션, 만족도 조사 및 이벤트, 알림톡, 계좌점유인증 서비스, 본인인증서비스, OCR 서비스, etc.). 14) Provide general support for other foundation (재단) coordination requests related to system operation. 15) Operate and stabilize the integrated member (통합회원) DB. 16) Provide system technical support services (시스템 기술지원 서비스 제공). 17) Prepare and participate in regular and irregular reporting (정기보고(주/월) 및 비정기보고(중간보고 포함)), submit start-up (착수보고) and completion reports (완료보고), and support orderly handover (업무 인수인계) to the next-year operator to ensure continuity. 18) Ensure 24-hour uninterrupted operation of the 통합접수시스템 (24시간 무중단 운영) as an expected outcome. 19) Ensure organic linkage/sharing with the 잡아바 platform (잡아바–통합접수시스템 간 유기적 결합 및 공유) and support recommendation services via integration (통합회원 관리, 잡아바 연계를 통한 추천서비스 설정). 20) Implement privacy and information security measures including: a) carry out follow-up actions from the 2024 개인정보 영향평가 results; b) take measures arising from information security and personal information protection management inspections; c) derive and apply improvements from security checks and web vulnerability scans; d) comply with enhanced security management requirements imposed on the performing vendor; e) reflect 개인정보 안전성 확보조치 기준 (personal information safety measures) in the system; f) encrypt management of unique identifiers and sensitive personal data (고유식별정보, 민감정보 등 개인정보 암호화 관리); g) handle and report results of e-Privacy incoming personal information protection complaints (e프라이버시 인입 개인정보보호 민원사항 조치 및 결과 보고); h) inspect administrator privileges and personal information access logs (관리자 권한 및 개인정보 접속기록 점검); i) perform system diagnostics for personal information protection and apply necessary measures; j) apply relevant personal information protection laws, guidelines and guides (개인정보보호 관련 법령, 지침 및 가이드 적용). 21) Perform any other privacy/security and operational measures requested by the foundation (그 밖에 재단에서 요구하는 개인정보보호 및 운영 관련 요구사항).

question: What are the specific functional requirements and behavioral rules defined in the RFP for the LMS 기능개선 across the media player, 강사파견(강사 매칭) 시스템, 교육등록(과정) 체계, 통계 기능, and 타기관 연계 가이드?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Media player improvements: a) Implement an interactive player supporting HTML games and click-response interactions (상호작용 가능한 플레이어 구현). b) Ensure the player can render outputs produced by 신규 교육콘텐츠 개발 사업 (신규 교육콘텐츠 사업의 개발물 연계). c) Add subtitle display capability within the player (플레이어 내 자막 출력 기능 개발). d) Replace/extend the current video-only player and existing mid-video quiz feature with these interactive capabilities. 2) 강사파견 시스템(자동화 강사매칭) improvements and behavioral rules: a) Code-enable each instructor's available regions/days using region/day codes covering 17 시도 (강사회원별 강의 가능 지역/요일 코드화 (17개 시도)). b) Store each instructor's historical lecture matching count in the DB and derive a ranking by reverse order of count (과거 강의 매칭횟수 DB 저장, 횟수 역순에 따른 순위 부여). c) When an institution requests a dispatch, require a single region code and single day value in the request (파견 신청 시 지역 코드, 요일 단일 값 설정 (기관 회원)). d) Auto-match the requesting institution to instructors who are available for that day and region, selecting by the defined ranking (해당 요일 가능한 지역 강사 중 순위에 따라 자동 매칭). e) If an instructor does not approve, after daily cutoffs (매일 12시/24시까지) change assignment to the next-ranked instructor (매일 12시/24시까지 미승인 시 차순위 강사에게 강의 배정 변경). f) If matching is completed, allow the requesting institution member to view the assigned instructor's information (강의 매칭 완료 시 파견신청한 기관 회원이 강사 정보 열람 가능). g) If fewer than or equal to 3 days remain until the lecture date, do not perform automatic assignment; instead surface a CMS notification so manual matching can be executed (강의일까지 3일 이하로 남을 경우 자동 배정이 아닌 CMS에 알림 나오도록 구현 (수동 매칭 기능)). 3) 교육등록 체계 고도화: a) Implement a group-management structure at a higher course-depth so related sub-courses can be managed under a single parent (교육과정의 상위 Depth로 그룹 관리 체계 구현). b) Allow content variations by position (직위별 다른 콘텐츠) to be bundled within one education course rather than as separate standalone courses (직위별 다른 콘텐츠도 하나의 교육과정에 묶이도록 기능개선). 4) 통계 기능 고도화: a) Analyze the existing statistics implementation source code (현행 통계 구현 소스코드 분석). b) Propose and implement improvements to fix inaccurate statistical values and to enhance per-course statistics (연·월·주·일 교육과정 별 통계 관련 기존 수치 부정확 문제 해결을 위한 개선점 제안·구현). 5) 이수여부 연계 가이드 고도화 (타기관 연계): a) Analyze current integration guide source code and propose/implement improvements (현행 연계 가이드 소스코드 분석 및 개선점 제안·구현). b) Replace the current popup-based API integration (팝업창 출력 방식) which causes many inquiries (팝업 해제 방법 등) with an in-system integration guide that enables LMS membership registration and course enrollment from external systems without popup windows (팝업창 방식이 아닌 시스템 내부에 LMS 회원가입, 교육 수강이 가능한 연계 가이드 개발). c) Maintain the capability to exchange membership/attendance verification via API/CI between systems but change the user flow to avoid external popups (현행 API 방식 연계 내용의 개선 및 팝업 대체). 6) Cross-cutting goals/constraints: a) Improve learner convenience and accessibility through these functional enhancements (학습자 편의성·접근성 향상). b) Implement automation for on-site instructor dispatch to improve accuracy and efficiency (현장교육 확대에 따른 자동화 강사파견 시스템 개발). c) Contract schedule constraint: work to be completed within the project period of 계약 후 150일 (사업기간: 계약 후 150일).

question: What are the detailed functional, data-integration, analysis/visualization, system-management, development-constraint, and hardware requirements specified in the RFP for the GIS/통계 기반 재난안전데이터 분석·관리 시스템 (synthesizing SFR-01, SFR-02, the data/integration and analysis sections, and the equipment table)?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Data integration and quality control: 1.1) Build integrated disaster-safety data generated by combining and analyzing disaster information. 1.2) Standardize data formats, units, and attributes so that interconnection is possible. 1.3) Establish a monitoring system to check data consistency and missing values and provide functions to quickly correct errors. 1.4) Design the system to enable integration and management of disaster-safety data received from relevant agencies and to establish a cooperation framework with those agencies. 1.5) Include disaster-related data sources such as the Disaster Information Shared Use System, Safety Information Integrated Management System, and data derived from foundational research and the 충청북도 재난안전연구센터. 2) Analysis model and validation: 2.1) Develop analysis models that consider disaster occurrence patterns, risk factors, and geographic characteristics to identify vulnerable areas. 2.2) Use statistical analysis techniques for classifying high-risk/risk areas. 2.3) Provide visualization and output of analysis results as data, reports, and thematic maps. 2.4) Include review and validation of model results through examination by relevant agencies and domain experts to verify practical effectiveness. 3) Core spatial functional requirements (map UI, layer, search, editing, analysis — from SFR-02): 3.1) Map display controls: zoom in/out, pan, refresh, previous/next view, display of level/scale. 3.2) Background maps: allow users to select background maps (aerial photos, maps such as 바로e맵, base maps, cadastral maps) and switch backgrounds. 3.3) Shortcuts: support registration/deletion of shortcuts to registered locations/scales and instant navigation. 3.4) Layer management: enable click-to-toggle layer visualization (activate/deactivate), support user-specific layer settings and linkage of layer settings with the spatial information system. 3.5) Search: support address search (parcel number address, road name address), POI (points of interest) search; clicking search results should center/map and navigate; support paginated search results. 3.6) Map output/save: allow printing/saving of the current map view and printing/saving maps for specified locations. 3.7) Measurement tools: distance and area measurement; drag-to-measure on the map. 3.8) Menu layout and UX: tree-structured menus, support hide/expand of menus, provide toolbars. 3.9) Spatial analysis and web-editing: allow setting different symbols/line types per facility; area and distance calculations via drag; support buffer searches and area selections (circle/polygon/user-defined) to search facilities; enable spatial data editing (position, length, etc.) within the system. 3.10) Web-editing data sharing: data created by web editing must be shareable/editable by others. 3.11) Statistical management: provide various graph types for all statistical results and allow saving statistical results to files (csv, pdf, etc.). 4) System management, logging, and outputs: 4.1) Provide system management functions including access statistics (by date, menu, user) and log inquiry (access history, operation history including create/modify/delete with history storage). 4.2) Deliverables tied to functionality: produce a function list and functional test reports. 5) Development and UI/design constraints (from SFR-01 and COR references): 5.1) Collect disaster information by various methods and DB-ify it; perform vulnerability analysis based on the spatial information system. 5.2) Exclude use of external plugins such as ActiveX and Flash. 5.3) Comply with web accessibility, web standards, relevant development security laws, and guidelines (see COR-07). 5.4) During system construction, conduct existing-work surveys and interviews with responsible staff (data-owning departments, linked system operators) to reflect operational requirements of business units. 5.5) Separate design elements from internal functional implementation so that design changes and future expansion are easy. 6) Analysis result presentation and verification: 6.1) Provide visualization and print/export functions for analysis results (data, reports, thematic maps). 6.2) Enable practical validation through review by relevant agencies and experts. 7) Hardware/equipment minimum specifications for system build: 7.1) Web Server: CPU 2.6GHz 4Core × 1 unit; Memory 32GB or more × 1; SSD 480GB × 2. 7.2) Storage node: CPU 2.2GHz 4Core × 1 unit; Memory 32GB or more × 1. 7.3) Products supplied by the contractor must be genuine products from the manufacturer and new. 7.4) Equipment list may be added or changed through consultation with the contracting authority. 8) Additional tasks and support expectations: 8.1) Provide joint research and system-build training for the contracting authority's internal staff. 8.2) Perform other activities deemed necessary to achieve project objectives (e.g., surveys).

question: Summarize all technical, architectural, operational and compliance requirements specified for the JST 공유대학(원) xAPI 기반 LRS 시스템, including standards to support, data store and query expectations, scalability and real-time handling, cloud and deployment features, monitoring/availability/security obligations, key functional modules to implement, and post-deployment support/training/transfer obligations.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Standards compliance: ADL xAPI 1.0 and 1.0.3 standard compliance; support for ADL xAPI Test Suite–based real-time data validity verification to ensure Clean Data storage; support for CMI5, Video Profile and various ADL learning-analysis profile models; global web standards compliance for interfaces. 2) Data store and query: RDBM (PostgreSQL) as the Data Store; SQL-based high-speed real-time data query aggregation and sorting; provide xAPI data query API via GraphQL. 3) Scalability and real-time handling: support collection of xAPI data at 3,000 records (users) per second; high-speed asynchronous FIFO (first-in first-out) xAPI real-time validation and data storage to support Safety Transaction semantics; real-time extraction of xAPI data for visualization (dashboards). 4) Cloud & deployment features: system and development environments must be built in a cloud environment; support pilot test installation and model development on cloud/server environment; virtualization-based Auto Scale In/Out functionality; sharding technology to distribute stored xAPI data in real time. 5) Visualization & query features: support real-time data sorting, aggregation and query (via SQL, GraphQL, RESTful APIs); provide at least six types of chart visualizations for data search and dashboards. 6) Functional modules (key SFR items): implement xAPI V1.0/V1.0.3 statement data real-time storage/management (SFR-01); LRS system composition (SFR-02); LRS query and sorting functions (SFR-03); data collection and management (SFR-04); provision of xAPI Profile (SFR-05); LRP (Learning Record Provider) integration functions (SFR-06). 7) Performance requirements: website optimization (PER-01); web page response time requirements (PER-02) to be met. 8) Interface & integration: interoperate with academic and extracurricular systems; support standard interfaces and external system integration (including LRP/LRC) and adhere to global web standards (SIR-01). 9) Data requirements: comply with data standards (DAR-01); perform data design (DAR-02); implement data integrity/consistency validation (DAR-03); perform initial data build (DAR-04); construct an integrated database (DAR-05); provide SW business information repository / related data storage (DAR-06). 10) Security & compliance: implement measures to prevent information leakage, hacking, tampering and to guarantee information integrity; comply with public institution privacy and information security standard guidelines and related laws; deploy web application firewall and monitoring; perform security-related testing and exercise full organizational response capability for critical incidents; emphasize strict security during environment setup. 11) Operational monitoring & availability: provide 24×365 uninterrupted infrastructure monitoring and management; periodic software updates for stable operation; rapid incident/infra response and data backup procedures; periodic data backup and establishment of emergency contact networks. 12) Service transfer & stabilization: provide technical support for successful service handover; conduct testing, stabilization and stabilization operations to ensure stable operation after transfer; provide ongoing cooperation/technical support to maintain 24×365 stable service operation. 13) Quality, certification & procurement: preferentially adopt products with GS certification (1/2 grade) and registration in the Public Procurement Service digital service mall. 14) Development & implementation principles: analyze and reflect detailed user requirements; build an optimal, stable and extensible user-centered service; follow informationization standards for forms, code systems and inter-network integration; use latest technologies to meet required functions and performance. 15) Testing & validation: implement unit and integration testing, ADL xAPI Test Suite validations, and ensure the system is testable during the project period; include plans for beta testing, security/testing and revisions. 16) Project deliverables & schedule constraints: complete build and testing within the contract period (contract date + 75 days) unless otherwise agreed; provide a realistic phased schedule (including pilot operation, security, beta test, inspection and corrections). 17) Maintenance, warranty & support obligations: provide system operator training, technical transfer, system operation/maintenance plans and a one-year defect repair (warranty) period; accept responsibility for defect repairs during warranty; present plans for post-project maintenance and long-term support. 18) Project management & support requirements: report project progress to the convening body, manage project schedule and personnel, ensure quality management, and provide necessary project support for stable system operation and training. 19) Constraints & change management: acknowledge that some design changes may occur based on business analysis; proposals must accurately analyze requirements and justify chosen construction methods and scalability for future expansion.

question: What are the detailed functional and non-functional requirements, interface and hardware/software architecture expectations, testing/quality/security constraints, and project/maintenance obligations specified in the RFP for the '정읍체육트레이닝센터 통합운영관리시스템 구축'?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional requirements (SFR): integrated member-management and operations functions covering member registration, membership termination, period extension, refunds (including partial refund), refund notifications, automated customer alerts (SMS), management of lessons/classes, facility reservations/대관, sales/metering, access control/출입, scheduling/time, and locker management; online reservation and payment flows for PC and mobile (수강신청, 대관신청) including payment, partial refunds, new registrations and renewals; CMS-based administrator pages allowing non-developer administrators to manage content and system operations; differentiated administrator access rights with ability to change or delete permissions; simple authentication methods for user convenience; support for 감면(waiver/discount) functions aligned to 정읍시청 policy and immediate waiver via linkage to 행안부 행정정보공동이용시스템. 2) Non-functional requirements / Standards: develop on the e-Government Standard Framework (전자정부 표준프레임워크) — compatibility with version 3.9 or higher and 2-level compatibility grade; ensure web accessibility, cross-browser/device compatibility (responsive design for PC, smartphone, tablet), information security and personal data protection in compliance with government guidelines; deliverability and stability for reliable online public services; provide statistical/reporting capabilities from computerized customer and revenue management. 3) Interfaces and integration (SIR): stable and flexible integration with external systems such as PG payment gateways, SMS sending services, 알림톡, and with internal/external automation devices (무인발권기, 전자키 등) in real-time; provision of an automatic-system relay server (로컬 중계서버) to mediate H/W interworking; design for future linkage with unmanned ticketing, access control, and parking control systems to enable payment, ticketing and integrated management. 4) Hardware/Deployment constraints (ECR / COR): the project will use cloud servers for deployment; include required hardware/software/network 구성 to support integrated operations and a local relay server for automation H/W; supply desk peripheral equipment as specified. 5) Data and database (DAR): implement DB design and data construction to support services (member, lesson, sales, access logs, locker, transaction records) to enable operational needs and statistical reporting. 6) Performance requirements (PER): provide appropriate performance, availability and throughput for online reservation/payment and real-time H/W interactions (general PER category required by RFP). 7) Security requirements (SER): enforce confidentiality and integrity of information assets, personal information protection, access control (administrator permission controls) and comply with applicable government security and privacy guidelines. 8) Testing and quality assurance (TER / QUR): perform analysis, unit/integration/통합테스트 with deliverables (통합테스트 산출물), conduct operational tests, vulnerability fixes when issues arise, and provide quality assurance processes, procedures and checks; submit start/mid/completion reports and test artifacts. 9) Project management and constraints (PMR / COR): project to be executed in accordance with the RFP and relevant laws (e.g., software-related statutes cited); 과업기간 is within 80 days from project start; project organization must follow the defined roles (사업총괄: 정읍시청, 실무지원: 담당자, 용역수행: 용역사업자) with regular and ad-hoc reporting to the 발주자 and 발주자 감독관 confirmation; the 사업자는 must use its regular staff for tasks and cannot assign/transfer work to third parties; changes to scope/price/duration should follow 소프트웨어사업 과업변경 procedures (과업심의위원회) per the Software Promotion Act. 10) Project support and maintenance (PSR): provide administrator training (관리자 교육), operational handover, 기술전수, 하자보수 (post-deployment defect repair), and ongoing fixes for vulnerabilities; the 용역수행자는 responsible for delivering completion reports, 산출물 납품, and providing 운영교육 and technical transfer. 11) Deliverables / Work scope summary: business plan and execution plan, 현행업무 및 프로세스·데이터 분석, DB and 화면/프로세스 설계, 화면 디자인, 프로그래밍/코딩, 통합테스트 산출물, 관리자 교육, 웹사이트 오픈 and start/mid/complete 보고회. 12) Requirement categories to be addressed in proposals: ECR (equipment), SFR (functions), PER (performance), SIR (interfaces), DAR (data), TER (tests), SER (security), QUR (quality), COR (constraints), PMR (project management), PSR (project support).

question: What specific web standards, browser/OS compatibility, accessibility rules, verification procedures, and responsive design requirements must the proposed WeHub system satisfy according to the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Encoding and standards: all web pages must declare and use UTF-8 encoding; comply with W3C web standards including standard (X)HTML, standard CSS, standard Script syntax and DOM conformance; apply web compatibility guidelines for dynamic page composition and control. 2) Separation of content and presentation: all web pages must be designed using CSS so that content and presentation are completely separated. 3) Browser and OS compatibility: ensure normal equivalent service for a minimum of five browsers (examples given: Chrome, IE10~, Microsoft Edge, Firefox, Safari) and across operating systems including Windows7, Windows8, Windows10, Linux, OS X, Android, and iOS. 4) Web accessibility standards: comply with the Korean Web Content Accessibility Guideline 2.1 (KCS.OT-10.0003/R2) to guarantee access for information-vulnerable groups; if the Korean guideline and W3C standards conflict, follow the Korean guideline; incorporate new/updated guidelines or standards as they are published. 5) Accessibility verification and post-management: prepare and present a stage-by-stage verification plan for checking compliance with the Korean accessibility guideline during the project; ensure post-production measures to maintain accessibility. 6) Accessibility testing tool and deliverables: verifications must be performed using accessibility audit programs provided by accredited web accessibility certification/assessment organizations; the proposer must act on results and submit a final report that includes evaluation results and remedial actions. 7) Accessibility score requirement at completion: after construction, check using the latest web accessibility evaluation tool (current at completion) and ensure that each checklist/item achieves a score of 95 points or higher. 8) Responsive design scope and behavior: implement 2‑ or 3‑column responsive web design to provide service continuity across smartphones, tablets, and PCs; ensure flexible response to touch-screen devices. 9) Scope exclusions and mobile optimization: the responsive design requirement covers the entire public website within this project, excluding administrator interfaces; the integrated management (CMS) must optimize user-participation features for smartphone and tablet so users can apply for projects and perform operational tasks via smartphone. 10) Cross-references to other development rules: during content construction, images must have secured copyrights; user-centered menu structures should be proposed for ease of finding information; all data should use standard codes and personal data must be encrypted — and ensure standardized cross-browser behavior as part of overall development compliance.

question: Summarize, in detail, the full scope of work and operational/maintenance requirements the RFP mandates for the 2025 Administrative Information System outsourced operation. Include monitoring and preventive tasks, incident response and recovery, helpdesk functions and record-keeping, application change and configuration management, staffing (including on-site presence and night/weekend work), performance/security management, and required coordination with internal departments.
ground_truth: The RFP requires the following scope-of-work and operational/maintenance activities: 1) System monitoring and preventive maintenance: continuous monitoring of the administrative information system to perform inspections and preventive actions ("행정정보시스템 모니터링을 통한 점검 및 예방"). 2) Incident response and technical support: rapid response and technical support for various failures and incidents ("각종 장애 발생에 대한 신속 대응 및 기술지원"); establishment of a response system to enable quick recovery when outages occur ("장애 발생 시 신속한 복구가 가능하도록 대응체계 마련"). 3) User-request handling and improvements: prompt reflection and implementation of user requirements and improvements ("사용자 요구사항에 따른 신속한 반영 및 개선"); efforts to improve user accessibility and convenience and thereby expand services and quality. 4) Application change history and configuration management: maintain histories and perform configuration (version/형상) management for application changes ("응용프로그램 변경사항에 대한 이력 및 형상 관리"). 5) Helpdesk operations and record-keeping: operate a helpdesk providing technical and administrative support for stable operations ("행정정보시스템의 안정적 운영을 위한 기술적·행정적 지원"); manage telephone consultation logs and history ("헬프데스크 전화상담 내역 이력 관리"); provide telephone consultation and remote technical support to improve internal/external user satisfaction ("전화 상담 및 원격 기술지원 등 헬프데스크 운영"). 6) Night and weekend support for server work and organizational moves: provide support for server-related tasks and organizational relocations that require late-night or weekend work ("서버작업관련 및 조직이동 시 심야근무 및 주말근무 지원"). 7) On-site specialized staffing and accountability: supply specialized personnel to be resident/on-site and provide technical support to ensure efficient maintenance and stable operation ("전문 인력 상주 및 기술지원을 통한 시스템의 효율적 유지관리 및 안정적 운영"); the 위탁운영수행(위탁운영사업자) role explicitly includes overall project execution, schedule management, and helpdesk operation/management ("사업총괄 및 작업일정 등 관리", "헬프데스크 운영 및 관리"). 8) Continuous performance and security management and system hardening: ongoing management to maintain system quality, security, and performance ("행정정보시스템 운영 품질 및 보안·성능에 대한 지속적인 관리체제 강화", "상시 시스템 모니터링을 통한 시스템 성능 유지 및 고도화"). 9) Preventive preparedness and rapid-response processes: establish measures for pre-empting failures and a rapid-response posture ("시스템 운영 장애 사전 예방 및 신속 대응조치 체계 구축"). 10) Coordination with internal departments and roles: operate within the defined 추진체계—contractor handles overall execution and helpdesk, while Information Operations (정보운영과) handles system operation management and approvals, Information Policy (정보정책과) handles server resource management, and Information Protection (정보보호과) handles communications and security management—requiring close coordination with these departments (표에 명시된 각 부서별 역할). 11) Deliverables implicit in scope: maintain records/logs (헬프데스크·작업·형상 이력), provide technical and administrative support services, perform monitoring reports and preventive activities, and support system improvements and user satisfaction measures as part of the contracted year (2025.1.1–2025.12.31).

question: Summarize, in detail, the functional requirements (SFR-01 through SFR-08) that must be implemented in the 꿀 품질평가 전산시스템 (K-GRADE) according to the RFP. Include all sub-requirements and behaviors specified for each SFR item.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) SFR-01 — 업무절차 변경 내역 시스템 반영: - Reflect changes from amended laws and guidelines into the system (add or change electronic forms, tables, and fields per 법령/지침). - Rename or use law/guideline terminology for entities and fields such as 대상업체 (target company), 생산관리번호 (production management number), 유통관리번호 (distribution management number). - Enable consumer information lookup (consumer-facing info retrieval) including viewing of 등급판정 확인서 (grade determination certificate). - Implement management functionality for drum management numbers: when 품질평가사 (quality evaluator) seals a drum after sampling, the system must record/manage the drum number engraved on the sealing device. 2) SFR-02 — 등급판정신청서 자동 접수 기능 개발: - When a 꿀 등급판정 대상업체 submits an application, the system must automatically accept (auto-receipt) the application for the same farm (동일 농장에 한해 자동 접수). - Automatically destroy applications past their retention period and record destruction history (periodic 파기 및 파기내역 기록관리 with counts by period). - Allow certain application materials that require separate preservation to be stored semi-permanently or permanently in K-GRADE or the honey management system (별도 준영구 보관 가능). 3) SFR-03 — 등급판정 신청서 자료관리 기능: - Provide a workflow where, after a 대상업체 submits an application, the 품질평가사 can review and then formally accept/receive the submitted application (품질평가사의 확인 후 접수 기능). - This is a newly developed function (신규 개발). 4) SFR-04 — 검사메뉴 필터 기능 강화: - Enhance the inspection menu filters for 규격검사기관 so that only selectable/desired conditions (e.g., 검사대기, 검사신청) are exposed; users must be able to query via filter conditions to show only selected states. 5) SFR-05 — QR 코드 조회를 위한 URL 연계 기능 구현: - Implement URL linkage so that when consumers scan a QR code on a graded-honey sticker, the system returns product/grade information via a production history number (생산이력번호로 등급판정결과 정보 제공). - Support searching by 11-digit and 12-digit codes; accept only numeric or alphabetic characters (11자리, 12자리 모두 검색 가능; 숫자 또는 영문만 입력 허용). - Ensure linkage between label printing (by printers desired by 시행업체) and URL so that consumer info lookup via the printed label works; provide URL information to 축평원 or the 시행업체 for label integration. 6) SFR-06 — 소분 기능 고도화: - Improve usability of 소분 (repackaging/splitting) functions: add printing of 검사성적서 (test/certificate) from the 소분 menu. - Expand list query count, provide Excel download capability, and add a '소분확인' button. - For Excel downloads containing personal data, require an input of the reason for download and provide an administrator view/confirmation function to monitor downloads. - Add 검사성적서 printing because of potential test-result related civil complaints (민원). 7) SFR-07 — 소분·판매단계 시료 접수 및 모니터링 신청 메뉴 추가: - Ensure LIMS (실험실관리시스템) and K-GRADE are integrated so sample-related information is synchronized (시료 관련정보 연동). - Implement functionality for 품질평가사 to register sample details in LIMS (evaluation samples taken by evaluators) with K-GRADE linkage. - Add menus for 시행업체 소분 모니터링 and 판매단계 모니터링 sample collection, including label printing and barcode functionality for collected samples (라벨 출력 및 바코드 기능 추가). 8) SFR-08 — 등급판정 수수료 징수를 위한 기능 신규개발: - Implement fee management functions in K-GRADE: per 시행업체 invoice (납입 고지서) viewing and issuance. - Enable monthly generation/printing of 납입고지서 by 품질평가사 and automatic email dispatch to the workplace fee manager; include automatic mail sending and verification of whether the mail was received and confirmation of sender email address. - Provide tracking of payment status for issued invoices and amounts (납입고지서 발급내역 및 고지금액에 대한 납입여부 관리). - Develop automatic mail sending, delivery/receipt tracking, and sender address confirmation features. - Ensure compliance with the internal guideline «축산물등급판정수수료 징수업무지침» (내규).

question: What are the detailed functional and usability requirements specified in the RFP for each of the four components to be improved (이력제 누리집, 축산물이력관리시스템(PC), 이력번호 조회 앱, 이력제 모바일 웹)?
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following component-by-component functional and usability requirements: 1) 이력제 누리집 (mtrace.go.kr) — Design and usability: (a) Overall visual redesign (images, photos, fonts). (b) Main screen layout similar to other government agency sites (including fonts). (c) Place and redesign a '주요 메뉴 바로가기' (quick menu) at the top. (d) Improve mobile rendering for smartphone access. (e) Enlarge and, if necessary, reposition the 이력번호 조회 input box; improve readability of lookup results via design changes. — Number-lookup specifics: (a) Enlarge input field and change location if needed. (b) Increase font/point size to make digits more distinguishable; provide automatic validation of digit count per species (same behavior on mobile). (c) Provide contextual messages such as current expected digit count and which species the entered number corresponds to (e.g., '현재 자릿수(00자리), 입력하신 번호는 축종(00)에 해당하는 번호체계입니다.'). (d) Improve popup/result layout for readability; add explanatory text for items that are hard to interpret (e.g., explaining multiple farm owners shown due to transfers). — Menu and content: (a) Reconfigure menu hierarchy and positions (add/delete/merge existing menus). (b) Consolidate or remove existing menus and add new menus as needed. (c) New menus to include (examples): 누리집 안내, 축종별 이력번호 체계, 관계기관 현황 및 역할. (d) Improve and supplement menu content (e.g., 축종별이력관리, 축산홍보관); contractor to incorporate content provided by 축평원. 2) 축산물이력관리시스템 (PC) — General: (a) Add new functions (knowledge/information management, education & promotion performance management, basic statistics). (b) Improve user convenience for different user types (축평원, 관계기관 담당자, 축산물 영업자, 농장경영자); note that account types will determine available menus/functions. — 지식관리 기능 (Knowledge-management): (a) Structure knowledge information according to system user types (사용자 → 축종 → 유통단계(사육·도축·판매) and other categories). (b) Accumulate knowledge by user type (등록 by 담당자 등, 이력지원실). (c) Provide searchable/accessable information so users can selectively obtain needed information (업무처리, 법률, 시스템 사용법 등). (d) Implement feedback/환류 loop for improvement (수요발굴, 개선의견) and a generation step to reflect reviewed changes (내용보완, 신규 정보 추가), establishing a knowledge information virtuous cycle. — 교육·홍보 실적관리 (Education & publicity performance management): (a) Replace Excel/manual sharing between support and 본원 with in-system project management. (b) Functions to include: 실적 입력, 기간별 통계 (일/월/연), 예산관리. (c) 본원-side functions: support-specific budget allocation, monthly report generation/printing, 마감처리. — 기본통계 추가 (Basic statistics): (a) Provide user-tailored basic statistics by species and by implementation stage. (b) Presentation formats: tables and graphs. (c) Expose via a main '기본통계' menu on the dashboard. (d) 관리자 can manage overall stats and grant selective access per account. (e) Example user-specific statistics: - 축평원: 축종별(소, 돼지, 가금) 기본 통계 (농가수, 마릿수 등), 신고정보(축종별, 이행단계별), 신고율 등. - 관계기관(지자체): 관할 농가의 신고정보(축종별, 이행단계별), 신고율, 전국 현황 비교·분석. - 관계기관(위탁기관): 관할 농가 통계(농가수, 마릿수, 신고정보 등), 전국 현황 비교·분석. - 사육농가/유통업소: 신고내역 기간별 통계, 신고정보 분석 및 오류정. 3) 이력번호 조회 앱 — Usability and functionality: (a) Improve overall design. (b) Integrate/merge species-specific number lookup into a unified lookup across species. (c) Improve input and navigation convenience. (d) Strengthen informational content provided to users (더 많은 정보 제공). (e) Improve readability of lookup results and general convenience (consistent with web lookup improvements). 4) 이력제 모바일 웹 — New functional additions and statistics: (a) Introduce DNA 시료채취 functionality. (b) Add CAPI (현장점검용 Computer-Assisted Personal Interview) features for on-site inspection workflows. (c) Provide basic statistics similar to PC system. Cross-cutting requirements implied in the RFP: — Account-based access control: menus and functions differ by account type; system must support role/account-specific UI and data views. — User convenience and readability are primary non-functional goals across all components (font size, input ergonomics, mobile responsiveness, clear explanatory text). — Content provisioning: certain menu/content items will be supplied by 축평원 and must be incorporated by the contractor. The improvements should support the stated purpose of increasing user convenience (design, menu, function improvements) across all four system components.

question: What is the complete scope of work (modules, components, and deliverables) required under 'Ⅱ. 사업추진 방안 - 1. 사업범위' for the '영상 AI감지 및 홍수감시 연동 시스템 구축 사업'? Provide a comprehensive, itemized summary with brief descriptions taken from the RFP.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Real-time field video relay and communication platform development: a) Real-time video relay server development including CCTV linkage for flood monitoring (관내 CCTV 연동 시스템 구축), CCTV video event reception data processing system (관내 CCTV 영상 이벤트 수신 데이터 처리 시스템 구축), and an AI 영상기반 도시데이터 수집 중계 플랫폼. b) Smartphone-based real-time field video relay and communication APP development (스마트폰 기반의 실시간 현장 영상 중계 및 커뮤니케이션 APP 개발) covering a real-time field video relay platform, a real-time field video communication platform, and real-time AI 영상 안전 관리 서비스. c) Situation-room PC management program (Dispatcher) development (상황실 PC용 관리 프로그램(Dispatcher) 개발). 2) Edge/Smartphone-based (Android OS) intelligent video analysis engine development: a) Develop a smartphone-based intelligent video analysis engine (스마트폰 기반의 지능형 영상 분석 엔진 개발). b) Develop the edge/smartphone-based intelligent video analysis engine to meet required performance (지능형 영상 분석 엔진 성능 — 엣지/스마트폰 기반의 지능형 영상분석 엔진 개발). c) Develop interfaces for the intelligent video analysis engine (지능형 영상 분석 엔진 인터페이스 개발). 3) Real-time video acquisition devices for urban data linkage: a) Manufacture separate devices for real-time urban data acquisition (실시간 도시 데이터 획득을 위한 별도 디바이스 제작). b) Provide an integrated form-factor device that can be mounted on various mobile personal mobility units (다양한 이동형 퍼스널 모빌리티에 장착 가능한 일체형). 4) Training/learning data construction: a) Build new training datasets according to the client's requirements (고객사의 요구에 따른 신규 학습 데이터 구축), with at least two (2건 이상) distinct datasets. b) Use the new training data to improve AI performance (AI성능 개선을 위한 신규 학습데이터 구축).
source_file: 케빈랩 주식회사_평택시 강소형 스마트시티 AI 기반의 영상감시 시스템 _parsed.json

question: Summarize the complete functional scope, integration requirements, and key non‑functional constraints for the '종량제봉투 판매관리 전산시스템 개선사업' as specified in the RFP. Include required modules, payment and external‑system integrations, expected user/service improvements, delivery/contract constraints, and any legal/administrative requirements that affect scope confirmation or execution.
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following requirements and constraints for the 종량제봉투 판매관리 전산시스템 개선사업: 1) Core functional scope (전산관리 시스템 구축): a. Order and sales records management (주문 및 판매 내역) — system must record and allow 조회 of orders and sales. b. Inventory management (재고관리) — track stock related to 종량제물품. c. Payment records management (결제내역 관리) — record and allow 조회 of payment history. d. Reporting and statistics (보고서식 및 통계자료 등 조회) — provide report templates and statistical query/조회 capabilities. 2) Internet ordering and integrations (인터넷 주문 프로그램 연동): a. Online ordering capability (온라인 주문) — support placing orders via the internet. b. Order detail confirmation (주문내역 확인) — allow users to check order status/details. c. Payment integration — support card payments and account transfers, specifically including virtual account (가상계좌) integration. d. PG company API integration (PG사 API 연동 등) — integrate with payment gateway APIs for electronic payments. 3) Additional system function mentioned: construction of a location‑lookup system (위치조회시스템 구축) to support the service (listed among 주요내용). 4) Service and user experience objectives: a. Diversify payment methods by introducing virtual accounts instead of relying solely on bank account deposit. b. Provide user‑centered, tailored services via an improved internet ordering system. c. Enable a 24‑hour ordering system to improve ordering convenience for designated sales outlets (지정판매소의 발주 편의성 향상). 5) Project schedule, budget, delivery and contract constraints: a. Project duration: 60 days from project start (착수일로부터 60일). b. Delivery/installation location: 파주도시관광공사 생활지원팀. c. Budget: KRW 55,000,000 (including VAT) (금55,000,000원(부가세 포함)). d. Contract method: restricted competitive bidding with negotiation (제한경쟁입찰(협상에 의한 계약)). 6) Administrative/legal requirements affecting scope and execution: a. The project’s task contents were confirmed through a 과업심의위원회 in accordance with the Software Promotion Act (소프트웨어 진흥법 제50조) — the RFP notes the project underwent 과업내용 확정심의 and simplification by Korea Information and Communication Industry Agency. b. Relevant statutes and guidelines cited that govern contract method and evaluation: Presidential Decree on Local Government Contracts (지방자치단체를 당사자로 하는 계약에 관한 법률 시행령) — Articles on negotiation and knowledge‑based contracts; Local government bidding and contract execution standards and bidder selection criteria (행정안전부 예규); Software Promotion Act and related guidelines on appropriate project period calculation and task confirmation. 7) Implied integration and deliverable expectations (derived from above): a. The system must provide end‑to‑end functionality covering online ordering, payment processing (card and virtual account), order/sales/inventory/payment tracking, reporting/statistics, and location lookup. b. Payment integration must be implemented via PG company APIs to support card and account/virtual‑account flows. c. The solution must enable continuous (24/7) ordering and improve order placement workflows for designated sales outlets. d. The finalized task scope is based on the 과업심의위원회 outcomes and must adhere to the legal/administrative procurement and contract rules cited in the RFP.

question: What are the detailed new-software and new-infrastructure procurement requirements (items, quantities, and special notes) specified in the RFP for the S/4 HANA ERP conversion project?
ground_truth:
The RFP specifies the following new software and infrastructure procurement requirements:

Software (신규 도입 소프트웨어 내역):
1) Process Asset Management System (PAMS) 솔루션
   - 수량: 식1 (1식)

   - 수량: 식1 (1식)

3) SSO 통합 인증 솔루션

4) 웹전환 솔루션
   - 수량: 식1 (1식)

3) 개발 서버
   - 수량: 2대 이상 (HCI 기반)
   - 비고/예시 구성: S/4HANA ERP 개발 AP, S/4HANA ERP 개발 DB, 포털 개발 AP, 포털 개발 DB, BW 개발 DB, BW 개발 AP

4) SAN 스위치
   - 수량: 2대
   - 비고: 스토리지용 SAN (이중화)

5) 스토리지
   - 수량: 1대
   - 비고: S/4HANA 통합스토리지 — 스토리지 #1에 운영 DB(Active), 운영 DB(Standby), 품질, BW, LDM 포함

   - 수량: 2대
   - 비고: L2 스위치

7) LDM 서버
   - 수량: 2대
   - 비고: LDM 서버 (Active - Standby)

8) 외부연계 서버
   - 수량: 1대
   - 비고: 외부연계 서버 (KGT 연계망)

9) 백업 S/W
   - 수량: 식1 (1식)
   - 비고: OS/데이터 백업 대상에 ERP 운영 DB(Active), ERP 운영 DB(Standby), 품질, BW, LDM, HCI 포함

   - 수량: 1대

Notes (from RFP context):
- Several items explicitly require redundancy/dualization (Active-Standby or 이중화) for high availability (DB, LDM, network/storage components, API internal/external duplication).
- Development, quality, and operation licenses/environments are required for many software items (web conversion, SSO, PAMS, EAI/API), indicating separate environments for dev/qa/prod.
