question: What technical, security, operational and maintenance requirements, constraints and deliverables must a proposer meet to operate and maintain the '아이돌봄인력 인적성 검사 정보시스템' according to this RFP?
ground_truth: The RFP requires the proposer to provide the following technical, security, operational and maintenance features and adhere to the stated constraints (summarized from the document): 1) Continuous operation & maintenance: provide an always-on (상시) maintenance/support organization and processes for stable information system operation, including application and cloud stabilization (어플리케이션 및 클라우드 안정화 관리). 2) Cloud environment: deliver and operate a non‑stop (무중단) cloud environment and provide technical support for cloud environment operations (클라우드 무중단 환경 제공, 클라우드 안정화 운영기반 및 기술지원). 3) Program modification & result reflection: perform program modifications and optimization when the in·aptitude (인·적성) tests change; reflect algorithm changes in results; support high‑levelization (고도화) of tests and improve result reports (인·적성 검사 변경에 따른 프로그램 수정 및 결과 반영, 인·적성 알고리즘 변경에 따른 결과 반영, 인·적성 검사 고도화에 따른 결과지 개선). 4) Test artifacts and variability: support up to the indicated test tool set (검사도구 4종) and accommodate changes in test tools per business needs. 5) Data collection & analysis: manage data collection and analysis to support policy and operational uses; enable storage/accumulation of structured test results for policy and service improvement (데이터 수집 및 분석을 위한 정보체계 관리, 체계적인 검사 결과 축적). 6) Validity & history management: provide target validity verification and history management functions (대상자 유효성 검증 이력 관리기능). 7) Monitoring, authentication and operator management: provide monitoring of test execution and results, operator authorization and authentication management (검사 수행 모니터링 및 결과 분석, 검사 실시 운영자 권한 부여 및 인증 관리). 8) Reporting support: integrate with provided reporting tool (OZ Report) for test result printouts (리포팅 툴 OZ Report 제공(발주처 제공) 및 결과지 출력 지원). 9) Web/accessibility & e‑government compliance: implement web accessibility and comply with e‑government technical/security guidelines (웹 접근성, 전자정부 가이드라인 준수). 10) Privacy/security requirements: comply with the Personal Information Protection Act (개인정보보호법) and related enforcement decree obligations (Article 29 and 시행령 제30조) — specifically establish an internal management plan, retain access/connection logs (접속기록 보관), and implement required technical, managerial and physical safety measures to prevent loss/theft/leak/forgery/modification/damage of personal data (내부 관리계획 수립, 접속기록 보관, 기술적·관리적·물리적 조치). 11) Information security deliverables: propose concrete physical, technical and managerial security measures for system operation (개인정보보호 및 정보보호 강화 조치(방안), 물리적·기술적 보안 대책 제시). 12) System documentation & restricted disclosure: system diagrams and detailed architecture are not publicly disclosed; bidders may view them only after submitting a security pledge and under staff supervision (시스템 구성도 등은 공개하지 않으며 보안서약서 제출 후 담당자 입회하에 제한적 열람). 13) Software & external integration: support connections to necessary software and external services required for system operation (시스템 운용을 위한 SW 및 외부 서비스 연계). 14) Project delivery responsibilities: perform project execution, progress and personnel management, technology transfer, defect repairs/warranty and ongoing maintenance (사업 이행·진도/인력 관리, 기술이전 및 하자보수, 유지관리). 15) Reporting & governance: provide project reporting (착수·중간·최종 보고) and accept system handover/acceptance by the client (시스템 인수). 16) Procurement & evaluation constraints relevant to proposers: respond under a restricted competitive bid with negotiation contract, be aware evaluation weights (technical 90% / price 10%), and that this is a large‑company‑restricted project (제한경쟁입찰·협상에 의한 계약, 기술평가(90%)/가격평가(10%), 대기업 참여제한). 17) Operational scope boundaries: support stabilization of the existing 2024-built system and TO‑BE optimizations for 2025, including possible changes driven by program operation (2024년 개발된 시스템 운영 지원, 2025년 인·적성 기능 최적화 및 운영 기술지원).

question: What are the RFP-specified functional requirements, non-functional/technical requirements, maintenance obligations, and constraints for the NCIC system operation and improvement (including scope of work and evaluation/security constraints)?
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following requirements and constraints: 1) Functional requirements / scope of work: 1.1 Web-site full overhaul with UI/UX improvements to increase accessibility and accuracy of content delivery. 1.2 Standardization and systematization of all currently hosted national curriculum information. 1.3 Build a long-term data accumulation and management system for national curriculum surveys, analyses, and inspections (data 누적관리 체계 구축). 1.4 New development of user login and user management functions. 1.5 New development of access statistics recording and data extraction functions for NCIC visitors. 1.6 Integration/connection with survey system(s) to enable survey-system linkage and objective evidence-based policy support. 1.7 Content management capabilities (e.g., adding boards, modifying banners, general web page edits) per user requests. 1.8 Maintain existing content menus (우리나라 교육과정, 세계 교육과정, 지역 교육과정, 국가교육과정 연구센터 연계, 교육과정 자료실, Q&A 외부연계 등) and ensure their availability. 2) Maintenance obligations (운영·유지보수): 2.1 Ongoing checks and maintenance to prevent operational failures across WEB, WAS, DB, etc. 2.2 Respond to and implement user-requested webpage changes (게시판 추가, 배너 수정 등). 3) Non-functional / technical requirements and design constraints: 3.1 Adopt recent/latest IT technologies appropriate for the NCIC environment. 3.2 Perform analysis of related systems' baseline technologies and data linkage to support efficient NCIC rebuild. 3.3 Conduct infrastructure (인프라) analysis to improve operation efficiency and provide stable research-support services. 3.4 Ensure accessibility improvements so users can quickly access desired content. 3.5 Design and build data storage schemas for cumulative survey/analysis/check data to improve data management convenience. 3.6 Follow technical standards and applicable laws regarding information systems (consider laws related to information system construction and operation). 3.7 Define or follow standard operation procedures, security framework, and policy formats consistent with existing standard systems. 3.8 Cloud-service operation: the system is currently operated as a cloud service (클라우드 서비스로 운영 중). 4) Security and evaluation constraints: 4.1 Hardware security details are not publicly disclosed; access requires separate viewing request, a security pledge, and supervised review per the "행정기관 및 공공기관 정보시스템 구축·운영 지침" Article 17 and related provisions. 4.2 Proposals may require prior information-security review (정보화사업 사전 및 보안성 검토). 5) Project execution / management / deliverables responsibilities: 5.1 The contractor must execute the contract and manage project personnel, report progress, and perform project management covering scope, schedule, risk, and quality. 5.2 Provide user training and technology transfer (사용자 교육 및 기술이전 등). 5.3 Cooperate with client departments and participate in cloud-system related consultations as coordinated by the client (한국교육과정평가원 관련 부서 역할). 6) Intended outcomes to be achieved (expected effects to guide work): 6.1 Continuous management/support of NCIC system and strengthened public information service (accessibility, currentness of domestic/international curriculum info, policy guidance). 6.2 Establish a standardized data management process to support evidence-based education policy and on-site adoption via accumulated survey/analysis data. 6.3 Overcome current system limitations through environment and status analyses and define integrated platform utilization measures. 7) Contractual/administrative notes relevant to technical work: 7.1 Contract method: negotiated contract (협상에 의한 계약체결). 7.2 The project period is from contract signing to 2024.11.15 and the system amount is specified (administrative context for deliverables).

question: Summarize the target system architecture and runtime environment requirements specified in the RFP: list the hardware and software components, quantities, OS versions, middleware, DBMS, security/HA, virtualization and monitoring tools for the DB, Web and WAS tiers.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) DB tier (DB 서버): two (식(2)) DB servers with hardware model DL380Gen10, CPU 3.6GHz × 2 CPU (total 8 cores), 128G memory; OS listed as "Redh 발주기관 7.4"; DBMS: Tibero 6; High-availability tool: Veritas Volume Manager; DB security: PetraV 3.1; monitoring/management (관제): CoreView 2.0. 2) Web tier (Web 서버): two (식(2)) Web servers on Simplivity 380gen10 hardware, CPU 2.3GHz × 1 CPU / 6 cores, 32G memory, deployed as virtualized hosts (가상화); OS: Solaris 11 (x86); Web server software: WebToB 4.1; monitoring/management: CoreView 2.0. 3) WAS tier (WAS 서버): two (식(2)) WAS servers on Simplivity 380gen10 hardware, CPU 2.3GHz × 1 CPU / 8 cores, 64G memory, deployed as virtualized hosts (가상화); OS: Solaris 11 (x86); WAS: Tmax Jeus 6; JDK: JDK 1.6; monitoring/management: CoreView 2.0. 4) Cross-tier notes from the RFP: each tier lists CoreView 2.0 for 관제/monitoring; Web and WAS tiers explicitly indicate virtualization (가상화).

question: Based on the RFP, what are the detailed technical and system requirements for the GIS-based Pilot water-management system — covering field instrumentation (types, specs, quantities, and device composition), communications and power, server and software stack, required system functional modules (GIS, data collection, mobile), data management and deliverables, plus training and post-deployment activities?
ground_truth:
The requirements include: 1) Field instrumentation (types, specs, quantities, and composition):  
   - Total field units: 6.  
   - Rain gauge: Tipping-bucket type, 0.5 mm per 1 pulse, quantity 1.  
   - Canal (waterway) level/velocity sensor: Radar level (FMCW) and velocity (PMW) sensor, quantity 2.  
   - River water level sensor: Radar level sensor (FMCW), quantity 2.  
   - Device composition for each measurement installation: sensor unit (rain, level, or level/velocity), data collection unit (RTU), communication unit (LTE), power supply (solar panel and battery), and auxiliary equipment (poles, enclosures/cabinets, other installation structures).  

2) Communications and enclosure/power requirements:  
   - Communications: LTE-based communications at each measurement point to transmit collected measurement data.  
   - Enclosure requirement: Communication equipment (and presumably RTU) must be installed inside a cabinet/box (함체) to protect against surrounding environment and climate.  
   - Data transmission target: LTE-transmitted data must be sent to an internet router at facilities designated by the Nepal government (the data recipient specified by the client).  
   - Power: Solar power with battery backup is required as the power supply for field installations.  

3) Server and software stack (system infrastructure):  
   - Server hardware: One operations server specified as 1.9 GHz, 6Core x 2 ea (or greater).  
   - Logical server roles and OS/services (per system concept):  
     • Collection server: Windows OS running the data collection program.  
     • WEB server: Windows OS running Apache.  
     • WAS server: Windows OS running Tomcat.  
     • DB server: Windows OS running Postgre (PostgreSQL).  
   - Application programs required (three program types): web operation program, mobile program, and data collection program.  

4) Functional modules / system features (GIS, data processing, mobile):  
   - GIS-based Pilot system features:  
     1. Display of field measurement device location information on GIS.  
     2. GIS-based display of meteorological data (weather), canal data (water level / velocity / flow), and river data (inflow / outflow water levels).  
     3. GIS-based display of detailed facility information.  
   - Data collection and processing features:  
     1. Collection of field measurement data from installed instruments via the data collection program and LTE communications.  
     2. Conversion/calculation of flow (유량 환산) from measurement data.  
     3. Integration of collected measurements into a consolidated/integrated database.  
   - Mobile-based data-input module features:  
     1. Ability for users to input water level values at non-instrumented (unmeasured) points.  
     2. Per-site measurement status information display.  
     3. User input data query/viewing capability.  

5) Data management and storage:  
   - Collected measurement data received via LTE must be securely stored in the DB server.  
   - The operational system (GIS pilot and mobile module) deployed on the same server(s) must allow web-based users to view facility and measurement information from the DB and enable direct data input when required.  

6) Deliverables and acceptance/testing artifacts:  
   - System-level deliverables: system design report, system development report, installation completion report, test results report, integrated quality inspection report, owner (source agency) acceptance confirmation.  
   - Operation/use documentation: system operation / user manual.  
   - Equipment/supply deliverables: equipment design report, start-up survey results report, equipment installation results report, installation result report, test completion report, inspection result report, owner acceptance confirmation, equipment operation & management manual.  
   - Training deliverables (technical transfer / capacity building): training plan, training outcome report, training materials.  

7) Project activities and lifecycle expectations (supply/installation/testing/acceptance/maintenance):  
   - Activities include: procurement and supply of instruments and communications equipment, detailed specification writing and price survey, equipment installation planning and design, supply and installation of real-time automatic rain, water-level, and level/velocity monitoring equipment, supply and installation of communication facilities for data transmission, supply and installation of DB/operation server, provision of spare parts, testing and commissioning, acceptance inspections (검·인수), service and transfer to the client, and aftercare (warranty/defect repair) planning.  

8) Quality, performance and requirement categories (documented requirement structure):  
   - Requirement categories and counts specified in the RFP:  
     • Functional requirements (SFR): 12 items.  
     • Performance requirements (PER): 5 items (processing speed/time, throughput, capacity, availability, etc.).  
     • Equipment composition requirements (ECR): 5 items (HW, SW, NW procurement details).  
     • Data requirements (DAR): 6 items (initial data build, conversion, security-needed data).  
     • Interface requirements (INR): interface requirements to external systems, hardware, communications, protocols (count not fully shown in the excerpt).  

9) Testing, acceptance and handover expectations:  
   - Testing: produce test completion reports and test results as part of deliverables.  
   - Acceptance: formal inspection results and source-agency acceptance confirmation required.  
   - Handover: service provision and transfer (inclusion of operation manuals and training) to enable operational use by the Nepal DWRI and associated agencies.

question: Based on the RFP, what are the complete technical, hardware, data, staffing, training, and project-management requirements (scope of work) that the PMC must deliver to establish the FSFM and related food‑security information system for the AFSIS 3rd Phase in Kampong Speu, Cambodia?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) FSFM Master Plan and System Deliverables: a) Develop an FSFM (Food Security Forecasting Model) master plan (mid‑/long‑term roadmap and execution strategy) specifically addressing remote‑sensing‑based crop monitoring and production forecasting; b) Design, build and document an FSFM database (D/B) to store remote sensing, spatial, growth indices, and agricultural statistics; c) Develop and deploy the FSFM system (software) including production‑prediction models and system functions for analysis, visualization and monitoring; d) Conduct a rice (paddy) production monitoring and prediction pilot for Kampong Speu Province as part of the FSFM implementation; e) Review and provide support for improving the existing national agricultural information system (NAIS). 2) Remote Sensing, Data and Analysis Requirements: a) Collect remote sensing imagery (satellite and UAV) for target crop/region (rice / Kampong Speu); b) Process and pre‑process remote sensing data (collection, processing, analysis) and integrate into the FSFM database; c) Generate and analyze spatial information and crop growth indicators (vegetation/biophysical indices) and link these with agricultural statistical data; d) Design, implement and validate production‑prediction models (model design, application and results analysis). 3) Hardware, Software and Equipment Provisioning: a) Supply field and ICT hardware: drones and sensors (UAV platforms and payloads), laptops and videoconferencing equipment; b) Provide server and network equipment necessary to host the FSFM database and system and support operations; c) Ensure delivered hardware supports required data collection, processing, storage and remote collaboration. 4) Data Collection & Integration Process Requirements: a) Support and integrate with Cambodia’s village‑level full enumeration approach (village surveyors and key persons collect rice‑related data); b) Accommodate the existing transmission chain (village → District Office via phone/FAX → Province → PDA verification → weekly meetings → DPS); c) Ensure system workflows allow aggregation, verification and weekly reporting consistent with MAFF/DPS procedures. 5) Staffing and Expert Deployment: a) Provide expert dispatch across six technical fields over a 32‑month period (including a Project Manager (PM); FSFM policy specialist; prediction model and database construction experts; software development and system operations experts; PAO/public affairs or equivalent) as specified; b) Manage expert deployment, rotations and performance. 6) Capacity Building and Knowledge Exchange: a) Organize AFSIS workshops (16–20 participants) involving target countries and AFSIS secretariat for knowledge exchange; b) Conduct in‑country practical training for ~50 central and provincial agricultural statistics practitioners to increase remote sensing uptake and agricultural ICT policy understanding; c) Deliver training materials and local hands‑on sessions tied to FSFM operation. 7) Project Management, Reporting and Governance: a) Prepare and execute project plans (scope, schedule, methods) and manage changes and risks; b) Regular reporting obligations: start/commencement report, monthly progress reports, periodic/annual performance reports, and hold kickoff, interim and completion review meetings; c) Manage logistics for expert dispatch, equipment procurement/transfer, and stakeholder coordination with MAFF and provincial PDA offices; d) Include project advisory fees, international travel (overseas missions), other operating expenses and publicity/communication activities in management. 8) Pilot & Evaluation Constraints: a) Pilot limited to target crop (rice) and Kampong Speu Province; b) Work must align with AFSIS objectives and earlier phases (1–2) experience (e.g., linkage with AMIS and NAIS where relevant); c) Contractor must prepare a detailed, negotiable schedule (the RFP schedule is provisional and may be adjusted by bilateral agreement). 9) Deliverables & Meetings: a) Deliver master plan, FSFM system and DB, pilot model results, equipment, training sessions, and all required reports; b) Conduct formal reporting events (착수/중간/종료보고회 – commencement/midterm/closing) as part of institutionalization and handover to MAFF/DPS and provincial PDAs.

question: Provide a comprehensive summary of all requirements and expected features specified in the RFP for the '건설기술에 관한 특허·실용신안 활용실적 관리시스템 개편' project, covering: functional requirements (with concrete feature details), performance requirements, interface requirements, security requirements, quality/data/testing requirements, constraints, project management requirements, and project support/maintenance/training requirements. Include the specific requirement codes and the concrete feature descriptions given in the document (e.g., notification behaviors, search/statistics fields, UI roles, external system linkage items, certificate/login behaviors, internal approval flows, file-download, reviewer assignment, session/logout behavior, and data/handover items).
ground_truth:
The RFP specifies a wide set of requirements grouped by category. Summarized strictly from the document: 

1) Functional requirements (codes and concrete features):
   - FUR-001: 심사 全 단계 의견제출통지서 작성 및 통지 기능 — enable creation and transmission of opinion-submission notices during all review stages (예비심사/본심사).
   - FUR-002: 심사 관련 자료제출 및 처리상태 자동 통지서비스 기능 — allow submission of review-related materials and automatic status/notification services.
   - FUR-003: 타 기관 시스템과의 연계 기술 지원 — technical support for linkage to other 기관 systems (e.g., 나라장터).
   - FUR-004: 로그인 / 로그아웃 기능 명료화 및 비밀번호 변경 기능 — clarify login/logout, provide password change functionality.
   - FUR-005: 제출 서류 및 신청서의 오류 체크 기능 — error checking of submitted documents and applications.
   - FUR-006: 건설기술활용실적 심사위원 건 배분 및 관리 기능 — reviewer-case assignment and management (심사의뢰건 배분 및 심사진행 관리).
   - FUR-007: 심사위원 화면 구성 및 기능 개선 — improve reviewer UI and functionality.
   - FUR-008: 심사 단계 화면에서 전자결제 화면 구성 및 연동 기능 개선 — improve electronic approval/payment screen composition and integration at review-stage screens.
   - FUR-009: 관리자용 시스템의 내부결재자 결재 및 최종승인문서 발송 기능 — internal approver approval workflow and sending final approval documents.
   - FUR-010: 파일 전체 다운로드 기능 — full-file download capability.
   - FUR-011 / FUR-012: 사용자용 시스템의 MY 심사현황 검색 기능 개선 — improve MY review-status search for users.
   - FUR-013: 심사위원용 시스템의 MY 심사건 검색 기능 개선 및 건설기술활용실적 심사 통계 기능 개선 — improve reviewer MY-case search and review-statistics functionality.
   - FUR-014: 항목 클릭 시 자동 정렬 기능 — auto-sort on column/item click.
   - FUR-015: 건설기술활용실적 관리시스템 메인 화면 개선 — main screen redesign.
   - FUR-016: 건설기술활용실적 심사 수수료, 등록 수수료 입금 확인 화면 개선 — improve fee/payment confirmation screens.
   - FUR-017: 증명서 발급 기능 개선 — improve certificate issuance functionality.

   Additional explicit functional details (from the body text):
   - Simplify application review process and provide convenient upload/download of materials.
   - Automatic notifications (e.g., 알림톡) to customers about review progress, payment due, opinion-submission notices, long-nonresponse cases, and review results.
   - System-side creation/verification of opinion-submission notices and ability to view them when applicants resubmit corrected materials for re-review.
   - Internal approver (사업부서 책임자) approval workflow implemented in-system, with final approval document creation and dispatch functionality.
   - Admin functions: reviewer assignment per case, add administrators and manage permissions, admin-driven corporate info management (직권 관리), and admin capability to change company contact info to support password recovery.
   - User-targeted functionality to reduce civil complaints and improve customer satisfaction.
   - Search and statistics: build search fields and extraction for administrator reporting including classification (승인건의 분류), technical field, registration number, period (연월), company, 실적구분, validity/expiration, patent name, review stage, contracting agency (발주처), usage site, region, fee payment status, fee types (심사수수료, 등록수수료, 증명서 발급수수료), long-nonresponse cases, company name, amount, counts, and downloadable results.
   - UI redesign: distinct interfaces for 사업담당자, 기업담당자, and 심사위원; full main-page overhaul; visual, intuitive layout with priority placement of important evaluation info; clicking an application number shows full review process and current stage automatically.
   - Integration check with 조달청 나라장터 to enable 조회/열람 of approved utilization records when linked.
   - Login/logout clarity: auto-logout warning popup and login extension option for inactivity.
   - Data preservation for staff changes: features to preserve handover materials and data when project staff change.
   - Provide online manuals for users, admins, and reviewers; produce and distribute user/reviewer/enterprise manuals.

2) Performance requirements (PER codes):
   - PER-001: 성능 일반 (general performance).
   - PER-002: 평균 응답시간 (average response time requirement).
   - PER-003: 동시 사용자 접속 수 (concurrent user sessions requirement).
   - PER-004: 동시처리능력 (concurrent processing capability).
   - PER-005: 오류 응답시간 (error response time requirement).
   - PER-006: 배치성 업무 처리시간 (batch processing time requirement).
   - PER-007: 데이터 안정성 (data stability).
   - PER-008: CPU 사용률 (CPU usage constraints).

   (Also interface/performance related metric listed under PER-009 SIR-001: 메모리 사용률 및 시스템 인터페이스 일반.)

3) Interface requirements (SIR codes):
   - SIR-001 / PER-009: 메모리 사용률, 시스템 인터페이스 일반 — memory usage and general system interface requirements.
   - SIR-002: 시스템 웹표준, 소스코드 보안 적용 — adherence to web standards and source-code security practices.
   - SIR-003: 오류메시지 — standardized/error messages.
   - SIR-004: 기관 내 표준연계 모듈 사용 — use agency-standard integration modules.

4) Security requirements (SER codes and items):
   - SER-001: 보안규정 준수 — comply with security regulations.
   - SER-002: 인증 및 권한 — authentication and authorization controls.
   - SER-003: 데이터 보안 — data security.
   - SER-004: 네트워크 보안 — network security.
   - SER-005: 외부연동 보안 — security for external integrations.
   - SER-006: 감사 보안 — audit security.
   - SER-007: 누출금지정보 — protection of non-disclosure information.
   - SER-008: 특허청 보안성 검토 결과 이행 — implement security review results from the Patent Office.
   - SER-009: 보안확약서 — provide security assurance/commitment documents.

5) Quality, data and testing requirements:
   - Quality (QUR): QUR-001 품질 보증 기준, QUR-002 기능 구현 정확성, QUR-003 설치 및 제거 용이성, QUR-004 이해 용이성, QUR-005 신뢰성, QUR-006 품질관련 계획 수립 및 시행 — quality assurance criteria, implementation accuracy, ease of install/remove, understandability, reliability, and quality planning/execution.
   - Data (DAR): DAR-001 데이터 표준 준수, DAR-002 유연한 DB 구조 설계, DAR-003 테스트 데이터 운영 — adhere to data standards, design flexible DB schema, operate test data.
   - Testing (TER): TER-001 테스트 방안, TER-002 테스트 요구 일반사항, TER-003 단위테스트 요구 사항, TER-004 통합테스트 요구 사항 — test strategy, general test requirements, unit test requirements, integration test requirements.

6) Constraints (COR codes):
   - COR-001: 지식재산권 보호 — intellectual property protection.
   - COR-002: 용역의 작업 장소 상호협의, 작업장소 보안관리 — working place mutual agreement and workplace security management.
   - COR-003: 손해배상 책임 — liability for damages.
   - COR-004: 기술적용 계획 — technical application plan (technical 적용 계획 요구).
   - COR-005: 데이터 품질관리 — data quality management.
   - COR-006 / COR-007: SW 산출물 반출절차 — procedures for exporting SW deliverables.
   - COR-008: 웹호환성 표준 준수, 웹접근성 표준 준수 — comply with web compatibility and web accessibility standards.
   - COR-009: 개발언어 및 프레임워크 — specified development languages and frameworks (requirement to follow stated dev language/framework constraints).

7) Project management requirements (PMR codes):
   - PMR-001 프로젝트 관리 방법, PMR-002 산출물 관리, PMR-003 위험 및 이슈 관리, PMR-004 사업관리 요구사항, PMR-005 인력관리 요구사항, PMR-006 정기 및 비정기 보고, PMR-007 일정 관리, PMR-008 개발 소스프로그램, PMR-009 구축 방법론 — project management method, deliverable control, risk/issue management, business-management requirements, staffing management, regular/irregular reporting, schedule control, source code handling, and development methodology.

8) Project support / maintenance / training requirements (PSR codes and text):
   - PSR-001: 교육 훈련 — provide training and education.
   - PSR-002: (blank in table) but user manual is listed under project support requirements as a required deliverable — produce 사용자 매뉴얼 and distribute.
   - PSR-003: 하자보수 요건 — defect-fix/warranty requirements.
   - PSR-004: 안정화 활동 — stabilization activities post-deployment.
   - PSR-005: 기술지원 — technical support.
   - PSR-006: 유지관리 — maintenance.
   - PSR-007: 시스템 장애복구 — system disaster/recovery.
   - PSR-008: 저작권의 책임 — copyright responsibility.
   - PSR-009: 인수인계 — handover (인수인계) including 자료보존/인수인계 기능 and developing/distributing manuals for users, companies, and reviewers.

9) Deliverables / schedule and process items tied to requirements (from project body):
   - Deliver complete rebuilt user/admin/reviewer systems, documentation/manuals, training, testing, and completion reports (착수·중간·완료 보고).
   - Planned activities include requirements analysis, infrastructure confirmation, system reconstruction for user/admin/reviewer, manual development and distribution, completion and user training, and stabilization/maintenance periods per the schedule table.

This summary strictly compiles requirement codes and the explicit feature and constraint descriptions provided in the RFP text (notifications, approval workflow, reviewer assignment, full file-download, search/statistics fields, UI roles and behaviors, integration with 나라장터, certificate issuance improvements, login/logout/session behaviors, admin corporate info management, data/handover and manuals, plus the enumerated PER/SIR/SER/QUR/DAR/TER/COR/PMR/PSR items).

question: Summarize KHIDI's fair-trade, subcontracting, and contractual responsibility commitments and the contractor compliance obligations stated in the RFP, including the types of prohibited unfair acts under the Subcontracting Law and the anonymous reporting (Red Whistle) procedure.
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) KHIDI will define clear and detailed requirements to enable appropriate estimation of project cost and duration and will pay appropriate compensation accordingly. 2) KHIDI will secure an appropriate project execution period; if project content changes, KHIDI will sufficiently consult with the contractor and process changes through the 과업심의위원회 (task-review committee). 3) KHIDI will prioritize remote development where appropriate to provide a flexible working environment suited to information projects. 4) If project-period extensions or delivery delays occur for reasons not attributable to the contractor and additional work is required, KHIDI will mutually negotiate conditions and costs for the additional tasks. 5) KHIDI will not shift to the contractor responsibility or costs for administrative procedures, complaint resolution, or environment management that KHIDI must bear. 6) KHIDI will not excessively limit KHIDI's own liability nor excessively increase contractor liabilities (e.g., by disproportionately reducing KHIDI's indemnity or disproportionately increasing contractor's defect-liability obligations) beyond standards set by related laws and regulations. 7) KHIDI will not impose delay-penalties on the contractor exceeding levels set by national/local contract law. 8) If work is performed via subcontracting, the contractor must comply with the Subcontracting Law; violations of the Subcontracting Law that result in Fair Trade Commission sanctions may be referenced in future vendor selection. 9) To prevent withholding of subcontract payments or wages, KHIDI will ensure payment to subcontractors and labor costs either by the contractor making direct payments or by using a payment system that effects direct payment (e.g., 하도급 지키미). 10) KHIDI operates an online grievance/reporting center and an anonymous reporting system (Red Whistle) for reporting unfair treatment or legal violations by KHIDI staff; reporting routes are the KHIDI website (www.khidi.or.kr) and KHIDI Helpline (www.redwhistle.org); reports are handled confidentially, but reports with false or unclear reporter identity details cannot be processed; personal data are handled per the Personal Information Protection Act and are not used for purposes other than complaint handling. Additionally, the RFP explicitly notes (in the law-compliance checklist) that the 과업심의위원회 review and the possibility of requesting task changes are documented (see p.36). Prohibited unfair acts under the Subcontracting Law (as listed in the RFP) include: a) failure to provide a contract to the subcontractor, failure to pay subcontract payments within statutory periods, or failure to adjust subcontract payments proportionally when the prime contract payment is adjusted; b) imposing unfair transaction conditions (special terms), unjust determination or reduction of subcontract payments; c) unjust cancellation of consignment or unjust returns; d) improper demands for technical materials, misuse of technical materials, or technical appropriation; e) management interference or retaliatory acts against subcontractors.

question: What are the comprehensive technical, data, security, performance and maintenance requirements specified in the RFP that a bidder must satisfy when improving the 연차별 자율 품질관리 시스템 (STEP+) platform, including required system environment/software stack, mandatory standards/compliance, required functional modules to be implemented, and post-deployment support obligations?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) System environment and software stack: a) HW/Deployment: platform runs in cloud for WEB/WAS/DBMS. b) OS: Linux (CentOS) 7.9 for WEB/WAS/DBMS. c) DBMS: PostgreSQL 15.2. d) WEB/WAS: Apache 2.4 and Tomcat 9. e) Development language: Java 1.8. f) Framework: eGov (전자정부) standard framework 3.9.0. 2) Functional scope / modules to be developed or improved (system scope): a) Build/upgrade 연차별 자율 품질관리 diagnostic functions so childcare center staff can self-diagnose at organizational and individual levels; supplement existing 어린이집 조직진단(STEP+) functions and develop the 자율 평가지표진단 menu/features. b) Implement autonomous diagnosis participation and result data management (data capture, storage, accumulation). c) Build diagnostic-result-based tailored consulting operation: consulting application UI (user-centric, intuitive), consulting application processing, schedule management, consultant assignment/placement and consultant management, consulting report management. d) Admin features: consulting management (participation overview, application status, schedule management), consultant management (consultant list and placement), statistics and raw data (홈페이지 통계, 진단별 통계, 누적실시현황, 평균 점수, 로우데이터), alerts/materials management (공지사항, 이벤트, 이용가이드, FAQ), survey management, user management (회원관리, 관리자관리, 메뉴권한관리), homepage management (상단배너, 팝업 등). e) Web design, program development, content registration/modification and any new webpage design/development required by the client. f) Support for external system and DB integration. 3) Performance requirements (PER): a) PER-001: general performance requirements. b) PER-002: web page display time requirements. c) PER-003: homepage server environment optimization and maintenance. d) PER-004: error response time requirements. (Exact numeric targets are not listed in the provided excerpt; these items must be satisfied as specified in the RFP.) 4) Data requirements (DAR): a) DAR-001: establish data standards and comply with upper-level standards. b) DAR-002: comply with data-related laws and guidelines. c) DAR-003: comply with data standardization. d) DAR-004: satisfy specified data requirements. e) DAR-005: design data structures. f) DAR-006: validate data structure. g) DAR-007: provide data value validation methods. h) DAR-008: enable data openness and metadata management system. i) DAR-009: keep data management deliverables up to date. 5) Security requirements (SER): a) SER-001: comply with security guidelines. b) SER-002: personal information protection. c) SER-003: system security. d) SER-004: DB access rights control. e) SER-005: security management for participating personnel. f) SER-006: administrative security requirements. Additionally, the contractor must comply with the Ministry of the Interior and Safety's 'Software Development Security Guide' (행정안전부·한국인터넷진흥원). 6) Maintenance, operations and support obligations (MAR / related): a) MAR-001 / SFR-017: comply with government guidelines. b) MAR-002: provide regular/preventive inspection plans (정기점검(예방점검) 방안). c) MAR-003: provide maintenance management and other support execution conditions (유지보수 관리 및 기타 지원 수행조건). d) Provide ongoing development and maintenance including adoption of new technologies and government guideline-driven updates. e) Form a dedicated homepage development and maintenance organization (전문 인력의 기능 개발 및 유지보수 전담조직) and perform incident/危機 management for service outages. f) Provide emergency (비상근무) staffing and support when requested by the client. g) Provide technical support for external system/DB interfaces. 7) Operational and compliance constraints: a) All development environments and tools used by the homepage must be understood and supported by the contractor. b) The RFP items are minimums; the contractor must negotiate and implement additional improvements if necessary to meet the project's purpose. c) Administrator page access is restricted for security reasons; viewing may require a security non-disclosure/waiver per ‘행정기관 및 공공기관 정보시스템 구축·운영 지침’. d) Developers must follow the 행정안전부 '소프트웨어 개발보안 가이드'. 8) Quality, testing and error handling expectations: a) Fix errors and reflect other detailed requested corrections (오류사항 개선 등 기타 세부 요청사항 반영). b) Conduct system analysis, requirements analysis, design, implementation, system testing and corrections, and stabilization (system 가동 및 운영(안정화)) within the contract period. 9) Deliverables/process expectations: a) Provide all items necessary for smooth homepage operation including web design, program development, and content registration/editing. b) Support security evaluation, technical negotiation, development environment setup, and submit required project deliverables and implementation reports to the client. 10) Constraints explicitly called out: a) The project period is contract date + up to 4 months (120 days) and budget/VAT information are defined elsewhere in the RFP. (Note: Numeric performance targets or deeper numeric SLAs are referenced by PER identifiers but not enumerated in the provided excerpt.)

question: What are the security, data-protection, and regulatory-compliance requirements and related constraints that a system developer must satisfy for the '대학재정정보시스템 (기본재산 및 기채 사후관리) 고도화' project?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Apply the 전자정부 표준프레임워크 and comply with the SW 개발 보안가이드 throughout development. 2) Strengthen protection of 개인정보 및 민감정보 at every project stage (project planning, development, testing, operation). 3) Comply with the 개인정보보호법 (explicit constraint COR-003). 4) Implement 원격지 개발 보안 measures when development work is performed remotely (원격개발 허용 but security required). 5) Enforce 참여인원 보안관리 (security management for personnel involved). 6) Ensure 사무실 및 장비 보안관리 for physical workplace and equipment. 7) Prohibit 정보누출 (information leakage) and apply measures to prevent leaks (SER-002). 8) Perform 웹 보안 취약점 점검 (web vulnerability scanning) and remediate findings (SER-004). 9) Follow 시큐어코딩 가이드 준수 (secure coding) during implementation (SER-005). 10) Implement 기술적 보안 controls (SER-006) including monitoring and protective technical measures. 11) Apply 네트워크 통제 and 네트워크 구간 암호화 for network security (SER-014, SER-015/SER-016). 12) Secure 자료 구현 및 시험 관련 환경 and test data handling (SER-012). 13) Define and implement 사업 종료 시 보안 procedures for handover and retirement of systems/data (SER-013). 14) Meet 보안관리 공통사항 and overall 보안관리 requirements (SER-001, SER-011). 15) Ensure 데이터 관련 보안 and data governance by meeting data requirements: 명명규칙, 데이터 이관 요구사항, 데이터 표준 수립 및 관리 방안, 데이터 구조 설계·검증, 이관 데이터 값 검증, 데이터 관리체계 수립, 데이터 개방 및 메타데이터 관리체계 (DAR-001 ~ DAR-012). 16) Provide 인터페이스 보안 and protect 연계정보 when integrating with other systems (INR-001, INR-002). 17) Protect test and acceptance phases with secure testing practices (TER-001~TER-005) including security considerations in 단위/통합/성능/인수 테스트. 18) Comply with web standards and constraints: 웹 호환성 준수, 웹 접근성 준수, 웹 보안성 준수 (COR-004, COR-005, COR-006). 19) Do not specify 특정규격 that would favor a vendor (특정규격 명시 금지). 20) Guarantee 산출물 활용 보장 and 사전명시된 개발 SW 공동활용 (deliverable reuse and joint-use declaration). 21) Observe 하자담보 책임기간 및 범위 (warranty/defect liability period and scope). 22) Follow 하도급 rules: 하도급 허용 but 재하도급 불허. 23) Respect procurement-related constraints affecting security/compliance: 투입인력 요구 및 관리 금지 (no mandatory staffing-management requirements), SW 사업 영향평가 및 SW 사업정보 제출 (impact assessment and submission of project information). 24) Implement 일반 보안·품질 통제 (품질/보안관리 방안 QUR-001~QUR-005 and related SER items) including configuration/형상관리, 하자보수 방안 and 운영적 보안 activities. 25) Apply monitoring/performance controls relevant to security operations (PER-007 CPU monitoring, PER-008 memory) and implement 사전 경고 및 응답시간 관리 for availability/security-related performance (PER-005, PER-002~PER-004).

question: What are the specific technical, functional, organizational and evaluation requirements and constraints for designing and implementing a simplified EMR platform that automatically links patient history and integrates with the national DHIS2 system, as specified in the RFP?
ground_truth: The RFP specifies the following requirements and constraints for an EMR-DHIS2 solution, organized by topic: 1) Functional requirements: 1.1. Build an EMR platform that is simple, user-friendly and streamlined for basic patient management at regional/primary care facilities. 1.2. Ensure automatic linkage of patient history so that patient longitudinal records are maintained and accessible. 1.3. Support integrated management where the EMR can be linked to DHIS2 (the national health statistics system) for aggregated/statistical reporting. 1.4. Provide operational workflows and clinical support functions appropriate to regional public health institutions (drawing on PHIS domain coverage such as health programs, health administration, EMR and clinical support). 2) Data, standards and prerequisite work: 2.1. Conduct code standardization prior to or as part of implementation: basic patient management requires prior harmonization of codes. 2.2. Account for DHIS2’s current characteristics: DHIS2 is used as a national health statistics system and currently does not contain unique IDs or personal identifying information (it stores statistical data only). Integration designs must therefore address how to reconcile EMR personal-level data with DHIS2’s statistic-only model. 2.3. Assess existing local EMR deployments (EMR introduced in 5 provinces with ADB support) and plan data/operational interoperability or migration strategies. 3) Technical and infrastructure considerations: 3.1. Assess local ICT infrastructure and constraints (internet and broadband availability, telephony, PC counts, service costs, facility equipment and utilities, ICT human resources and procurement/maintenance capabilities). 3.2. Choose technologies and an implementation approach that the recipient country can sustain after ODA support ends (including appropriate technology complexity and consideration of local capacity). 4) Organizational, capacity-building and operational requirements: 4.1. Provide training and capacity building for operating personnel (operational staff training and skills transfer). 4.2. Support standardization work (health information standards and coding) and strengthen local governance/management for routine operations. 4.3. Propose an implementation organization and staffing plan (project management, roles, and staffing profile) and avoid mid-project changes to key personnel without approval. 5) Feasibility, evaluation and sustainability requirements: 5.1. Conduct a comprehensive feasibility analysis covering policy, economic (cost–benefit), technical, socio-cultural, environmental and sustainability dimensions. 5.2. Evaluate recipient country technical absorption capacity and local willingness to implement and sustain the system. 5.3. Include risk analysis and mitigation measures and propose monitoring and evaluation mechanisms (PDM, performance indicators, monitoring tools). 6) Stakeholder engagement and coordination: 6.1. Undertake stakeholder mapping and interviews with domestic and local actors (Ministry of Health units such as CHSI, development partners, embassies, KOFIH, KOICA, WHO, ADB, national and regional hospitals, health centers and, where needed, community representatives). 6.2. Verify existing or overlapping donor projects and identify opportunities for reuse/coordination with other donors’ systems. 7) Deliverables and compliance items related to implementation support: 7.1. Produce English-language outputs for sharing with Lao counterparts and overseas posts (trip reports, feasibility study, final reports). 7.2. Support preparation/receipt of the partner country project (PCP) and draft a Free Aid (grant) implementation plan as requested. 7.3. Collect and incorporate environmental, social and climate screening inputs (receive and use screening questionnaire) into planning. 8) Contractual/scheduling constraint: 8.1. The study and deliverables are planned within a short project window; the RFP notes a 90-day contract period but indicates that, because the PCP and related actions are planned for March–May 2025, some tasks may need completion after the formal contract period. 9) Non-functional and policy alignment constraints: 9.1. Align the project with Lao national Digital Health Strategy (2023–2027), national laws/regulations and relevant donor/partner strategies and with Korea’s international cooperation strategies (CPS/K-Health context). 9.2. Ensure solution design and recommendations consider interoperability, sustainability, and the need for minimal complexity to match local workflows and capacity. These items must be reflected in the workplan: country assessment (legal/policy, ICT and health system baseline), stakeholder interviews, feasibility analyses (policy/economic/technical/socio-cultural/environmental), implementation plan with budgets and schedules, risk/monitoring frameworks, PCP and Free Aid plan support, English deliverables, and operational training/standardization activities.

question: RFP에 명시된 '산단안전정보시스템 1차 구축 용역사업'의 기술적·기능적 요구사항, 데이터 연계·통합 요구사항, 인프라(하드웨어·소프트웨어) 요구사항, 보안·운영 관련 요구사항 및 비기능적 요구사항을 모두 요약해 달라. (각 항목을 구체적으로 나열할 것)
ground_truth:
요구사항 요약: 

1) 기능적 요구사항(상황관리 시스템)
  1.1 상황알림
    - NDMS 연계를 통해 실시간 사고발생 상황 모니터링
    - 사고발생정보 접수 시 관할 산단 자동 식별
    - 관할 산단 사고발생 시 자동알림 제공
  1.2 대응·조치 관리
    - 관할 산단 사고 접수처리 기능
    - 연관정보 검색과 연계된 현장영상·상황전파 등 실시간 공유정보로 상황파악 및 조치 지원
    - 대응·조치 정보의 저장 및 관리 기능
  1.3 보고·전파
    - 파악된 정보를 바탕으로 상황보고서 작성 지원
    - 등록된 보고 및 전파대상자에 대한 상황보고·전파 서비스 제공
  1.4 연관정보 자동검색(정보검색)
    - 사고발생 산단 및 기업정보, 언론보도 등 사고 연관정보를 자동 검색하여 제공
  1.5 현황관리
    - 접수된 사고·피해·대응·조치 정보를 기반으로 기간별 사고현황 및 상세 사고이력 관리
    - 상황판을 통한 현황표시 기능 제공

2) GIS(지도) 관련 요구사항
  2.1 관할식별 자동화
    - 사고정보와 연동하여 사고현장 인근의 산단 및 입주기업 정보를 지도에 자동 표시
  2.2 지도기반 정보검색
    - 산단·입주기업, 인근시설, 기관, 위험물, 유해화학물 등 사고 연관정보의 검색·조회 기능
  2.3 공간정보 관리체계
    - 한국산업단지공단 보유 지도 및 타기관 연계지도 데이터의 융복합 활용 지원

3) 관리자(사용자·권한) 시스템 요구사항
  3.1 사용자 접근권한 요청 처리 기능 제공
  3.2 상황보고 및 전파 대상자, 전파방식 등 상황관리 업무에 필요한 환경설정 서비스 제공

4) 데이터 연계·통합 요구사항
  4.1 연계 대상(문서에 명시된 항목)
    - 1) NDMS(행안부): 사고신고, 대응정보 — 실시간 — 연계방식: ESB, API
    - 2) CARIS(환경부): 화학사고 신고, 대응정보 — 실시간(연계대상 단일화 가능) — 연계방식: ESB, API
    - 3) 119 현장지원 시스템(소방청): 출동대정보, 원페이지 브리핑정보, 관할지역 등 — 실시간(연계대상 단일화 가능) — 연계방식: API
    - 4) 화학재난통합 대응시스템(소방청): 화학물질정보, 현장대응정보 — 실시간(연계대상 단일화 가능) — 연계방식: API
    - 5) 현장영상 공유시스템(소방청): 소방차량 영상정보 — 실시간 — 연계방식: API
    - 6) 국가공간정보 포털시스템(국토부): 배경지도, 연속지적도, 도로명주소, 국가관심지역 등 — 배치 — 연계방식: API
    - 7) 기상정보포털(기상청): 기상관측정보, 특/경보정보 등 — 실시간 — 연계방식: API
    - 8) 공장설립 지원시스템(발주처): 기업·산단정보, 사고이력, 유해화학물 취급정보 등 — 배치 — 연계방식: ESB
    - 9) 경영정보시스템(발주처): 안전관리활동정보 등 — 배치 — 연계방식: ESB
  4.2 연계 방식 및 제약
    - 연계방식은 기관 협의를 통해 변경 가능
    - 행정정보공동이용센터를 통한 연계를 우선 추진
    - 일부 연계대상은 단일화(연계대상 단일화) 가능
  4.3 데이터 관리
    - 연계된 데이터가 상황관리시스템에서 활용되도록 자체 데이터 관리체계에 따른 통합관리 지원
    - 지속가능한 데이터 연계·활용 및 품질·서비스 성능 유지 위한 통합관리체계 구축 요구

5) 인프라(하드웨어·소프트웨어·네트워크) 요구사항
  5.1 하드웨어·네트워크
    - 서버 6대, 스토리지 1대 및 네트워크 구성을 위한 장비
    - 상황실 상황관리용 대형 디스플레이
    - 그 외 상황관리시스템 운영에 필요한 인프라 장비
  5.2 보안 장비·로깅
    - DDOS 방어 장비, 방화벽 등 보안 장비 및 통합로그 소프트웨어
  5.3 필수 소프트웨어
    - DBMS, GIS 소프트웨어, DB 암호화 소프트웨어 등

6) 비기능적(성능·운영·유지보수) 요구사항
  6.1 실시간성
    - NDMS, 소방청, 기상청 등과의 실시간 연계를 통한 신속한 사고상황 파악 및 대응지원
  6.2 데이터 품질·서비스 성능
    - 지속가능한 데이터 연계·활용과 품질 및 서비스 성능 유지
  6.3 현황판·대시보드
    - 상황판을 통한 현황표시 및 통계 관리를 지원
  6.4 운영 효율성
    - 신고접수부터 보고·전파에 이르는 업무프로세스 정보화로 이력의 체계적 관리 및 업무효율성 개선

7) 보안·준수·법적 요구사항
  7.1 보안 준수
    - 제안서 제출 및 사업 수행 중 발생하는 모든 사안에 대해 보안 유지
    - 제안참가 업체는 제안 관련 사항을 타 업체 또는 외부기관에 공개 금지
    - 사업 수행 중 취득한 발주기관의 정보통신 보안사항에 대해 보안 유지
  7.2 책임
    - 내부자료 유출 등 문제 발생 시 수행업체가 모든 민·형사상 책임 부담
  7.3 별첨 준수사항
    - 별첨(사업자 보안관리 준수사항, 제안사 정보보안 관련 서류 등)에 따른 보안 관련 제출·준수 요구

8) 산출물·계약·유지 관련 요구사항
  8.1 하자담보책임
    - 납품한 모든 장비의 하자담보책임기간은 발주기관이 검사에 의해 사업의 완성을 확인한 후 ‘년간’으로 명시(문서상 표기: “년간”, 구체적 연수는 문서에 표기되지 않음)
  8.2 별첨 관련 요구
    - 소프트웨어 사업 영향평가 및 소프트웨어 개발사업 적정 사업기간 산정 관련 별첨을 참고 및 준수
  8.3 제안 범위
    - 제안요청서에 기술되지 않았으나 사업 추진에 필수적이라고 판단되는 사항은 제안범위에 포함하여 제안할 것

9) 기타 운영·추진 관련 요구사항
  9.1 추진체계
    - 사업총괄(안전총괄팀), 업무협조(정보전략팀, 재난안전데이터 보유기관), 사업수행(용역수행 계약업체) 역할 명시
  9.2 일정
    - 환경분석/설계 → 응용프로그램 개발·데이터 연계 구축·인프라 구축 → 테스트 및 보완·홍보·교육 → 종료 (세부 일정은 수행기관 등과 협의하여 조정)

참고사항(문서상의 제한 및 변경 가능성)
  - 연계 대상 및 연계방식은 발주처 및 보유기관 상황에 따라 일부 변경 가능
  - 시스템별 연계방식은 기관협의를 통해 변경될 수 있음
  - 행정정보공동이용센터를 통한 연계를 우선 추진하되, 불가 시 대체방안 협의

(위 요약은 제안요청서 본문 및 별첨에서 명시된 요구사항을 문서에 기술된 내용만으로 정리한 것임)

question: What are the comprehensive technical, hardware/software, testing, delivery, maintenance, and training requirements that bidders must satisfy for the RFID-based national qualification exam results smart management system as described in the RFP?
ground_truth: The requirements include: 1) Functional objectives and workflow: a) Build an RFID-based management system to track exam result items (answer sheets, works) by 권별 during in/out so changes are immediately recognized; b) Load exam-result DB (Excel extracted from the 공단 system: 시험 년월일/부·자격명/결과물(필답, 작업형, 동영상)/지부(사)명/시험장소/시험실/종목명) from an internet network into the system, print tags and attach them to items after the exam, then read tags in pouches to verify by branch, test site, room, subject and detect missing 권별 to improve speed and accuracy. 2) Hardware components and quantities (1st phase pilot for 3 institutions — Seoul 2 sites, Ulsan 1 site): a) RFID fixed readers: 3 EA; b) RFID mobile readers: 3 EA; c) Reader controller (including data-collection solution): 3 sets; d) Antennas: 12 EA; e) Control boxes: 3 EA; f) RFID printers: 2 EA; g) RFID tags: 2,400 EA; h) Printer ribbons (발행기 리본): 2 sets. 3) Software components and platforms: a) Custom web-based operating software (1); b) Android mobile software (1) supporting smartphones and tablet PCs; c) Windows-based data collection SW solution for integration and data collection; d) Integrated platform to manage exam-result items. 4) System integration & deployment scope: a) Pilot deployment in 3 institutions (Seoul 2 / Ulsan 1); b) System build then pilot test followed by phased H/W rollout to all affiliated institutions. 5) Testing requirements: a) Unit tests for each IoT(RFID) device using predefined input data and analysis of result values; b) Integration tests checking data flow between IoT(RFID) devices and handling of fault conditions; c) System tests measuring performance of IoT(RFID) devices. 6) Delivery and acceptance requirements: a) Delivery completion defined by installation, performance testing, and acceptance (검수) by the 발주자 and final approval by the supervisor; b) Deliverables must include developed software with source code installed on delivered hardware (운영소프트웨어 포함 소스코드 제출); c) Delivery locations: 공단 designated places (서울지역본부, 울산지사, 국가자격채점센터); d) RFID tag attachment and physical verification sampling may be performed by the 공단 and contractor must remediate if requested. 7) Warranty, maintenance and liability: a) Defect liability period: 12 months; b) Contractor must submit related defect performance insurance policy; c) During warranty, faults or damage not caused by the 발주자의 willful or gross negligence must be repaired or replaced by the contractor at their expense. 8) Support, documentation and training: a) Provide IoT(RFID) technical support and aftercare/operation management; b) Provide operator training; c) Deliver guidelines and documentation covering environment analysis, system configuration, standardization, RFID application procedures, system analysis/design, build/install methods, user manuals, operation procedures and strategies. 9) Included costs and responsibilities: a) All costs for network, electrical/power, or floor facility works required for installation and construction are included in the project budget; b) Costs to produce and manage digital user manuals, operator guides and other deliverables are included; c) All expenses required until inspection completion for delivered equipment are included in the project. 10) Project duration and procurement: a) Project period from contract date is 90 days (3 months) with staged tasks (preliminary survey and IoT(RFID) design, review of IoT(RFID) plan, solution adoption and environment construction, equipment procurement and build, etc.); b) Procurement method: limited competitive bidding and selection by negotiated contract.

question: What are the consolidated functional and non-functional requirements, constraints, and post‑deployment obligations for developing and deploying the '차세대나라장터 연계 모듈' and the associated internal purchasing/procurement system modifications, including requirements for development environment, data migration, performance monitoring, error/attachment handling, deployment/stabilization, and maintenance responsibilities?
ground_truth: The requirements and constraints include: 1) Integration module scope and functionality: design and develop a new 차세대나라장터 연계 모듈 per the 차세대나라장터 연계 가이드; discover and develop additional required electronic document types through analysis (송·수신·조회·배치 등); implement features derived from existing 연계 전자문서 and 업무담당자 요구사항. 2) Non‑impactful development: conduct development without affecting 실데이터 (develop in a way that has no impact on real production data). 3) Development environment support: 조달청 may provide a development server for integration with 조달청 (조달청과 연계된 개발용 서버 지원 가능). 4) Internal system modifications: analyze and, where necessary, modify internal 구매조달시스템 functions and existing 자체 인터페이스 프로그램; plan and implement 개선 작업 및 기능 고도화 to apply changed/new documents and changed 연계 항목; determine menus to which 연계로직 will be applied (counts subject to analysis/design). 5) Data migration / transfer: perform 이관작업 for existing 연계데이터 and 전자문서 to meet 차세대나라장터 연계인터페이스 기준. 6) Attachment handling: derive and apply a 안정적 관리 방안 for attachments included in 연계 문서. 7) Error handling and operational guidance: identify past 연계 오류/불편사항, propose and implement measures to prevent recurrence; provide 후속 처리 방안 or operational guide when 연계 오류 발생; apply handling capabilities into the new module where feasible. 8) Stability and post‑go‑live obligations: 반드시 perform stabilization after 차세대나라장터 개통 and establish an immediate issue‑response 체계; stabilization support is mandatory for at least '최소 개월 이상' as stated (specific number not provided in document). 9) Performance monitoring and support cost responsibility: monitor system performance during development/operation using logs or tooling to detect issues early; if additional 엔지니어 기술지원 is required beyond the institute's contracted maintenance scope and costs arise, the 사업자 (vendor) must bear those costs. 10) Quality attributes and standards: implement UI/UX and technical delivery with cross‑browser support, web accessibility and web compatibility compliance, and apply modern open standard web technologies to ensure maintainability and extensibility; implement atop the purchaser's specified framework. 11) Change management and schedule flexibility: when 조달청 차세대나라장터 개통시기 changes, contract period can be adjusted by agreement; the number of 연계 전자문서 and menus may be increased or decreased according to analysis/design. 12) Deliverables and traceability: produce 산출물 per the 프로젝트관리요구사항 산출물목록 (referenced for required outputs) and document related requirements and associations (관련요구사항). 13) Issue avoidance and impact management: identify areas impacted by new module development and prepare 대응체계 to prevent issues in those zones during rollout.

question: Summarize the required system architecture, hardware, software stack, and integration points that the proposed EIP3.0 고압가스 안전관리 시스템 must comply with, based on the RFP.
ground_truth: The RFP requires the proposed high‑pressure gas safety management system to conform to the existing EIP3.0 업무포털 종합정보시스템 environment and to integrate with the listed hardware, software, and external systems. Specific requirements and environment details derived from the RFP are: 1) Target system/context: It must be implemented as part of the KITECH EIP3.0 integrated information portal (EIP 시스템/업무포털 종합정보시스템) and interoperate with portal modules (homepage/SNS, 기업지원시스템, 연구관리시스템, 지능형 포털, 메일(두레이), 협업공간, 경영전략시스템, 등). 2) Hardware (H/W) baseline: The system must operate within the existing server landscape: - WAS운영서버1: IBM E950, 4 CPU, 101 GB memory (installed 2020) - WAS운영서버2: IBM E850, 4 CPU, 128 GB memory (2015) - 개발서버: IBM P570, 4 CPU, 15 GB memory (2007) - SSO/LDAP 서버: HP DL380 G10, 8 CPU, 16 GB memory (2020) - SSO/LDAP 서버: HP DL360 G10, 8 CPU, 16 GB memory (2020) - DB서버1: IBM E950, 4 CPU, 128 GB memory (2020) - DB서버2: IBM E850, 4 CPU, 120 GB memory (2015) 3) Core software stack and versions (existing components to integrate with): - WAS: IBM WebSphere 8.5.5 (installed 2014) - Framework/UI: Proworks, Websquare (인스웨이브) (2022) / EIP3.0 지능형 포털 (프레임워크: Proworks5) (2022) - DBMS: Informix 12.10 (IBM) (2011) - Reporting: OZ report (포시에스) (2017) - User management: yullin-Idap (2020) - Charting: rMateChart (리트모아소프트) (2011) - Integrated search: ProSearch (프로텐) (2022) - Intelligent platform / 검색·추천: D-플랫폼 (다이퀘스트), Mariner3 (다이퀘스트) (2022) - SSO / 인증관리: KsignCASE for Web; KSignAccess for SSO Server/Agent (2011) - 전자결재: FlowControl BPM (플로우컨트롤) (2022) - DB 모델링: DA# (엔코아) (2011) - Application monitoring: JENNIFER5 (제니퍼) (2014) - PDF 변환 및 뷰어: PDF GateWay (ePapyrus) + StreamDocs (ePapyrus) (2017) - 형상관리: ChangeFlow (지티원) (2022) - 문서뷰어: 사이냅 문서뷰어 (2022) - 문서유통: 엑스클릭 (비즈웰) (2021) - 규정/원규관리: 규정관리 시스템 (엠텐) (2022) - 모바일앱: Mthink (데이터뱅크) (2022) (and other listed tools/components) 4) Software architecture elements: The RFP shows an application architecture that includes DBMS (Informix), Web Application Server (IBM WebSphere), server frameworks (Proworks/F/W, WebSquare5), portal/search/recommendation modules, D-Platform/Mariner IPMS components, Spring application model, and application artifacts (JSPs, Transactions, MyBatis, ProQG2B). The solution must align with this software architecture. 5) Authentication/authorization and SSO: The environment includes SSO/LDAP servers (HP DL380/360) and SSO components (KSignAccess/KsignCASE), so the new system must integrate with existing SSO/LDAP and 인증관리 infrastructure. 6) Integration points and external linkages: The EIP integrates with many external services and agencies (e.g., 국가연구사업, 기업은행, 나라장터(조달청), 카드사, 전자세금계산서, 국세청, NTIS, 특허사무소 포털, 등). The new system must support required 연동 (external기관연동) and data exchange with these services and with internal modules like 자산관리, 구매조달, 전자증빙, 연구관리, RPA/업무자동화, 문서유통. 7) Non‑functional/operational constraints implicit from environment: The system must operate on the stated hardware capacities and within the listed software versions/platforms (i.e., WebSphere 8.5.5, Informix 12.10, Proworks/WebSquare frameworks, D‑Platform/Mariner components). 8) Monitoring, reporting and UI expectations: Must tie into existing monitoring (JENNIFER5), reporting (OZ report), charting (rMateChart), PDF generation/viewing (PDF GateWay/StreamDocs), and UI frameworks (WebSquare) used by the portal. 9) Development/management tools: Source/version control and configuration management use ChangeFlow (2022) and DB modeling uses DA#; the proposal must accommodate these tools. 10) Implementation requirement (scope alignment): The system scope described elsewhere (manage chemical/hazardous gas inventory and vendor data, purchase → safety review workflow, legal compliance management, disposal/recall management, and statistics for chemical operations) must be realized within this existing EIP3.0 technical environment and integrate with the above H/W, SW, SSO, external interfaces, and platform components.

question: Summarize all security, intellectual-property, and secure-development obligations the contractor must meet during development, deployment, and post-deployment of the CMS upgrade. Include required approvals and documents, secure-coding and vulnerability-scanning requirements, software-licensing obligations, access-control and personnel-security measures, data-classification/printing rules, required deliverables before deployment, remote-development constraints, and consequences for information leakage.
ground_truth: The obligations include: 1) Legal and regulatory compliance: contractor must comply with all government security laws, K-water security regulations, and related rules; contractor bears full responsibility for any noncompliance and resulting damages. 2) Development-tool approval: contractor must submit the list of all development tools to the supervisor (감독원) and use only those approved by the supervisor. 3) Intellectual property and third‑party rights: ownership of deliverables follows (계약예규) '용역계약일반조건' 제56조 (principle of joint ownership) with details to be negotiated; if third‑party patents or IP are used, contractor must ensure usage rights for K-water and submit proof (content certification) to K-water. 4) Genuine software and licensing: all software used by project staff must be legitimate; contractor must maintain per‑person software lists and licenses, perform periodic checks, and submit results to the supervisor; contractor is fully liable (civil/criminal) for any illegal software use. 5) Secure coding standards: contractor must develop according to government guidelines—'소프트웨어 개발보안 가이드' and language‑specific secure‑coding guides (Java, C, mobile). 6) Continuous vulnerability diagnostics: contractor must use K-water provided diagnostic programs to detect and remove security weaknesses during development and continuously perform remediation. 7) Mandatory security checklists and pre‑deployment verification: upon project completion the contractor must submit '시큐어코딩 보안약점 확인 점검표 (별지 제8호 서식)' and '웹 보안약점 확인 점검표 (별지 제9호 서식)'; operating server deployment is only allowed after diagnostic tool reports show no outstanding issues. 8) Data security design and post‑deployment protections: contractor must propose and implement measures preventing data leakage by users not authorized by the system; propose concrete data‑security measures for the implemented system. 9) Personnel security and access control: submit security oath (보안서약서) for every deployed person, strictly manage physical access badges and entry control; contractor is responsible for failures in access control. 10) Data confidentiality, classification, and publication controls: classify deliverables by confidentiality with the supervisor; external publication of confidential materials must use government‑approved secret‑document publishing vendors with supervisor oversight (including recovery and destruction of originals/waste). 11) Handling and disposal of acquired materials: contractor must not disclose project materials during or after the project without K-water prior consent; on project completion contractor must return or fully destroy materials as required. 12) Remote development rule: when performing work remotely, contractor must follow the '원격지 개발사업관리 가이드' of the Korea National Information Society Agency. 13) Warranty and technical transfer: during the 1‑year free defect‑repair period after completion contractor must immediately fix defects, support technical handover, and obtain supervisor approval for remediation results. 14) Reporting and documentary obligations for security: contractor must document and retain records of communications, supervisor instructions, corrective actions, and make them available on demand. 15) Consequences for information leakage and disqualifications: if protected items are leaked (including, but not limited to: 1) internal/external IP address inventories, 2) detailed information‑system configurations and network diagrams, 3) user accounts/passwords and access rights, 4) vulnerability analysis/assessment outputs, 5) information‑technology deliverables and program source code for information projects, 6) national security/protection system adoption status, 7) IPS/IDS/product configuration details, 8) internal documents classified as non‑disclosable under the Public Information Act, 9) personal data under the Personal Information Protection Act, 10) secrets (비밀) per security regulations, 11) any other materials K-water president deems non‑disclosable), the contractor will be registered as a debarred/unqualified bidder (부정당업자) per referenced laws and bear all resulting liabilities. 16) Liability for security incidents: contractor must indemnify and compensate K-water for damages from information leakage or security incidents caused by contractor personnel or processes.

question: What contractual intellectual-property, security, and remote-development requirements and constraints does the RFP impose on the contractor for the software developed under the '수도사업장 통합 사고분석솔루션 시범구축 용역' project?
ground_truth: The RFP imposes the following requirements and constraints: 1) IP Ownership and Purpose: the software developed under this contract is designated as software to operate and manage nationally designated major information and communications infrastructure (per 정보통신기반 보호법) and, taking into account national security, the intellectual property rights (including copyrights) in the contract deliverables belong to the client (에) according to the standard service-contract clauses. 2) No Commercial Exploitation: the contractor is explicitly prohibited from any commercial use, reproduction, distribution, modification, transmission, or monetization of the contract deliverables; any violation incurs legal responsibility on the contractor. 3) Source Delivery Requirement: the contractor must submit the contract deliverables' software source code and original files in an unencrypted, modifiable state (i.e., not encrypted and editable). 4) Patent Rights: patent rights arising from the contract deliverables are similarly assigned to the client under the contract general conditions; infringement exposes the contractor to legal liability. 5) Joint-use Statement: the RFP states there is no plan for joint-use of the developed software with other agencies under the specified contract clauses; (the document also contains wording that may indicate possible joint-use after completion with a designated agency). 6) Confidentiality and Security Compliance: the contractor must not disclose or provide obtained data/information externally, must strictly comply with security requirements demanded by the client, and submitted proposal materials and all performance outputs belong to and are owned by the client. 7) Remote Development Security: if the proposer suggests remote (off-site) development locations, those sites must comply with the client's remote security requirements; the proposer must describe concrete remote-security management measures including participating personnel, remote development locations and equipment (e.g., laptops, portable storage media), network and data handling, and other protections. The client may reject proposed remote sites that fail to meet security requirements. 8) Worksite Allocation for Personnel: the client will provide the primary workplace required for the task; the proposer must supply other equipment/environment. Support (non-development) personnel may be located by the proposer except in cases requiring special security reasons. 9) Submission and Provenance Requirements: personnel who will participate in the project must already have been employed (in service) prior to the bid-publication date to be recognized; all proposal statements must be supported by objective evidence documents, and falsehoods may result in exclusion or contract termination. 10) Legal/Contractual References: these constraints are enforced under the Information and Communications Infrastructure Protection Act, the contract-general-conditions articles referenced in the RFP, and related software-contract and management guidance cited in the document.

question: For project reporting and deliverables, what exactly must the contractor produce and submit (contents, formats, timelines, approval processes), and what system-usage, coordination, and contingency rules apply for the following: 착수신고서 and its supporting documents, 계약문서 사본, 상위계획 부합·연계성 검토, 월간진도보고, 중간보고, and 타당성조사 초기보고서 (two-stage)?
ground_truth:
The requirements include: 
1) 착수신고서 (Start Report) and attached documents:
   - Required documents to be included (explicit list):
     ① 착수신고서 (별지 제1호 서식)
     ② 사업수행계획서
     ③ 인력(장비)투입계획서
     ④ 세부공정계획서
     ⑤ 단위과업별 성과품 제출계획서
     ⑥ 사업책임기술자선임신고서 (별지 제2호 서식)
     ⑦ 사업수행조직표
     ⑧ 건설기술 경력사항 확인서
     ⑨ 참여기술자 인적사항, 참여과업내용 및 참여예상기간 (별지 제3호 서식)
     ⑩ 참여기술자의 보안각서 (별지 제4호 서식)
   - Submission format/quantity: 제출 5부를 감독원에게 제출하여 승인받아야 함.
   - Approval timing: 감독원은 착수신고서 접수일로부터 10일 이내에 승인여부를 계약상대자에게 통보해야 함.

2) 계약문서의 사본 제출:
   - When submitting the 착수신고서, the contractor must also submit a combined set (합본) of contract documents including: 계약서, 현장대리인 신고서, 참여기술자 목록, 공정표, 인력투입계획서, 산출내역서 등을 감독원에게 제출.

3) 상위계획과의 부합 및 연계성 검토 보고:
   - Scope: 검토 대상 예시로 “국가수도기본계획(`22.10)”, 지자체 수도정비기본계획, “용인 첨단시스템반도체 국가산단 용수공급사업 기본구상(`23.10)” 등 이전단계 조사결과 포함하여 검토.
   - Timing: 착수일로부터 20일 이내에 감독원에게 검토보고서 제출.

4) 월간진도보고 (Monthly Progress Report):
   - Timing/Submission: 매월 말일을 기준으로 작성하여 다음달 5일까지 사업책임기술자의 확인을 받아 감독원에게 제출.
   - Mandatory contents (must include):
     (1) 과업추진내용 및 공정현황
     (2) 각종 도서수발현황 (승인사항 포함)
     (3) 과업수행상 중요 문제점 및 대책
     (4) 참여기술자 현황
     (5) 다음달 과업수행 계획
   - Certification: 보고서는 사업책임기술자의 확인이 필요.

5) 중간보고 (Interim Reports / Presentations):
   - Trigger conditions (any of the following require 자료제출 및 설명):
     (1) 주요 단계별 과업이 종료되었을 때
     (2) 과업기간 중 2회 이상의 중간보고시 (즉, 복수의 중간보고 일정이 있을 때)
     (3) 주요계획 및 방침의 설정과 변경시
   - Requirements: 관련자료 제출 및 사업책임기술자 혹은 분야별 책임기술자가 설명토록 해야 함. 감독원의 지시사항(구두 및 서면지시 포함)에 대해 성실히 수행하고 조치결과를 서면으로 제출해야 함.

6) 타당성조사 초기보고서 (Feasibility Study Initial Reports) — two-stage:
   - Number & timing:
     • 1단계 초기보고서: 착수일로부터 3개월 이내 제출
     • 2단계 초기보고서: 착수일로부터 9개월 이내 제출
     (단, 사업 추진 일정 변동 시 제출기한은 변동될 수 있으며 감독원의 요구기일에 따라야 함.)
   - Required contents (each 초기보고서 must include the following and follow 상세지침 in 특별과업지시서):
     ① 자료 수집 및 기초 현황 조사
     ② 현지 조사
     ③ 취수원 선정
     ④ 용수수급전망 및 용수공급계획
     ⑤ 주요시설물계획
     ⑥ 타당성 평가
     ⑦ 사업집행방안 검토(기본계획(안))
     ⑧ 기타 감독원이 요구하는 사항
   - Incomplete field-survey contingency: 현지조사 일정·소요기간으로 인해 초기보고서 제출시까지 현지조사 분석 결과 도출이 어려운 경우, 감독원과 협의하여 조사계획 부분 및 진행 결과를 수록할 수 있음.

7) 민원·인허가 및 관계기관 협의·지원:
   - The contractor must carry out 민원 및 대관 인·허가 업무 to avoid complaints or administrative actions.
   - Must support K-water in 주민·이해당사자 의견수렴 및 관계기관 협의 and, if requested by K-water, perform or even take over required tasks. For items needing local government coordination (facility scale, water allocation, local waterworks status/plans, pipeline routing, permits), the contractor must conduct consultations and propose appropriate measures based on results.

8) 계약자통합정보시스템 (수자원CTS) usage requirements:
   - All electronic submissions for 착공, 기성, 공정보고 등 must be made via 수자원CTS using the system's registered standard forms.
   - The contractor must master CTS usage, prepare necessary computer/network resources, and perform submissions, reports, and approval requests electronically through CTS to minimize paper documents.

Notes on approvals and disputes:
   - Supervisory approvals (감독원) are required for many items; approval timelines are specified for 착수신고서 (10 days). For other submissions, the contractor must follow 감독원 requests and timelines. If supervisory directions are challenged (e.g., 부당한 지시), the contractor may raise objections as provided elsewhere in the contract.
